Beautiful cascadas in Tamanique.
You can park here in the center and you have to search for the police in blue t-shirt. They take care of your car and tell you where to park. To go to the cascadas you have to take a guide. It's 5$ per person but we negotiate for 5$ per 2. The hike to go is about 20min and could be hard if you are not used to steep.

name: cascade tamanique
description: 4 beautiful waterfall. just park at the municipal park and call Freddy 7568 6601to guide you for 5$ per person. being a pack lunch and have a relaxing day. steep decent to the bottom with a cable to help you come back up, really worth it and cooler than the beach

name: Mirador Esperitu de la Montaña
description:
Beautiful mirador next to Volcan Conchagua. The place is owned by Luis, a local who made this place so beautiful. A restaurant and cabanas will soon open at the top with everything ecological. 
Directions: 
- you can go on your own but the road is really bad and steep and you will still have to pay 5$ pp. We recommend the other option below.
- you can go with Luis truck from the nice pueblo of Conchagua. (Free & safe place to park and to sleep -> Ioverlander point). The tour starts at 3pm and costs 10$ pp. It's about 45 min driving to go to the top and enjoy the sunset with a hot chocolate! It's possible to camp with a tent at the top for free. We can assure you that the drive to go is part of the adventure (on the open back of the truck but it's doable with children). Strongly recommended ! 
You can contact Luis for booking at this number : +503 7824 7766 (- this is only working on Telegram now) 

New WhatsApp number is: +503 7484 9950 - I think it‘s still Luis‘ company. Don‘t miss the sunrise, when you are going! So a sleepover in a tent with the company is your best option if you do not have 4x4 and high clearance.

name: Police car park
description: Parking where you can sleep (for free) if you ask the police. There is no facilities but still nice to have a safe place. They close the gate for the night. The village is really nice and we were super well welcome by local here. Feel really safe. We did the trip with Luis to go to the mirador de la montaña to see the sunset and as you come back at 7pm we had a safe place to stay here. Highly recommended.

name: Restaurante La Bahia
description: A large restaurant and bar right on the sea with beautiful views and a lockable gate. The guards at the nearby Faro Turistico said overnight camping is no longer permitted (needs to be validated by someone else) so we pulled into this nearby restaurant. A huge open flat parking area, good for rigs of all sizes, dirt so I suppose you could pitch a tent. The day guard and manager said camping was no problem and no cost but when we returned from a walk around town the evening shift squeezed us for $10, not too cool.  Clean bathrooms, no showers, wifi was down the day we were there. All that aside, the setting was outstanding and the beers are only $1.00.

name: Beach outside of Barra de Santiago
description: Follow Calle hacia Barra de Santiago to end. 4x4 needed as you will be wild camping on beach. Sand isn’t too soft. No issues with Toyota pickup 4x4. Plenty of wood on beach for fire. Locals said it was more than fine to camp here. Beautiful, clean and desolate. No mosquitos.

name: free camp , for a quiet night
description: no people , in proximity with city of Santa ana , for sleeping only.

name: Hostal Cumbres del Volcan Flor Blanca
description:
Big Hostel with lots of dorm room in a refurbished victorian house
Parking in the Garage for Motorcycles or a 4x4 with normal clearances. 
Dorms - 7$
Private rooms $30-35
Laundry room
BIG kitchen

Not very close to the center, but uber is available. 

Good: Big house, quiet. Nice atmosphere

Bad: Dorms have too many beds, No fans or AC. Mosquitoes bug you all night.

name: agua for drink and for showers in the same place
description: good place for full agua, shower and drink .

name: Safe parking (+perhaps camping)
description: Gated parking lot for 1 Dollar the whole day. Has restrooms. Maybe it's possible to stay here for the night.

name: termos del rio
description:
nice swimming pools park with slides
really nice to beat the heat in salvador.
ideal for kids from toddlers to teenagers 
5 dollars per pers above 1.10m tall
2 dollars per pers between 0 6 m to 1.10m
free under 60 cm tall !

name: Agua Purificado
description: You can buy Garaffones or refill your own containers. Price is 2,40 Dollars per Garaffon.

name: mar y sol
description: Popular spot for locals on weekends. Overpriced food. Right the beach. Paid $15 for room with bath. Not much else going on around here.

name: Laguna El Jocotal
description: Local recreation area with the Laguna nearby. Lots of space to camp. Locals said it's safe. There's a gate that closes in the night. No facilities. You can park either inside or outside the gate. Picknick Tables available.

name: Camping at Rancho
description:
This is a beautiful Rancho that's still in construction. They let us camp for 7.- per night, per vehicle *(person). It's basically just a small, flat area where you can park your vehicle. You may be able to camp further down the road as well and set up a tent there. The lookout is really great and just 50m away. Can get windy up here but the temp is much better to sleep than at the beach. Basic bathroom with toilet. Picnic tables and a small shop available. And of course a great view over the bay.
The road is no problem in a 2WD. Maybe a bit of clearance is nice to have.

name: El Salvador to Guatemala
description:
There's a checkpoint before the immigration office to ask to cancel your véhicule permission. need a copy of it to give the officer.  1 km later, immigration on the right, can't miss it to stamp your passport.
Almost too good to be true!!! friendly customs agent who speaks good English on Guatemala side. less than 1 hour for both customs!!!

name: Gasolinera Texaco El Tazumal
description: Gas station at the exit of Santa Ana. Very quiet with enough space to park. Good services and excellent location.

name: CIlindros Tomza - Zaragoza
description: Where to fill the gas cylinder. On the left hand road to Ahuachapan

name: Ruinas Casa blanca
description: The museum does not preserve original pieces. The ruins are very small and rebuilt

name: Laguna Cuzcachapa
description: Very beautiful lagoon, quiet place, with lots of green and friendly neighbors. It has areas with camping tables. We spent 4 days and we loved it. BEWARE BIG RIG !!!! Large vehicles enter, but it is difficult to turn around to exit. We had to knock down a tree with a machete to get out

name: Hidrotec - Shurflo water pumps!
description:
Just passing by and couldn't believe what I saw : a Shurflo 2008, the exact same model that gave me so much trouble until I finally fixed it 2 weeks ago!
See picture, it's expansive, yet so necessary if yours let you down. The second picture shows the location inside the mall.

name: Hospital de diagnóstico
description:
Came to the emergency for the reoccurring salivary gland since few weeks. We were taken to a comfortable waiting room with bed and WC. Doctor came and asked all the details, blood was taken for the test, waited for an hour and half to go for the sonography/X-ray. Later, the result was professionally explained. 

Clean and very nice people(speaks English as well). Dr. Miguel Roberto Majano Tercero was very patience to wait while we were contacting our doctor in Europe. He even sent the report by email to Paris. We are very thankful to him and the staff of the hospital. 

Parked our 25’’ RV right in front of the hospital for the night. 

To our surprise, the bill was just $125 for the emergency approach, sonography, X-ray, 4 hours in a nice ac comfortable room and doctor consultation. 

Recommend the best hospital in Central America as per the survey.

name: Shopping and food
description: Really nice shopping malls, had a lovely time and a great time eating

name: la Gran Via
description:
Huge parking lot, free to park until late evening. Officially they don't allow parking at night. We asked one of the guys and he came back 5 minutes later after talking to a "boss" who allowed us to stay if we paid 25$. We said we would pay maximum 15, they eventually agreed but it was a little complicated later in the evening when another boss came, and when the kind employee (Giovanni) told us we would need to pretend our vehicle had a mechanical issue... Did so when the new boss came here, and he allowed us to stay until 10am. Good night sleep in our 24 feet RV that is otherwise almost impossible to park in San Salvador.
Next door Puma gas station is an option although a bit tight for a large rig, and very busy anyway.

name: Dr. Ricardo Rivera, dental surgeon
description:
Excellent, friendly and very concerned about your well-being.
Easy to park in front or nearby, even with a large rig. Street feels safe.

name: Puma Gas Station
description: After being refused to overnight at McDonald's, WalMart and Pizza Hut, we asked nicely in this gas station and they had no problem with us parking there. They had a few long parking spaces possibly thought for transport trucks. We filled out tank there, of course. Bathrooms available. Noisy and very hot night (in March) but it's ok if you're just looking for a place to sleep (and it's free)

name: Bomberos
description: Fire station In Ahuachapan welcomes Cyclotravellers and 'skateboard tourers for camping.

name: San juan opico
description:
parking of the market MiSuper. A little bit close to the road but quiet at night.
The market close at 8pm and open at 8am.
Guarded.

name: Hospedeje Gomez
description:
Very Basic accommodation 
bed, fan, hammock, power outlet.
USD 6 without bathroom
USD 8 with bathroom. just a shower pipe and toilet bowl

looks Grimm but if you are on budget, this is the place. if you can afford $usd 20 hotel nearby, then go for it.

name: Uno Gas Station
description: Large truck stop with servicios.  Water available with hose.  Us$3 for 12 hours.

name: Alliance française
description:
Pleasant. Nice garden, cafeteria. Free Wifi and library. Easy parking and quiet area.

Agréable. Joli jardin, cafétéria. Wifi gratuit et bibliothèque. Parking facile e quartier tranquille.

name: Colibrí House old
description:
We stayed four nights at Colibrí House (formerly known as "Camilo's House") and really enjoyed it. Osiris, who is now running the place, asked us to update the information to the following:
- 10$ a night
- no more rooms & kitchen available 
- no cars over 2.80m height (gate)
- pet friendly
- washing machine available for 5$

Please call Osiris 7149-4359 ahead of your arrival, so she can give you directions and make arrangements according to your needs. She speaks Spanish and English.

name: Cafe y Restaurant Santa Fermira
description:
Outside restaurant with nice view over the valley. We asked if we could stay on the small parking lot and they said it is ok. We fitted with our 24 ft Unimog camper truck. 
We had a late lunch or an early dinner at the restaurant (but they did not ask for this). Food was ok.
Hamburguesa with papas for $ 4 
Tacos con pollo for $ 5

name: Pum gas station
description: Normal gas station. Closes at 9pm but no fences. An armed security guy (Daniel) stays overnight. Very friendly. Gave him a tip. Bathrooms available. As a last minute option, it’s ok.

name: Parking lot
description:
Gated Parking lot, nothing special but there are not many in town.  Quite narrow entrance but still doable with practically all vehicles. Paid $4 to stay overnight. The hotel segen (very nice, $20 for a private room) does not allow overland parking (unless paying for the room). The owner (Margarita) is nice. A family lives at the back of the parking lot. 
Gate-arch at entry around 2.5m high.

name: Gravel parking lot
description: Huge even gravel lot which was empty when we came. Quiet at night but the days start early. It’s a good option for a night before or after the border. We asked people from the restaurant across the street and they said it’s okay to camp one night. They even said we should camp close to the street lamp because they sleep across the street and can see us at night. We felt safe

name: Volcan Santa Ana
description:
Opens at 7:00 (but you can walk up before, the gate is not locked). This is where you meet up with the guides and the police if you don’t stay at the official parking, also you pay the entry fee 6$ per person for foreigners at this location. From here in no dogs allowed!
Toilets and small tiendas.

name: El Parador
description: It is close to the Guatemalan-Salvadorean border. Useful

name: Parking Lot, San Salvadir Internacional Airport
description: Good place to overnight. Very cheap only 4 USD the whole day. There are people to watch 24 hours. Ideal in case you need to make a trip without the motorhome. In my case I went 4 days to Belize. You have fast WiFi, electricity and running water at 200 mt at the Terminal main building

name: Pajaro y Nube Camping
description: To enjoy nature, rent tents and camping space.

name: La Zona
description:
Cozy Hostel that has 4(!) dogs and obviously pet friendly. Got to keep my puppy in the dorm, which ranges from $10-$15.
Very central and safe with free parking (no big rigs) up front.
Lots of great restaurants around and tons of travelers.
(Breakfast only)

name: Oasis Azul
description:
Remote, at oceanside clean small hotel owned and managed by Canadian Ramon. He allows camping, tent on GRASS😀and campervans if you eat at his restaurant. Great fresh food. 
Pool. Beach. Quite. No wifi, working to get it.

name: Airport parking for flying away
description: No height barrier. Bus parking spaces big enough for the biggest rigs. Secure with plenty of guards and camera systems. For max confidence, park on the side near the guards hut where they hang out, but there are plenty of guys on 24 hrs bike and foot patrol. It seems very safe/secure. We slept in our truck there for the night before our early flight out. $3.75 per day. No problem with Aduana for us to fly out of El Salvador without suspending the TIP (we plan to be back well before the TIP expires).

name: Hotel Sevilla
description: While scouting a route for a commercial cycling tour we were not sure if we would find a decent hotel for the tour, but we were surprised to find this place. Parking lot has no height limit, breakfast was good and staff was friendly. Not very cheap at USD50 for a  twin room.

name: Hotel Mediterraneo Inn
description: Nicest and newest hotel in town. Parking can’t handle a big rig, for that you are better off at the Larios Hotel. But Mediterraneo’s rooms and all areas are much nicer and it is the only one with breakfast. Breakfast starts at 7am.

name: Le Croissant- Fastest WIFI!!! (+shopping)
description:
Amazing modern cafe/bakery with delicious chocolate croissants, bread and blazing fast WiFi (45Mbps Up and 28Mbps Download Speed).
Back up your photos and download movies within no time...

name: Alis downtown
description: Homestay/hostel, conveniently located between all kinds of car mechanics! With wifi and breakfast. Owner is super friendly and knowledgable. He runs a El Sal tour company called Ectours, and arranges free walking tours through downtown. We went there and it was super nice! Recommended! We parked on the street in front, felt secure for the van. $18 for 2 ppl private room in family house.

name: parqueadero enfrente de la policia
description:
Preguntamos en el punto ioverlander que esta pegado y nos pidieron 8 dolares por noche. Este lugar es la entrada siguiente, habia un cartel que decia parquin 2 dolares, entramos, preguntamos y nos dieron que en la semana no hay nadie para cobrar, solo los fines de semana. Tiene sombra y hay una ducha. El lugar esta abandonado. pasamos dos noches gratis. 


We asked at the ioverlander point that it was stuck and they asked us 8 dollars per night. This place is the next entrance, there was a sign that said parquin 2 dollars, we entered, we asked and they gave us that in the week there is nobody to charge, only the weekends. It has shade and there is a shower. The place is abandoned. We spent two nights for free.

name: El Trapiche swimming pool with spring water
description: Lovely place to take a refreshing dip and socialize with locals doing their laundry. Perhaps you could camp here too, don’t know!

name: Foxy car glass
description: Good place to get new car windows. We had the windshield of our Chevy Van from 1995 finally repaired - they didnt have the glass in CR or Nica. We paid $125 for new windshield window plus labour. Kind employees and quick! Took 2 hours. You could also try Oslima or other window shops in the neighborhood for price comparisons. There are all kinds of mechanics within walking distance.

name: Volcano Park
description:
This is what I wish we had known before getting here:
1. It costs $3pp + $1 per vehicle to enter this park area.
2. There are 3 possible hikes starting from here. All 3 hikes must have a guide. The two crater hikes also take armed police escorts for security.
a) a short 45min circular trail. Can go anytime. Trail is free, pay guide a tip (suggested $1).
b) Izalco crater hike. 5hrs. Guide said it is steep & challenging. Rarely goes on weekdays unless pre-booked for a group. Demand is low due to the challenge but there's usually enough people at the weekends. Price $6 pp (foreigners) for trail in a special volcano zone, + $1 pp for guide. Leaves only at 11:00 hrs (no other times).
c) Santa Ana crater hike. 4 hrs. Goes everyday (except rarely if less than 4 people turn up). Bit steep in parts but not too challenging. Leaves only at 11.00hrs. Must leave the crater rim at 13:00hrs to come down. If you are slow going up, you may have very little time at the top. This hike leaves from the main park (here) but the first section is steep downhill to Hotel Tibet.  You can intercept and join the hike either at Hotel Tibet at around 11:10 (you can park here for $2) or at the Santa Ana entry point at around 11:20 (see on maps.me and iOv - this is good if you are camping at Casa Cristal). There are 2 benefits with these 'shortcuts': (i) you don't pay the park entry fee to get to the start point; and (ii) you don't have to walk all the way back up the steep hill to the start-point to get your car afterwards. Hike price is $6+$1pp. 
We did the Santa Ana hike from the start point and really regretted not having joined them at Hotel Tibet instead. By going to the start you pay the extra park entrance money just to do a tiring and boring section of the hike (walking back up at the end was hell!! 😐). Other than that, it's a great hike, spectacular views and highly recommended.

name: Seguros Qualitas
description: We were told this is the only insurance company in El Salvador allowed to insure foreign vehicles. When we entered from Honduras we could not get insurance at the border so we came here. Very nice & helpful staff but after an hour of form-filling and questions, they could only offer us cover for a year at $800!!!. Cover was for most of Central America (incl Mexico but not Belize) for our UK reg'd Iveco Daily 4x4 (2014). They said if we don't use a full year we can cancel and get a refund on the balance, but we didn't take it. Too expensive for us.  But if you are desperate, you might be able to negotiate a better deal, esp if you have a smaller or older vehicle. The cover levels were quite high, so maybe a better price could be negotiated for lower cover.

name: La Fabrica
description:
La Fabrica is one of the more mellow and tranquil spots in El Tunco. This is my 4th time staying at this location in the past 2 years and I can't get enough of it- I've stayed at 3 other hotels/hostels in town and this is by far my favorite. The entrance to the property is just outside of the main gate to El Tunco. The family that manages the property is very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. 
There are several hostel rooms (with fans), a few hotel rooms, a shared kitchen and common area, and a pool. The bathrooms and showers are pretty clean. 
La Bocana surf break is located directly out the back gate. The property is completely enclosed and the gates remian closed during the day and are locked at night- very safe and secure. Laundry service, gallons of drinking water, and beers are available onsite. 
RV parking is available for a very reasonable price, we are paying $4 per person per night to stay for a week. I believe the single hostel rooms are $10/night and a double room 
is $15/night. 
WiFi is a bit slow but is fast enough to browse the web and make WiFi calls when in the common area. 
Overall a really great place to stay.

name: End of road
description: The small road end's here and is just a path for Bikes and to walk

name: Llamatopec volcano
description: Top of Volcan Santa Ana. The hike is about 1.5 hour up and less down. Usual group leaves at 11 but sometimes there are earlier groups. Amazing views!

name: Puma - ULSD
description: This Puma gas station has ULSD (ultra low suffered diesel).

name: Eco Parque el Espino
description:
Very nice place for hiking or mountain biking. Lots of trees. Colder than the city. The entry is easy to miss, so be alert. Small road but we made it with a big and tall truck camper. Guards all the time. Cafeteria offers nice pupusas and beers. We paid 4 usd per person. The mountain bike trails are right there. We stayed one week. Rustic Shower and bathroom. Nice views of El Salvador. Very quiet at night. Probably pet friendly but didn't ask.

Prices seem to fluctuate.   Jan/2020 $5pp and $3 for the RV.  Yes pet friendly. 

Jan 2022 $5pp and $1 for truck camper

name: Hostel Sole
description: Brand new and beautiful hostel, opened 3 month ago. Dorm bed  12 $(each bed has  it s own lighting and a plug) Double room with fan 20$, double Room with A/C 25$. Very nice and helpful owners. They helped us to find the bus to vulcano Santa Ana. Very well equiped kitchen with fridge, microwave and IR hob. Nice dining table. Nice courtyard. Washing machine with dryer 5$. Most luxurious hostel we have seen. Absolutely recommended.

name: Restaurante El Faro Del Lago
description: The friendly staff will let you park and overnight for free provided with the fact you eat at the restaurant once a day. Just ask. No arch entrance (fits hight rigs), police station close by, super safe area, parking is leveled (grassy one on the left side after entrance), toilets available, stuning terrasse and access to the lake. Great spot! Stayed 3 days.

name: Nubes del Pital
description:
This community ecotourism cooperative is a perfect getaway to spend a couple days in the beautiful clouds of Pital. The super friendly owners, Yazmin & Tobias (Tobias is from the US, so English and Spanish communication both possible) have three naturally built cabins for 4-6 persons each (40-75$ per night, cheaper rates for 3+ nights). There are shared bathrooms, grilling area, wood-fired oven, picnic area, playground, a bunch of animals, etc. They welcome dogs/pets (plenty of space) and kids (this is a really great spot to spend some time as a family!). Tobias and Yazmin can provide information about some great walks in the beautiful area and going up to Pital, or take you if you like! Note: there's a small bolted sport climbing area up at Pital too, Tobias knows the way. They can provide breakfast/lunch/dinner if you want, the pizzas are delicious. 
--> You NEED a 4x4 to go down to this place. They have parking space for one or two cars/vans, but it's not level and thus not really suitable to sleep in your vehicle. If you don't have a 4x4, there's a safe parking possibility in the village (about 10 min walk from the cabins) and Tobias can pick you up.
--> Best to text/call upfront, the place isn't easy to find without directions: 50370246928

name: Tropigas
description: Propane station. you can fill a camper fixed tank here.

name: Restaurante y Hotel Los Ranchos
description: Through the gate that looks like a bus station, turn left then up a bit of a hill. We stayed for two nights, ate a one or two meals there each day ($3/plate three options/day). It was a good place to stay for Las Bolas de Fuego (August 31st) which we highly recommend. Probably not enough room for a really big rig, but a great spot for smaller rigs. Nice people working there. Over night security too.

name: El Mirador de Don Antonio
description:
Merendero Don Antonio parking. Toilets and pool availables, pupuseria and restaurant, access to the pristine beach. ideal location for lancha and crocodiles tours, turtles conservation and liberation. Doña Rosita, the owner, is actively involved in the local women community association (Associaccion de Mujeres Ambas) and is your sweet and best contact there. Awesome place and people, facilities access for 5$ per night only. Best place on la Barra! Highly recommended! :-)
Tel: +503 2420 1825

name: Complejo para la conservacion de la tortuga marina
description: This place is dedicated to sea turtle conservation. There is a little museum which had the history of San Blas and lots of good  info about the different species of turtles. Here you can watch mother turtles lay their eggs and release the baby turtles when they hatch. Friendly people. You should be able to speak Spanish (one person speaks English but he isn't there often). We stayed here for a few nights waiting for the turtles. $5 pp each day.

name: Payment to enter El Tunco
description: It is 1$ per vehicle to enter the Playa El Tunco area.

name: Tropigas Planta Usulutan
description: Was closed when we passed by (Sunday) but will be open Monday from 8:00am. Close to the littoral hwy

name: Vacant lot right on the beach
description: We parked here in this vacant lot for 2 days right on the beautiful beach of Playa El Espino. We had a couple of cows & dogs passing by and their owner who came to talk to us. According to him the land belongs to a guy who comes here only on Sundays & the lot might be for sale. We enjoyed it fully and you should also go check it out !!!

name: Really bad road
description: We tried to go to the « Beach Shack » iOverlander point on Thai road but we had to turn around more than half way trough cause there was super steep sections full of dirt and the road was closing on us. We recommend you go back to the main road and go via El Cuco.

name: Playa El Palmarcito
description:
For large vehicles (3m7 high, 7m long) take the road at the end 50m before the beach, there is a parquadero run by a super nice owner. It's free for one night. We are glad to have found it because not easy in the region for a vehicle like ours

Pour les grands véhicules (3m7 de haut, 7m de long) prenez la route au bout 50m avant la plage, il y a un parquadero tenu par une proprio super sympa. C’est gratuit pour une nuit. Nous sommes contents de l’avoir trouvé car pas facile dans la région pour un véhicule comme le notre

name: Parqueo publico
description: Large secured parking in La Union. Ideal for big rigs. The nice guard (Carlos) locks the doors and leave at 5.00PM. no amenities.

name: tropigas
description: Filled up amy integrated tank. 24$ for 12 gallons

name: Aventuras Perquin
description: Waterpark with restaurant, cabins and ample room to park.  Plenty of room for any size rig but rough, steep road coming in. $3 for adults and $2 for kids for the waterpark. Charged us $15 to camp for the night but there are 8 of us. Must be a weekend place. Monday was completely empty. We were the only ones there. Incredible views and they had firewood there that they let us have a fire. We chose not to park by electricity because of a better spot and it was not too hot.

name: Orlando Mecanico
description: He fixed our power steering system. He took more time than promised, but he was very nice and communicated well about the progress. Not cheap but in the  end the problem was fixed professionally.

name: Call out mechanic available in Tunco
description:
After our front brakes failed entering El Tunco on a Sunday afternoon, we were advised to go to the tourist police on the main road. They were very helpful and said it was unlikely to get anyone on a Sunday, also there do any seem to be too many mechanics around this way.

After being chauffeured around by the police we met Geovanny (+50370123275).
He helped cancel the brakes and also remove in order to get the parts the following day in the city. We parked up in the Monkey Lala spot whilst the repair took place (opposite the police station).

He is a young and super eager mechanic who believes he's found an opening in this area for a mobile mechanic. He's super young (18) but he works with some pals and replaced our front brakes for $80 parts + $10 Sunday charge and $10 Monday charge - we bought the three street food and drinks on the Sunday and lunch on the Monday.

A local guy we'd become friendly with said a day rate would be $10 - when we asked about tips etc. he advised not to be too generous otherwise it'd set a precedent for 'ripping off' or 'overcharging' foreigners in the future. We took this on board - spent around $15 on food for the lads and also think the parts were $70 so we left at that and we everyone was happy. 

This guy is super attentive and hardworking and would get you out of a pickle if necessary in this area. He's a mobile mechanic - number above or seek assurance at the tourism police station in El Tunco.

name: interllantas Alineacion, Balanceo, Frenos
description: Super friendly owner and staff. Very professional. we Check the brakes  our 1960 van.

name: mecanica automotriz
description: good mechanic, had a bushing in the suspension replaced. They were helpful and efficient and had a pit. Was awesome we didn't have to go into San Miguel

name: Private Parking
description: Big dirt parking lot close to the border. Sign says 24h parking, there was nobody in the evening, but in the morning a guy from opposite house showed up and wanted $5, bathroom and water is included. Some road noise, fairly quiet at night.

name: Winners dryclean y lavanderia
description: Laundry, the only one we were able to find here.

name: Integra Agua Purificada
description: Jug filling station in the corner of Maxi Despensa parking lot. $1.25 for 5 gallons

name: Restaurant “che pibe”
description:
This is the right place ir you are looking for golf meat and argentinian empanadas (the best). The owners, Claudia and Enzo (Argentinian) are very friendly and they will offer you a good talk as well. You also can camp in the street in front of the place, felt very safe and you can use toilets whenever you want if you have a meal. 

Este es el lugar correcto si están buscando comer carne y empanadas argentinas. Los dueños, Claudia y Enzo son súper amables y tb te ofrecerán una linda charla. Pueden estacionarse en la puerta frente al lugar, se siente muy seguro. Además consumiendo aquí, podrán usar baños cuando los necesiten!

name: Water station
description: Jug filling station in a mall area (Wendy, Pollo Campero etc.) 1.25 / 5 gallons, one litre and one gallon options too.

name: Repurstos IMRA
description:
Well stocked auto parts. We tried about four different ones before we found what we needed here in IMRA. They also have lights, oils, break pads, tools... all in one shop. They were really helpful and friendly, double checked everything. Accepts credit cards.
The shop is right in the middle of highway intersection.

name: Casa Blanca Tu Casa
description: I would call it a homestay in a big house, 5 rooms for rent. Very friendly people who run it. Speaks great english. Breakfast included. Fast wifi, 15-20 minutes walk to town center. Have space for 2-3 motorbikes inside, but ask first. Theres a parking facility nearby for bigger vehicles. I paid ~ 9 USD pr night breakfast included. Definetively worth the money and highly recommended!

name: Unillantas pasatiempo
description: Good service, friendly people and good prices. Honest and helpful, we repaired the tires of our van.

name: llantas y accesorios
description: Tires and accessories, very good prices, very good service. A year ago when we were going north we changed our tires and now we came back because we loved the service. Also offering alignment

name: Ocotepec
description: Really nice and big place, cheap beer for a restaurant with an amazing view of Ilopango lake and san Vicente Volcano i really recommend it. Have a big parking lot maybe they allow to camp

name: Alcadia Municipal de Tamanique
description:
We were in two car travelers, we came to go the Cascade of Tamanique, the people are very good, a small town, the police received us super well and they let us park in front of the municipality, the police are doing round 24h a day, the city seems to be quite quiet and safe. They let us sleep and use the bathroom.

------
Estávamos em dois carros viajantes, viemos para ir a Cascata de Tamanique, as pessoas são muito boas, um povoado pequeno, a polícia nos recebeu super bem e nos deixaram estacionar em frente a municipalidade, a polícia fica fazendo ronda 24h por dia, a cidade parece ser bem tranquila e segura. Nos deixaram dormir e usar o banheiro.

name: Texaco
description:
New fuel station massive parking lot behind.  there are 3 armed guards who all asked separetly for Propina. As well as the 7pm shift. New in El Salvador
Guatamalen nor Mexican plata was wanted by them.

name: Hammock Plantation
description: Hammock Plantation is a low-key, local style, safe, family and group friendly Lodge. We are located in Playa Palmarcito, El Salvador. El Palmarcito is a laid back local El Salvadorian beach community. We take pride in our community and praise Palmarcito as one of the safest, cleanest town and beach in El Salvador! We welcome the solo surfer, backpackers, families and small groups. Come enjoy El Salvador!

name: 4 million $ view
description:
After attempting to get beach side.... second choose was here. Inbetween 2 large unused houses parking with a beach, VIEW, breeze, and a local village in walking distance. 
Quiet,safe,free.

name: Hostel Las Flores
description: It is a cute little hostel with room to park one small van inside. We have a ford econoline e350 and it fitted perfectly. It's our first hostel on central America so we dont have much to compare it to. But rooms and showers were clean, air con worked and it was nice and safe with a big internal garden. We wanted to go to Santa Anita but were a little late in the day and didnt want to risk driving around in the dark so we stopped here.

name: Top USA
description: Another branch of secondhand and new STUFF camping equipment. tools. beach everything from garage sales in USA

name: mega lake view
description: Restaurant/beer stop with a mega view over the lake and into Honduras

name: Restaurant Caminante
description:
The staff at the Restaurant allows you to stay offer night at their gated parking lot if you eat here.
There even is a schwimming pool that can be used.

name: Pupuseria Geisy
description:
Amazing pupusa homemade on the spot by family with lots of locals. super nice place ! super cheap paid 7$ for like 7 pupusa and 2 beers.

Great pupusas with vegan options, $1 - $1.50 USD ea, accepts bitcoin!

name: Cabaña El Impossible
description:
Small room for rent at the entrance of the park. Didn’t use as I camped in the park. 

Room 1: 2 persons, private bathroom $30 for room
Room 2: dorm, 6 persons, $10 pppn 
Room 3: 2 beds, shared bath, $10 pppn

name: Don Juan Cascada - Camping possible
description: Lovely ecoparque hidden in a little green valley. Beautiful flower garden as well. They made a natural pool at the waterfall which is ideal for a fresh dip. Camping on a flat plot of grass is possible for $10. The parking place is big enough for campervans as well. Flush toilets available. The main entrance is a little down the road from the waterfall. They have quesadillas during daytime.

name: Rancho La Bendición de Dios
description:
This is a ranch with rooms with air conditioning or fans. On the edge of the estuary In front of Bocana El Zapote. At comfortable prices from $ 25 to $ 35 dollars. It offers roundabout for hammocks, parking, bathrooms and sanitary service. A good place to rest.

-----

Este es un rancho con habitaciones con aire acondicionado o ventiladores. A la orilla del estéro Frente a Bocana El Zapote. A precios cómodos desde $25 a $35 dólares. Ofrece glorieta para hamacas parqueo baños y servicio sanitario. Un buen lugar para descansar.

name: Uno Gas Station
description:
Large open parking lot behind gas station which has wi-fi
Night guard
Bathrooms costs money to stay  even with a fill up, food and beer. a few kms south is PUMA.

name: Punta Roca Surf Parking (day only)
description: Safe easy spot to park while surfing Punta Roca. Tilo runs the estacimento and watches over the vehicles.  $2.00

name: Secured parking
description: After all this stories of broken in cars we found this secured parking spot (at least on weekends). 2Usd per day

name: Hotel Central
description:
The cheapest hotel we could find in town.
Very simple room with a double bed and fan. Shared showers and toilets. 
$7 for the two of us per night.

They also have $40 rooms with a/c, tv and private bad room. We didn’t check them out so no idea how they look like.

Friendly family is running the place.

name: El Paraíso Hotel
description:
The only hotel in town as far we have heard.
Clean and safe place with big rooms. Private bad room, fan, a/c and tv.
$25 per night, per room.

The owner is local but speaks English as well since he lived in the states for a few years.

The restaurant next doors sells great local food for cheap.

name: Along the road with great lake view.
description:
Spot just along the road with a great view over the lake. The sun sets over the lake.

The spot it self is a bit higher than the road. On most places along this highway the fence is very close to the road but at this spot the fence is about 25m from the road so there is enough place for a tent. (We don’t have a small tent;-) )
You can put your tent hidden from the road when the grass is high. We did put up our camp when the sun was down.

We camped here while cycling through northern El Salvador.

name: La Aventura de El Mono
description: An oasis 16 minutes from San Miguel. A refreshing water park with restaurant, zip line in to a pool, water slides, a pool river,  a canopy ride and much more. With an armed guard securing the parking lot, big enough for large rigs. The owners were very gracious and helpful. The prices were very reasonable.  So if your looking for a place to cool off from the sweltering heat for the after noon, this is the place. Very enjoyable.  It closes at 5 pm, and opens at 8 am.

name: Hostal Doña Marta
description: Simple hostel/hotel with private rooms. They have a nice breakfast included. Price of the room we stayed in with 2 people was 25 usd, the room had 2 double beds and a single bed. Private bedroom. Feels very safe as its in a gated neighbourhood with 24h guards.

name: Surfers Inn has a sewer dump
description: Surfers Inn.... very nice people! We were able to fit with our rig, which is around 24’ long. They have a spot to dump black water YAY :)

name: Libreria y Fotocopiadora Esmeralda
description:
You can get copies and lamination of whatever documents you may need.
Fotocopiadora y plastificado de documentos.

name: Puma fuel stop
description: Puma fuel stop.  Asked if we could stay the night and security guard said no problem.   Gratis.   Bought him a coke    Bathrooms picnic tables and small tienda.   Great stop after crossing over if u get late start  like us

name: Piguyo
description: Best pupusas I have ever had ($1 each ) , parking in restaurant $10 plus $3 for electricity , paid a tip because my rig is 28ft long , tight fit down the street if you are over 30ft you won’t fit in the side entrances  .... best place in El Salvador ( ps very clean no trash ) a cool surfing style community ... too bad was just passing through ... well worth checking out

name: parco acquatico sihuatehuacàn
description:
We asked the police if it was safe to stay in the square with La Ceiba and El Pibe, the said one guy got killed there not long ago. 
So they told us to come here. FREE.
you have two options: 
1. park on the roadside just before the entrance of the park, beside the gym, the area is patrolled all night
2. park inside but leave at 6am unless you want to pay for the entrance ticket to the park; gate will be closed at night.

Welcoming and friendly private guard :)

name: Claire’s
description: Really secure parking lot. Spacious room, with ac but no warm shower, 23$

name: granja los mangos
description: the owner of the far let you park for 5$ the night with bathroom and shower and $10 with breakfast with the fresh milk and eggs and complements strength from the far. great space near the beach and good for kids n dogs

name: Secured Parking
description: Secure Parking near the cathedral for 1$ per hour.

name: El Mozote Massacre Memorial
description:
In Dec 1981 over a period of several days, the El Salvadoran Atacatl Batallion carried out the systematic execution of over 1000 citizens in six hamlets in the area around El Mozote.  Lured to the town on the promise of security, the citizens were separated into groups with the men locked in the church, and women and both girls and boys in nearby houses.  The next day the torture and killing began, men first, then the older women.  Young children were last.  Only one person escaped to tell the tale of what happened that day.  Others had fled before the invasion to the surrounding area east of Rio Sapo and therefore survived as well.

Today there is a memorial in the village commemmorating the names and ages of those who lost their lives in El Mozote, Guacamaya and the other hamlets.

We were greeted upon arrival by a woman who told us the history of the event.  A small display shows photographs of the aftermath (not suitable for children), and there are books and CDs (in Spanish) you can purchase, along with handicrafts -- the money goes to help the ongoing effort to educate visitors about the tragic happenings (or you can make a contribution).

This makes a nice companion stop to the Museum of the Revolution in nearby Perquin.

name: Mirador & Cascadas Los Tercios
description:
Small but very beautiful falls.  We went during dry season when there was no water, and it was still very beautiful and interesting.  The rocks are hex shaped columns that form from an old volcano.  Really interesting to see and climb on (when there is no water).  Probably even more interesting with water!

You can drive there and park...probably limited to 24ft long due to difficulties in turning around.  Even though we could fit, we took a tuk-tuk for $5 for 15 min wait and return.

name: Hammock Plantation
description:
Very Nice hostel where you can park 3 cars/vans !!
5$pp and you can use kitchen, bathroom and pool !! you can get good pupusas delivery every night ! and she sells some beers and juices, and free mango right now !!(april) 25 dollars for a private room

name: Mecanico -Taller Ojeda
description: Friendly guys, really helpfull, we had to fix some electrical part before going to Honduras.

name: Alba gas station
description:
Security, clean bathrooms and showers, very kind people! free

seguridad, baños y duchas limpias, gente muy amable! gratis!

name: Uno Gas Station
description:
Just a parking back of the gas station. there's a guard but told us he doesn't charge anything for travelers. 

Parking atrás de una gasolinera. El guardia nos dijo que no le cobra a los viajeros. muy tranquilo durante la noche excepto por un par de camiones que llegaron

name: Parque Recreativo Municial Tacachico - Water Park
description: We asked the security guard if we could camp here for the night. He phoned the on duty manager and they said we could pitch our tent anywhere in the park. Entry for the park is USD2 each, but the manager said tourists could stay ‘complimentary’ and we weren’t charged. We are touring on bicycles, but there is a car park where campers and RV’s could park. There are showers, pools and slides and a restaurant with plenty of covered areas to cook under if it is wet. Opening hours of the complex is 9am to 6pm. We would advise treating or boiling water. The complex is very clean and tidy with lots of grassed areas to choose from to pitch your tent. The restaurant offers cheap local food, snacks, beer and soft drinks.

name: Bomberos San Francisco Gotera
description: Friendly firefighters. I arrived by bicycle. They let me set up my tent inside. Whether you can stay may depend on which boss is working. Good for people on bicycles but I’m not sure about cars. Not a lot of extra parking space.

name: Pupusería Cristy
description: Excellent pupusas! Maybe the best I’ve had so far in El Salvador. Various options, including vegetable ones. Good hot chocolate too. Opens at 3pm.

name: La Placita
description: Good restaurant open for breakfast, lunch and dinner (food until 9pm). Mexican and Salvadorian options, all in the $3 range. Delicious pupusas for 60 cents each. They also have fast WiFi and serve beer at night.

name: Bomberos
description: Some of the friendliest bomberos I’ve stayed with! I arrived by bicycle and they were happy to let me stay the night and even invited me to stay a second night. I was able to sleep inside in an empty room inside. They have a kitchen and fast WiFi.

name: Bomberos
description: Very friendly bomberos. I arrived by bicycle and they let me sleep on a bed inside. Kitchen and slow WiFi. Chaletenango is a nice town to spend a day walking around.

name: Policia Turística Street Parking
description: We parked on the street across from the police station as it seemed like the safest place for street camping. There's a few restaurants around too. Not too busy, not too quiet.

name: la barra
description: free place to stay, safe, friendly people

name: Alba Gas Satation
description: Good spot to park at night!! Gasoline, Oil Center, Minisuper, Supermarket, Ice Cream, Pupusas, Clean Bathrooms, maybe water and Internet you can get  the password inside the eating area in the Supermarket. Was quiet, not too noisy.

name: Muelles\ Springs
description: Exellent work shop for springs. Fast,  easy and cheap. Friendly people.

name: parque central nahuyzalco
description: Nice small pueblo, plaza where locals come to talk and spend the evening, very friebdly people, you can get water from the tap right on the side of the church. maybe can ask for electricity from the plaza, which have outlets, but we didbt ask. coffee shop on the corner has wifi that reachs the parking. market street very organized and clean, lots of fruits and vegetables. on weekends people say there are party on the streets. we stayed only weekdays and was all quiet after 9pm. but the church bells at 6am. really worth a stop, best plaza on ruta de las flores.  can use toilets at museo comunitario, also a great place to learn the history of the indians killed here in 1932. sad but true.

name: Blue Banana
description:
Good spot for free, quite and safe.
No facilities. Just next to Hotel Juayua. 
Perfect for a night and to discover town without having to worry for your vehicle.

name: Hotel Puesta del Sol
description: Nice and cheap hotel just at the beginning of El Tunco. We paid 25$ for a double room with a/c, private bathroom and breakfast, on a Sunday night. They let us use the kitchen and there's free fast WiFi. A big rig won't fit the entrance, not sure about road safety to park outside as it is straight on the main road. It's a family run hotel, owners are friendly and extremely helpful. Bear in mind that this place is 600 mt away from the village El Tunco.

name: Hotel Campo Real
description: Very nice and quiet hotel. Good wifi all over the property, small not very clean pool but a lot of space to rest away from the heat. Rooms are clean and with air conditioning. Official price is 25 $ for a basic double room (they call it "sencilla") we bargained 23. Parking lot is pretty spacious and the entrance can fit a big rig. We are traveling by bicycle so we are not sure about overnight with your own vehicle but as the atmosphere is pretty relaxed I bet they'll let you stay! We also checked the near Hotel Sevilla but honestly it's not worth the money.

name: Free Potable Water
description: Potable water fill station that the locals use. They said we could drink this water. Not sure how safe it is but we filled up and will use with our filters. Free unlimited :) cannot connect a hose to it though

name: Mercado Municipal
description: Large and busy mercado with a wide array of goods for sale and delicious local food for cheap.

name: El Carmen Coffee Tour
description: $7USD (updated 2022) per person for their coffee tour. English and Spanish available. It lasts about 2 hours and it walks you through the entire coffee process. Our guide was very knowledgeable and engaging. We really loved it and learned quite a bit. Highly recommend if you visit this town.

name: El Palmarcito Pools
description: Walking along the beach going east, you will eventually see some stairs/steps. Get up there for lovely views of wildlife and the waves, and also a small set of pools to take a dip in. Free when we went on a Monday and we heard they charge on the weekends.

name: Parque Nacional El Boquerón
description: A lovely national park that highlights the San Salvador Volcano and offers great views of it. Three Miradores and some trails available. It was $2USD for entrance and $1USD for parking. The drive was steep (uphill) and at times very narrow but doable with our 2WD. We enjoyed our time here.

name: Auto parts stores
description: There are several auto parts stores from here South on this street. They are all listed on Google maps if you need! There are also Moto parts and repair places. Seems like a good place to come for repairs if you don’t want to go to San Salvador!

name: Motorider (Touratech/Heidenau)
description:
Motorider is a Touratech and Heidenau reseller. I got some Scout K60 here. Credit Cards accepted.
There’s a motorcycle and car mechanic right next door to mount the tyres.

name: Tires
description: Great roadside tire shop. Replaced 3 leaking valves for $6 usd. Very fast and nice.

name: Cyber cafe / copies
description: Got copies made here for the border crossing

name: Restaurante y hostal Buenos Aires
description: An amazing place to be, several places to eat inside the restaurant and in the garden. Lots of hammocks, a cool labyrinth, karaoke, a house in the sky and a look out of the town. Cool owners.

name: Moncagua Natural Swimming Pools
description:
Hot springs in a swimming pool. Water is warm, but it’s perfect. 
They charge 1 USD per person and 1 USD for parking ($2/person, nothing for parking on a Thursday -April 2023).

Dogs allowed in but they are not permitted to swim.

name: Radiadores Alberto
description: We had a leak in the tubes coming from the radiator. Our coolant was leaking constantly. After trying 5 places we ended up here. They fixed the problem in 1 hour and fix our tube for 25 USD. In a different place we were quoted 80 USD and a 7 hour work including removing our gas tank!! They are specialist in radiators so they know exactly what they are doing. 1 hour and we were off to the beach!!!

name: Santa Teresa Veterinarians
description: 7:30-6:00 great vet. Lots of special food and medicine. Not cheap but great service

name: Dr. Alberto Aguilar Rivas Clinic
description: Yellow fever shots free here on Wednesday and Friday from 7:30 to 12:00. Be early. Bring copy of passport and onward travel

name: Santa Lucia Cafe
description: Best papusas in El Salvador. Basil and garlic and cheese is Delicious. Super affordable and very friendly staff. Located behind church.

name: Hostel YUCAMIX
description: Awesome hostel, very friendly staff, well maintained, everything clean. Private room with shared bathroom for 2 $17, shared room $7 pp. Secure parking for motorcycle. Excellent location, many restaurants options near.

name: Giros Internet Cafe
description: This place is right on the Pan American Highway. next door to the Lito's Comida Mexicana. It is open even on Sunday. We were able to get internet and our photocopies done before the boarder. It was a lifesaver as we had run out of our copies. The man was very nice and he spoke a little English. $2.60 for about 4 copies of everything.

name: Laundry at central del arte por La Paz hostal
description:
They allow guest to hand was and hang dry their clothes and for a very high fee they will wash for you and hang dry. 

Wash $5 USD per load in a regular machine 
Dry $5 USD per load in a regular machine

name: Puma Gas Station
description:
You can overnight here.
The shop/snack is open 24h with toilets.
24h guard (armed).
A little bit noisy because this is a huge truck stop.
Showers for 1 dollar and they are ok

name: Andian -good burger and so much more
description:
We stopped here because there’s outdoor seating for our dog and we were overjoyed. 

It’s an expensive place but the quality is amazing. 

They have the best Burger since the USA (south bound), the chicken and waffles is fantastic, the make and sell bread, pastries and well you get it. 

They also have good wifi!

name: Parque Madreselva
description:
Security is the big issue in San Salvador. But finally there is a free, safe and possible to park several days in the capital.
In the block of the US embassy
In the street behind the madreselva park there are five armed security 24 / 24hs, each 50 meters (which keep private streets) here there are no bathrooms or water tap, but you can park large vehicles. I stayed three days. You can easily go to the city center on bus 34, which passes in the corner. Very quiet place.
On the other street, in front of the park there is 24 hour security of the park itself, there are bathrooms and water, however there is more movement of cars, and vehicles with more than 2.5 meters high do not park, through the branches of the trees.

---

 Seguridad es el gran tema en San Salvador.  Pero finalmente encontramos un lugar gratis, seguro y posible para parquear varios dias en la capital.
En la cuadra de la embajada de EUA (seguridad máxima).
En la calle de atrás del parque madreselva hay cinco seguridad armados 24/24hs a cada 50 metros (que guardan las calles particulares) aqui no hay baños ni agua, pero si se puede parquear vehículos grandes. Me quedé 3 dias. Fuí al centro de la ciudad en el bus 34 que pasa en la esquina. Muy silencioso lugar. 
Ahora, en la otra calle, en frente al parque, hay seguridad 24hs del proprio parque, hay baños y agua, sin embargo hay  más movimiento de autos, y no parquean vehículos con más de 2,5 metros de altura, por las ramas de las árboles.
Altamente recomendable el lugar.

name: Clinica Veterinaria
description: Awesome vet who speaks perfect English. He helped us diagnose our dog after getting a misdiagnosis in Antigua. Got blood tests done in 2 hrs. No need to drive to San Salvador if you are in need of vet care.

name: Santa Ana Yellow foodtainers
description:
Parked on the street, Free,
wide street, with shadow, silent, in front of this foodtainers square. Private security from the food square from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m.
At night, you can go to the end of the street there is a rich condominium with big gate and 24 hour security. From here take a bus and visit downtown, get into the theater, the market  and the 50 churches of the city.
very recommended because the shadow, security and quiet night.
--
Parqueado a la calle, Gratis,
calle ancha, con mucha sombra, silenciosa, en frente a esta plaza de alimentación. Seguridad privada de la plaza Yellow desde las 10am hasta las 10pm.
al fondo de la calle hay un condominio de alto padrón con portón y seguridad 24hs, bueno para tomar un bus y bajar para el centro, conocer el teatro, las 50 iglesias de la ciudad.

name: Cholos Place
description:
Bladimir, the owner, rents out a few rooms (not sure the price), but you can also camp in front on a grassy bit right at the beach ($10/vehicle/night). outdoor shower, no toilets except in the rooms, but the last restaurant on the right side of the beach has a toilet for $0.25 or if u have some beers and food, they let you use it for free at any time thereafter (always offer to pay out of courtesy).
views onto the surf break, hammocks for use and pretty good wifi as well as electric plugs to use if u have an extension cord. occasionally bread, ice cream, veggie, pizza and chicken trucks pass by, but u can also walk at low tide on the beach to el cuco to get basic groceries.

name: Auto Express Service
description:
Amazing Service, professional and efficient with our Land Rover Defender. Ask for Nelson
Front gate. Very helpful and friendly guys here. All kinds of mechanical services offered, good price

name: Hotel Santa María
description:
Camping allowed. Private camping spot / hotel with wifi, Pool, hot shower, restaurant, close to everything in town. Security 24/7, super friendly owner Julio was very welcoming and helpful. Big rig friendly (height) but depends on occupancy of hotel for parking. Good wifi.

Highly recommended

name: Veterinaria Tecana
description:
Super nice veterinarian. I only had the rabies vaccination and a paper with the other vaccines and desparasitation (removal of parasites) because in the US they didn’t want to put the vaccines stickers on my European dog passport. He filled everything with stickers, stamps and signatures, gave me instructions on what to do next (go to the ministry of agriculture) and told me about the procedures for the next countries.
He only charged me $20 for the health certificate and everything else.

name: Mi Casa
description: The place is a hostel in a very safe spot downtown and you can park your Van on the street in front of it. The owner is Silvia and she is very flexible in case you wanna use the amenities. Breakfast is amazing.

name: Granja Don Alvaro
description:
We met the son of the family in town, he is studying tourism and his family owns a farm. He invited us to stay in his fields and said they are planning a camp area. He also plans to ride a motorcycle down the Pan American. It’s a great location, tucked away around the back of the farm in a grassy area up in a hill. The farm recently opened a cafe selling coffee (to drink, maybe beans too), cheese, milk and honey (all farm produced) as well as having young cow feeding times for kids and things like sugar cane crushing. 

The bus to and from Juayúa is just 20c and you can catch it outside the farm or head 5 mins up the road to the small town of San Jose de Mojada and catch it from there.

He is happy to have Overlanders stay, he let us use the toilet and shower in the guest building and there is water available too if you need a tank fill (likely clean but not potable). They have electricity you can use but not at the site. You have the choice of where to stay in the fields, we chose the back corner as recommended by him. Some tight-ish corners through the farm but we were in easy enough in a long bed full ton Dodge Ram 3500 + camper. No height clearance issues.

We planned to stay a night and stayed two. Felt very welcome and secure, quiet too. The farm is also guarded at night. Expect an enthusiastic welcome from a pack of dachshunds and you may, like us, spot a quetzal in the trees nearby. A great stop for kids and adults alike. Check out the pictures for a better idea).

We were not charged. I am not sure this will continue forever, who knows. We purchased some cheese and milk etc. Alvaro seems to love travel more than profit :)

Right next to a cell tower for full bars 3G Tigo (10 Mbs)and full bars LTE Claro (41Mbs ... yes, forty one!). Tested by Ookla. 

Happy to be adding this first, great friendly hosts. Enjoy!

Directions: Just at the corner into/out of town you will see a bright red shed which is the cafe. The gate into the farm is just beside with two big tractor tires buried into the ground either side of the entrance. (See gate in pics)

Contact: probably best to contact first but they will likely be happy to accommodate you just turning up. Contact Alvaro on:
diazalvaro940@gmail.com
+503 7860 4197

name: Cafe Granja Don Alvaro
description: Cafe selling farm grown coffee, honey, fruit, cheese and milk. Stuff for the kids to do and see too. Parking on road or in opposite car park for smaller rigs. Camping available in the fields behind, see other entry.

name: Puma - with Ultra Low Sulphur
description: This station has low sulphurs but also an Ultra Low Sulphur pump on its own by the entrance. Around 20c per gallon more at time of writing.

name: Sammy's Tacos
description: Fantastic papusas, tacos and the prawn soup was so delicious! Very cheap prices, a wonderful little family establishment.

name: Flower Nursery - Adonay law office
description: Flower Nursery - Adonay law office . Quiet space not far from the border.  The owner's name is Alo and he sometimes allows travelers to camp here and use the shower.  They grow various plants for sale, so it is a little oasis with nice smells and vibes. Much nicer than camping at the nearby hotel. They also have a nice space in back for camping.

name: Cartagena Restaurante
description: A beautiful restaurant set among lush gardens with an amazing view. Breakfast is $5 and includes coffee. Open from 8am to 8pm

name: Cartagena - Parque Ecologico
description: These beautiful gardens are free! They have an amazing view overlooking the country. Lots of flowers and exotic plants as well as many different animals and birds. I believe this is maintained by the local university. Small cabins for rent as well, but we did not ask about the price. The restaurant here is very good as well. Very easy walk from the town center.

name: Cafe 303 Berlin
description: This cafe is right next to a jaw dropping overlook! Also the owner of this cafe, David, is the sweetest El Salvadorian I have met. He gave us traditional coffee from the region (made with clove and cinnamon), watched our bikes as we walked around the town, and found us a place to sleep for the night. David is also very knowledgeable about the surrounding geography and gave us lots of advice for our travels. I’m so glad people like this exist on this planet!! The WiFi here is great and the drinks and food are yummy. Definitely support this locally-owned business by a great guy.

name: Metro center mall
description: Free wifi but it is a mall (yikes). We went to Lorena which has bottomless coffee refills and did our WiFi stuff there but you can do it anywhere in the mall

name: El Salvador Sim Card
description:
Tienda Jireh, the first shop when leaving the border premises sells sim cards for 1usd.
Nice guy who activates the sim card which takes a phone call and ID.
Go get the sim cards you need while your travel partner does the aduana papers.

name: Antenas en Cerro Tecapa
description:
1h hike up from the Laguna along the crater rim with splendid views of Vulcano San Miguel, Santiago de Maria and the Pacific.

Once up there possibility to continue to Alegria orvwalk down to the Laguna on a dirt road.

Trail up to Antenas:
1h, often close to the edge of the crater rim or through 2m gigh grass, unexperienced hikers might not enjoy this trail
 Facing the guard house walk up the cobblestone road for some 50m to your left and before the road starts going down ask at the houses there were the trail to the antenas start.

Road up to Antenas:
1h20min
5,2km on dirt road, by car only on 4x4 i was told, best to take it walking down after a hiking up the crater rim trail

Private road from Antenas down to Alegria:
1h
Ask military boys at the Antena which road leads down to Alegria.

name: Veterinaria Tecana Santa Rosa
description: $20 for health certificates to cross the border. $12 for rabies shot. Great and affordable.

name: Bar y restaurante Villa del Mar
description:
I would not recommend to stop there unless you are, like us, caught by the night on the road between Metapan and Playa Cuco.

The big plus: it has a secure gated parking guarded day and night by a armed guard. Our van (2,50m high) fitted with no issue. Big rig friendly. It is the only option with parking we could find on the road, except from “love-hotels”

The room now : 20$ for 12h (literally, counting from the hour you pick-up the key)/ 30$ for 24h. Room 4 was one of the shabbiest room we have ever had. Some stains on the sheets ; one of the window’s gutter is broken ; the showers is just a tube going out of the wall, and cold water only... On the bright side: it has Tv and A/C. 
Wifi is quite fast: we could use it for Facetime call, and the quality was good.

We were too lazy to ask if we could sleep in our van for smaller fees. It might be possible though, since the restaurant has restrooms; and there is a shower at the swimming pool.

There is a restaurant too. Food was greasy, nothing special and seemed kind of expensive (11$ for a share appetizer - big portion / 8$ to 11$ for a main / 2,5$ for beer and drinks) but it was our first restaurant in El Salavador so we have nothing to compare with.

There is a swimming pool, clean as it seems. We did not tried it.

To sum up: it does the trick if you have no other option but I would not recommend staying there otherwise.

name: Restaurante Flotante Orchideas
description:
Floating Restaurant Owner told us you can tent camp at his place. Food is fine.

Likely a very nice experience, you can put up your tent on the wooden floor or hang your hammock.

It is located in front of an manglar island and to get to it you ask at the Puerto el Triunfo for floating restaurant and you will be taken for free to the the business.

Food fine but pricey. Menu and phone number in attached pictures.

Did not talk aboutovernight cost but i am sure you can arrange a minimum consumption so that the owner lets you stay the night.

Running water, toilets. No shower.
Rain water collected from the roofater

name: Brisas del Mar
description:
Restaurant on the beach. Same quality as Comedor Sofi in el Cuco but a bit cheaper and a nice view.

Here is one of the road accesses to the beach. Lots of motorbikes and some cars drove on the beach..

name: ASPESCU
description:
Asoscacion de Pescadores Artesanales de Playa el Cuco recieves and processes most of the seafood of the beach which fisher bring from the ocean.  Here you can buy seafood (shrimp, fish..) before it is shipped of to be sold around the country and Walmart.
Huge Shrimps frozen (4-5 units per pound) 10usd/lbs
Big shrimp frozen (6-10 units per pound)
8usd/lbs

You can access this place from the road or the beach. If accessed by the beach be careful because the path next to the fish drying 'greenhouse' is extremly slippery for 30m.

name: Casa Biscocha
description:
Camp in the home of Elvis a licensed tourist guide who works for the municipality of Jiquilisquo at the moment.

Lots of shade, own Shower and bathroom and if requiered hammock or bedroom to sleep in.
Wifi and good water pressure shower included.
Maximum vehicle height 270 to to 280cm, fenced in.

Elvis is a nice guy to chill with and is excited to tell you about to tell you the places you can visit or he can show you all over El Salvador.

Camp in van for 2 people 5usd pn
Use of washing machine 2usd per small load
Hooking van up for A/C 2 usd pn
Bedroom with fan 15 usd pn

2hr from the border to Honduras
Lovely quiet chilled dog.

On weekdays he is home from 18:00 on.
Weekends he usualy is home. Anyway to be safe call him to see if he is around.
WhatsApp: +50374875054 call him to let him know you're coming

If you arrive with out warning call his name at his place (the one with palm trees) and ask the neighbours.

name: Casa Vieja
description: Lovely homely place run by Luis. Rooms range from dorms to private rooms. Great location just a few of blocks from the centre but nice and quiet. Cost $8 for a dorm bed and $12.50 for a private room, including breakfast.

name: Panchimalco
description:
Panchimalco was a precolombian town which makes it one of few towns with a large indigenous population and later the Spanish turned it into a colonial town to be recognised by the architecture.

We enjoyed walking around the town for 20min and ended up at Restaurante Puerta del Sol where locals weave fabrics and some other artesinians work.

The frontyard has nice sculptures, plants and vibe.

The restaurant offers lunch for 2.75usd on a nice big terrace. See attached pictures of the food.
Beer 1.25usd.

Parque acuatico to swim in a pool is 0,5usd. Check googlemaps.

name: Patio Maya Coffee Shop
description:
Real coffee in a nice and calm patio to escape the craziness of the center. Located at the side entrance of Rosario church.

Showers and toilets will come in handy if you end up camping on the fenced in parking lot next to the church.

name: Cadejo Brewing Company
description:
For the traveling beerlovers.
Microbrewery offering beer at 2.5usd for 16oz during happy hour from 16:00 to 20:00.

Beer comes with a dog bowl of Popcorn. Ask for it because waiters tend to forget.

For the anti-beer people they do make their own sodas with tastes according to fruitvseason. Very nice and tasty and you can ask to taste before ordering a whole glass of soda.

Fenced in parking lot requieres leveling with wedges.
Did not ask for camping. 
More details on beer selection in attached picture.

name: Apaneca
description: Next to the central park in a parking lot. We where at the Laguna Verde and decided to pass the night like other overlanders there. But police came and told us, in there opinion it is not a good idea to stay there alone. So they brought us to this place. Quiet night. Felt good.

name: El Cafetalón (Polideportivo con seguridad 24hs)
description:
It is a sports center with soccer fields, basketball and running track, very green. It has 3 parking lots, the main one is the CAN (police with dogs) and they allow you to park behind them and be safe. 
We spent several nights, we left the van there to walk around the city, there is a big tree with a lot of shade for the day. 

Costs
Bathroom: 0.20 $ 
Showers (cold water): 0.50 $
Pools: 1.00 $
Parking lot:
6 am to 6 pm 0.35 $ (every 3 hours)
6 pm to 9 pm 0.50
9 pm to 6 am 1.50 $

Sometimes we got a discount after several days.Security 24/7. A big show in some parts. We stay here a few days and we felt safe.


Es un polideportivo con canchas de fútbol, básquet y pista de running, mucho verde. Tiene 3 estacionamientos, en el principal está la CAN (policía con perros) y te permiten estacionar detrás de ellos y estar seguros.
Pasamos varias noches, dejamos la camioneta ahí para pasear por la ciudad, hay un gran árbol con mucha sombra para el día.
Baños: 0.20 dólares
Duchas (agua fría): 0.50 dólares
Acceso a las piscinas: 1.00 dólar 
Valor del estacionamiento: 0.35 cada 3 horas de 6 a 18hs. 0.50 dólares de 18 a 21hs, y 1.50 dólares de las 21 a las 6am.
En ocasiones nos hicieron un descuento luego de varios días.

name: Hotel Real Intercontinental, car park
description:
Camp in the city center for 20 USD pn for 2 people in one van. Parking for camping is between parking garage and security hut.

Very safe spot to camp as it offers a plethora of security guards and countless cameras.

Airconditioned lobby
Clean bathroom and sinks
Fancy restaurants
a) all you can eat brazilian rodizio 26usd +taxes
b) wood oven pizzeria
Did not try to use the pool
1 Van fit on a leveled spot
Fits big rigs with a medium incline

For camping ask security guys in little hut behind the parking garage.Employees might fluctuate a bit and might say no at first and then when get him to ask his boss you get permission to camp.

Payment takes place together with the security guards at the parking machine at the 10usd X 2 rate of a lost parking ticket.

name: Lakeside
description:
Park on the shores of the lake.There are tables and chairs in the shade.
There is a hotel with a restaurant and swimming pools "La Perla".
Two dollars or consuming something at the bar will give you access to the pools all day and the bathrooms and showers. All very clean. They say the place is super safe. We felt safe.

name: Restaurant Los Remos (Security, Wifi, Great View)
description:
Restaurant with Vegetarian and Vegan Options, lunch from 3 dollars. Miriam, the owner, is very kind and attentive. We ate an exquisite vegetable casserole and a very good broccoli soup. They allow sleeping in the parking lot with a beautiful view of the Metapán Lagoon and with a security guard all night. Bathrooms available 24 hours, shade and excellent service.
Restaurante con Opciones Vegetarianas y Veganas, almuerzos desde 3 dólares. Miriam, la dueña, es muy amable y atenta. Comimos una cazuela de vegetales exquisita y de entrada una sopa de brócoli muy buena.
Permite dormir estacionar para dormir en el estacionamiento con una vista preciosa a la Laguna de Metapán y con guardia de seguridad toda la noche.
Baños disponibles 24hs., sombra y una excelente atención.

Restaurant with Vegan options
Parking lot with shadow in some parts
Security guard at night
Bathrooms available 24hs
Very kind owner (Miriam)
Excellent view to the Lagoon

name: Cruz Roja
description:
Bicycle traveler 
You will find very friendly people here. Came after the Bomberos said no.
Spent a night but was offered to stay one more if wanted.

name: Migracion - Visa Extension
description:
Visa extension of up to 90 days counted from the day your old Visa expires can be made in Santa Ana, San Salvador and San Miguel.

Took 3 days to get the passport back. Official is that it can take up to 5 days.

a) 25USD pp
b) filled out form, except of finger prints and signature (seems to be available online too)
c) copy of passport and all pages with stamps
d) copy of Bus, plane or boat ticket stating departure from CA4. as iOverlander TIP copy works too
e) proof of suficient funds to pay for your time in CA4 (bank statement,..)
f) passport picture 3×4cm (worked for me without that picture)

Apply at least 5 workdays before your old visa expires to avoid a 45USD fine.

name: Autohotel Eclipse
description:
Rooms for 8 hours from 10 to 18 usd.
It is a autohotel of the bit nicer and clean kind, likely runs 24h, includes your own parking, cold shower, towel, soap, A/C and two non alcoholic drinks.

I don't know what you would like to go there for but anyway we did not feel grossed out even tough a mirror next to your bed and a sturdy oddly shaped furniture reminds of what usually happens in these rooms.

Up to 3m you fit into the parking. Above you can park in front of the room.

Room Menu in attached picture.

name: Coctelería Linda Vista
description:
Right where the ocean enters the lagoon is this cute Restaurant decorated with some flowers and shade from palm leaves teached roofs.

When walking along the shore in the area i saw that this is the only place you can drive and camp on grass all the way up to the shore and the only one with sand beach (when it is not high tide).

You can camp here as long as you consume.

Nice, friendly and simple people. No music at the restaurant or the suroundings (maybe this is different on weekends).

Chicken and turkeys hanging out around the Restaurant.

Very calm waters and shallow, perfect to hang out and play as long as you take measures to protect yourself from the sun.

4 cabins each 25usd for 24h

When camping they will open up one of the cabins to be able to shower.

name: Restaurante y Cabañas Viña Del Mar
description:
The owner family is very nice and friendly, had awesome 3 nights here, swimming and goofing around the sand bars at low tide with their kids, family dinners with home smoked tuna pupusas and 9 year old Rodrigo who is keen on washing your dishes, cleaning your car, preparing Micheladas and checking your Solar System (Rodrigo likes to be addressed as Ingeniero Solar.)

We chose this place over Irma because the grassy area which Irma did not have. 

If you park just after the green entrance gate to the right you get your own roofed 'patio'.

Outdoor shower with nice pressure
Indoor shower
Kids pool and pool for splashing
Running water
Nice palm leave roof and breeze to chill in hammocks.

Stay for free but please don't ruin their hospitality and consume their nicley prepared meals and drinks.

Cabañas with A/C and en suite bathroom 35usd p/n

Walk and swim across the bay to check out the sunset and beach or take the ferry in Zapote.

We were told that surfers who stopped by did say the surf was regular.

The experience we had with the family and  the locations is the reason we travel.

name: Dead End Berlin
description:
A dead end that leads to a funeral home, at first to the left you see a large abandoned house, we stopped in front and there were no problems at all, we talked to people who were from the place and told us it was very safe, we spent two night and  It was really like that, besides being quiet and quiet.

Un callejón sin salida que da a una funeraria, al principio hacia la izquierda se ve una gran casa abandonada, paramos en frente y no hubo problemas de nada, hablamos connpersonas que eran del lugar y nos dijeron que era muy seguro, pasamos dos noche y fue así en verdad, ademas de silencioso y tranquilo.

name: The great Pupusas
description:
A good place to eat pupusas, we tried many and here have very rich and some varieties. It is a family home, you will not find a great restaurant, it is a house literally. The pupils of beans and cheese $ 0.35 specials without meat $ 0.60.
------- Spanish / Español---------
un buen lugar para comer Pupusas, probamos muchas y acá tienen unas muy ricas y algunas variedades. es una casa familiar, no vas a encontrar un gran restaurante, es una casa literalmente. las pupusas de frijos y queso $0,35 las especiales sin carne $0,60

name: UNO Gas Station
description:
We spent a night at this gas station, it is very quiet at night, they close after 10 but a guard is left, we talked to him and he said yes, he also asked us for a money collaboration, but we said we could not and there was no problem  .  There is gas at the station and you can carry non-potable water. Oh, one detail, in that area it smells like bad water, like sewers.

Pasamos una noche en esta gasolinera, es muy tranquilo por la noche, cierran despues de las 10 pero queda un guardia, hablamos con él y dijo que sí, también nos pidió una colaboración de dinero, pero le dijimos que no podíamos y no hubo problema. en la estación hay gas y puedes cargar agua NO POTABLE. oh, un detalle, en esa zona huele a agua en mal estado, como a cloacas.

name: Cihuatán: archaeological park
description:
A small archaeological complex, the place is very nice, there are several ruins of an ancient city, there is a pyramid, several platforms and two courts of a ballgame.  Admission for foreigners is $ 3 per person and the park is $ 1
Un complejo arqueológico pequeño, el lugar esta muu lindo, hay varias ruinas de una antigua ciudad, hay una pirámide, varias plataformas y dos canchas de un juego de pelota. la entrada para extrangeros es de $3 por persona y el parque es de $1

name: Free good water.
