description: Locals use it for drinking. You can park on the side.

name: Quesos de Metapán
description: great shop that sells a big variety of cheesee you can try everything and they also sell nuts, coffee, honey, pita bread and roasted seeds. nice people too and easy parking out front.

name: Comedor Las Palmeras
description:
great comedor, exists since 1932! very local feel. 
try the carne guisada.
we were invited to eat with the family that runs the place.
easy to miss, it's a yellow gate.

name: Golfo Travel
description:
Mario runs a boat service that connects motorcyclists or bicyclist from El Salvador to Honduras and Nicaragua. He has a few boats. One is 40 passenger fast boat, as well as having a 60 passenger slower boat. Our group used him to transport 35 bicycles, 1000kg of bags, and 35 cyclists. First we used him to transport us to Isla del Tigre, and afterwards to Nicaragua. It's a huge help if you're wanting to avoid the hectic land borders between Nicaragua, Honduras and El Salvador. Speaking with him, he has transported 3 bikes at a time, but figures up to 8 is possible in a single run. Mario Melendrez is a cool guy, and can also help with clearing customs in either Honduras, or Nicaragua. He is based in La Union, although he can pick you up in either Nicaragua or Honduras. 
+50372824362 or email golfo_fonseca@hotmail.com or golfotraveltours@gmail.com

name: Ahuachapan street
description: broad street just to the exit of the city. not of worries with our 24 feet. Of many bus are also parked. A little of noise in evening but very calm the night. Sufficient for one night.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart with one big parking and entry. No problem for there accesses with one big rig. It is not not possible of sleep on the parking

name: Restaurante Los boomwalos
description:
Typical restaurant food from El Salvador, the best pupusas we ate plus an amazing view to the capital. Recommended really nice stuff, parking included. See attached pictures for pupusas we ate and the panoramic view.
---
Restaurante con comidas típicas salvadoreñas, las mejores pupusas que probamos además de una increíble vista a la capital. Recomendado, muy agradable el personal, parqueo incluido. Ver fotos añadidas de las pupusas que comimos y la vista panorámica.

name: Mauricio's House
description:
Mauricio is the owner and he likes to receive travelers to talk. He requested us to be added at iOverlander so other travelers can contact him. He and his wife are artesians and they offer Wi-Fi, water, bathrooms, showers, refrigerator or anything you need for free. Very friendly. You can contact him at +503 7807 1450. 

Mauricio es el dueño y le gusta recibir viajeros para conversar. Pidió ser registrado en iOverlander para que otros viajeros los busquen. Él y su esposa son artesanos y ponen a disposición Wi-Fi, agua, duchas, sanitarios, refrigerador o cualquier otra cosa que necesiten gratis. Muy amables. Pueden contactarles al número +503 7807 1450.

name: Hotel Jardín
description: The only hotel in town on the main road down to the pier. Has a red sign outside with the name "Hotel". Small basic rooms with hot water, wifi & AC, It was $12 for one person. Room had a double bed and small private bathroom. There are 12 rooms and secure gated parking beside your room. Its in the center of town and surrounded by cheap eats and shops.

name: La casa de Mauricio
description:
In front of the house of Mauritius there is a church where you can leave your Motorhome.
We arrived by motorbike and he let us into his house and gave us room to sleep without cost.
If you are in Motorhome you can ask permission to use the bathroom and shower without problem too !.
Please contact him before you arrive so that he is aware of his arrival and if you come by motorbike to coordinen if he is available.
Mauritius Contact: +50378071450

name: Bomberos of Sonzacate
description:
I camped at the Bomberos of Sonzacate for the night. The person in charge checked my passport and then I was allowed to camp here. I was cycle touring. Probably it won't work with a vehicle. 

The fire station is on the main road. Expect road noise. The station is not the biggest and camping was on concrete.  Across the station was a big supermarket. The camping option going towards the ocean didn't look good in my opinion.

name: Football field
description:
In case of problems at the border or in case you come in late, this spot could be an option overnight. 
On the  El salvador side, next to a river to swim and jimp from rocks or trees, there is ample side for big rigs to fit next to the football field.
Soldiers from the birders are patrolling the area so it feels safe. 
Tiendita sells beers along the river.
Take a right just after crossing the bridge coming from the Guatemala side, short dirt road going down for 200m and here you are!
Enjoy!

name: Atiquizaya
description: Atiquizaya town. Came here randomly and loved the vibe in the main square...all locals, no tourists at all. Really cheap options for drinking and eating around the square. There is a market too (0.50$ delicious tamales). Spent the night here before crossing to Guatemala.

name: Canegüe Café
description: This is a café next to the beautiful beach of El Zonte. The owner is a Canadian chef who shares his talent in creating healthy and delicious breakfasts with us. It has been the best breakfast we have had so far in Central America. He prepares everything with a lot of love! I highly recommend this place to all people who love good food and nice places! Say hello to Oliver and give him a hug of us!

name: Camping at the mirador
description: the gate to see the waterfalls was already closed but the very friendly caretaker of the place let us in. for a 5$ propina we were allowed to drive down to the mirador and camp there. beautiful view over the lake (duh, it's a mirador), some stone tables, lots of moscitos at sunset,  but a nice breeze, good stargazing and a beautiful sunrise. very quiet night!

name: pupuseria in the yellow house
description:
superfriendly ladies selling very tasty pupusas with 5 different vegetarian fillings. they have some tables outside. 
50c/pupusa. we had them for breakfast. good morning!

name: Las Casitas Hostal
description: Amazing accommodations within Ataco. Spotlessly clean. I needed some minor welding on my motorcycle and the owner escorted me through town to find a suitable welding shop and translated as required. He has enough secure parking to accommodate a rig of any size. Owner speaks fluent English. A small breakfast is included but there is no restaurant

name: Great Mechanic (and best place to stay in el Tunco)
description: Ay La Fábrica campground you will find the care taker Edwin and his lovely family. Edwin and a friend are mechanics and they diagnosed our spark plug problem, bought us new ones in San Salvador, and changed them for us (right at the campsite). He helped a friend with breaks, oil changes, and general maintenance as well. Because he is a mechanic and does a lot of work he is able to get high quality products at reduced prices. It’s hard to find the entrance because there is no sign but look for a yellow gate on the left before a sign for Rocka Sunzal and Blu Resort. +503-77512852 is his number if you want to reach out but we highly highly recommend his services!

name: Hotel Boca Olas
description: There is a water tap on the left side of the gate which is potable water. Ask the guard on the gate if he allows you to fill your tank first.

name: Pita Jaus - Jugos and more
description: Little place where a lovely old lady sells food and jugos to very reasonable prices. You can heave breakfast and lunch here.

name: Esquina La Comadre
description: Little family run restaurant in the middle of El Tunco. Good food to good prices and great portions. They have everything from fish to meat and Mexican food.

name: Puma Glas station card scam
description:
Filled up here (only 32 usd fortunately) and paid on credit card. After entering pin the attendant said it hadn't gone through - it looked like it hadn't so tried again. Same again. Paid in cash. 

Checked my bank and both payments were in pending transactions. My bank stopped them but I don't want this to happen to others! Avoid. 

Didn't take it up with the attendant even though we're still here as my spanish isnt good enough unfortunately.

name: SOL BOHEMIO
description:
Awesome spot, beautiful and relaxing place, we felt totally safe.
The owner is very friendly (Gerardo Lopez, whatsapp 71084080).
The place has a pool, several hammocks, direct access to the beach and possibility to send baby turtles to the sea depending on the period.
Dogs are welcommed, the restaurant is delicious.
Gerardo can Also help you for any travelers issues (vehicle, health, animals..)
Free bodyboards renting, free wifi (quite fast).
15 USD per vehicles (we were 5 in a 25 feet RV).

Super coin , tranquille et très mignon et en complète sécurité.
Très bien accueilli par le Gérant ( Gerardo Lopez, whatsapp 71084080).
Avec Piscine, Hamac, accès direct à la playa, possibilité de libérer des tortues selon saison.
Les chiens sont admis.
Le Restaurant est excellent.
Gerardo peu également apporter ses services pour les problèmes de voyageurs, véhicule, santé, animaux, problème légaux.
Prêt de Bodyboard gratuitement, wifi gratuit.
Prix par véhicule 15 dollars US ( nous étions 5), avec un camping-car de 7,5m.

name: Quinta Recreativa Cooperativa Los Pinos
description:
After ten km of track, and inaccessible to big rigs, a haven of peace. Toilets and water. $ 3 per night 
(update 15-05-21, the track is a bit narrow here and there, but I think it's doable for big(ger) rigs as well.) 
---
Après dix km de piste, et inaccessible au gros VR, un havre de paix.  Des toilettes et de l eau. 3 $ la nuit 

We paid $2 entrance per person (once) and $1 for each night of staying (the parking fee).

name: Key and lock repair! Best in town -
description: The place is on the other side from the parking which is shown in the coordinates. Very nice and helpful people

name: Liberté
description:
Between two walls a corridor that leads to the Pacific Ocean, a magical beach.  food and water in the village.  ---  Entre deux murs un couloir qui mène à l'océan Pacifique, un magique plage.
au village nourriture et eau.

name: Finca Canci - organic coffee traditional
description:
Beautiful coffee finca directed by a wonderful man: Juan Pablo Viaud.
He took us after luckily running into us when we were trying to take a picture of the beautiful Volcano just next to his finca from our rv. This finca has been in his family since the end of the 19th century. Juan Pablo is so generous and interesting as well as his finca!
If you’re around and want to meet a Salvadorian coffee farm as well a the process and the incredible views over the volcano, call him! He’s from time to time in San Salvador so you can message him: +503 7010 6468 (Whatsapp) or private message via instagram @chuchoefinca

name: Horizonte Surf Camp
description: Nice place with two swimming pools! (one on a balcony overlooking the beach!) Alot of parking space with lots of shade. Kitchen available and very good wifi with strong reach at the parking area. Restaurant out front of the beach if you don’t feel like cooking. We paid $8 pp for one night camping our van here. Don’t know how much a dorm or room will be. Very nice place :) Would recomend!

name: street next to Wendy's
description:
It was late and traffic in the city was bad. We asked permission to stay in both Texaco and Puma gas stations across the street but were turned down. You can technically stay at Puma but quoted us $5/hr to stay the night. While they were polite, this was too much to justify a gas station stay. 

Wendy's also said we could not stay in their parking but that this street is safe. We talked to them and after a while they suggested this street, and that we can come in and use their restrooms. We ended up ordering some food and staying to use the free WiFi in the cold air conditioning. 

The location is the street on the drive-thru side of the Wendy's despite what the GPS coordinates may say. There are both businesses and residences on the street. Quiet at night, no one bothered us. Also worth noting that there were security all night for the Wendy's, and he said not to worry that he would also keep an eye on us. He did not ask us for money. Free. 

If you are out of options, this could work for one night.

name: El Carmen Parking (Eddie's Place)
description: Overnight parking, including running water, ample spaces, nice climate, clean restroom with cold shower,  petrol station nearby, safe area, access to electricity, mechanical help and parts, fenced in secure installation, phone number is (503)75068896 and (503)78776244.  Eddie or Irene.

name: Los Naranjos tree house
description:
Wonderful place. No camping. People are so nice. Tree house is so unique.
Unique place up on top of mtn facing two volcano.

name: Cat House
description: Cat House is a small hostel, you can find it on booking.com. The owner is very friendly, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. We payed 30$ per night. You have an optional big and delicious breakfast. The owner offers also tours to all the attractions of the country. He also offers uber or pick you up at some place. There is also a laundry available. TV and air condition in the rooms.

name: Mirador Espiritu de la Montaña
description:
Here at the gate you pay $5 per vehicle to access the mirador.

Bikes and people on foot don’t pay.

name: Max Block - Covid Test - Condomínio Clínicas Médicas
description: Here is where you can take your covid test to continue your journey. Max Block - Covid Test - Clínicas. There’s parking $1/h next to it, and another parking in front.

name: Pelicano Surf Lodge
description: Simple surf shack. Rooms upstairs. Has food and beers. Quiet. On the beach. Sand floors downstairs. Secure motorcycle parking for up to four bikes. Overland truck parking for mid sized rigs, which can use bathrooms, showers etc. No hookups. $8 bucks in high season. Can use the kitchen if needed. Secure and quiet outside of El Tunco.

name: Puerta del Diablo
description:
Puerta del Diablo is a cliff side hike with free parking! 
There are three hikes on either side. They have nice views of the coast, lake, volcanoes and the capital. They have no shade at the top so it’s little sweaty and steep but not far. Doable in 20 minutes, with a big reward. 
During the civil war executions were held here. There are many other urban legends about the place as well. 
There’s some lil food shacks with pupusas, riguas, the usual fried stuff and drinks below the hikes. 
We went on a Sunday, it wasn’t too crowded but it’s a popular spot for sure. 
We had pupusas in Parque Balboa and it was super tasty!

name: Pupuseria La Ceiba
description:
Simply the best pupusas in town. Very popular among the locals. It can especially be bussy during weekends at dinner time. 
Try a rice and mais pupusa with the same toping to taste the difference.

name: Hotel Primavera
description:
Medium clean hotel which have seen better times. They had a bigger 3p room for $30 and a smaller 2p room for $25, we negotiated it easily down to $20 but we could only use the AC between 6pm and 8am. Cold showers, average wifi. 
It looked like they didn't expect costumers. They had to search for the key and the bed linen was not changed yet.
Height limit for entrance, only small vans can fit.

name: Berlín Main Square
description:
We asked if we could camp somewhere (the hostels/hotels did not welcome tents when we asked) and the *Alcaldía* offered us a place in the main square (by the public bathrooms) or by the basketball field by the mirador (steep steps going down). We decided to chill at a pupuseria/café and waited until the town got quieter to set the tent (around 7pm)

The square has a few functional sockets where you can charge your stuff.

name: Quelepa Camping inside community center
description:
We wanted to camp around this area (Moncagua/Quelepa). We got to the town around 3pm  (15 minute bike ride from Moncagua. We took a beautiful quiet dirt road. You can also take the highway from Moncagua)

Where to camp: we asked the Alcaldía and they offered us the Casa Comunal - it’s a big community hall. It’s covered and we slept inside, very well ventilated.

There is no *shower* but there is a bucket and water. So, we took a shower and it was perfect.

There are a lot of sockets where to charge your things

This place offered us a lot of privacy. We had such a good rest ! People at the alcaldía were super friendly

Food: we got some snacks veggies and more food at the small super market by the alcaldía.

name: Hotel La Estación
description:
Very nice clean room for $35. Two big beds, old but functional cable tv. The internet is strong (we made sure to ask to please be placed closer to the router as we wanted to make sure the WiFi was as stable as possible). We work on the road and this hotel was a good option. 

The room is big and has a private bathroom, mini fridge and AC. We put our bikes inside the room and had a great night of sleep. 

Plenty of soap and water to do sink-laundry. Our stuff dried in 2hrs. It’s so hot in la union !

Food - we went to Pupuseria Martitha, a 5min walk from the hotel. They also had nice licuados. I could not it to iOverlander

name: COVID19 - Antigen
description:
This lab does the antigen test. 

It’s a cash only lab. Solo efectivo. 
PCR $50

The lab is open 
M-F 6am - 2pm
Saturday 6:30-12
Sunday closed

name: Copies/Printing (Foto Nelson)
description: To make copies of TIP and passport etc on the way to Frontera. I also had them make a copy of my driver license. Great service. They have Whatsapp number +503 6162-9814. parking lot across tge street

name: Next to the Lake
description:
Super wide place, many spots to camp.
The lake is calm, ideal for relaxing and bathing. Accesses all paved super easy to get to.
Here they sell fresh food and food, they also sell a lot of fish in case they want to cook.

In terms of safety, it is very healthy and safe, we have spent Saturday and Sunday where there are more people and we have been weekdays where there are less.
The police are very friendly and often drives by.
We camped 5 days. a real gem!

IMPORTANT
It must be taken into account that in the rainy season the lake grows and all the green part disappears and remains under water, which makes it difficult to find a place to park. In May the rains begins, I just don't know for how long


All public. FREE!


lugar super amplio, muchos spot donde acampar. 
el lago es tranquilo, ideal para relajar y bañarse. accesos todo pavimentado super fácil de llegar. 
aquí venden frescos y comida, también venden mucho pescado por si quieren cocinar.

en cuestión de seguridad es bien sano y seguro, hemos pasado sábado y domingo dónde hay más gente y hemos estado días de semana dónde hay menos. 
la policía es bien amable y pasa bastante. 
acampamos 5 días. una verdadera joya! 

IMPORTANTE
hay que tener en cuenta en en época de lluvia el lago crece y toda la parte verde desaparece y queda bajo agua, lo que dificulta encontrar un lugar donde parquear. en Mayo empiezan las lluvias sólo no sé hasta cuando . 


todo público. GRATIS!

name: Small comedor w cold drinks
description:
Cold drinks and hammocks to chill. Very simple but nice place before the hectic comedores by the border. 

We got a soda, chilled on the hammocks and ask if we could get some tap water to fill up our bottles (we have a UV light to sterilize it:) - the owner was super kind. You can also buy cold bottled water if you wish

name: scenic 4x4 trail
description: Scenic drive between the Santa Anna and the lake. Crossing coffee plantations with various view points.

name: Velvet Hostal
description: This is a great little place to come and relax. The man that works here is very helpful and breakfast included. Clean, we paid $25 with breakfast. Secured motorcycle parking, no RV parking. Family friendly, close to everything.

name: Great Italian food! Piccolo Giardino
description: This is a nice place worth recommending. Actual wood oven, thin crust, not with extra sugar in the dough, and reasonably priced, situated in a nice green garden. We didn't try the other dishes, but they have a good menu with other Italian dishes.

name: El Eden
description:
Little camp site run by a very nice family. They have 2 cabañas for rent and some grassy area to pitch the tent. Although we were only camping for 1 night they let us use the shower in one of the cabañas.

It's not so easy to find. On Google Maps you see the point only if you search for the name. Also, roads are not correctly displayed in Google Maps, so the navigation isn't quite right. You need to leave the main road at Hotel Santa Leticia, follow the unpaved road until a big gate at the end and turn left into a smaller road. You will pass Sol & Primavera and see the sign of El Eden. (See pictures for direction)

name: Restaurant Brisas de Santa Mónica
description:
Restaurant at the lake with pool, picknick tables, toilet and a shower by the pool (not private though). Very nice yard, not very crowded on a Saturday afternoon.

First they wanted 10 USD per person for camping in the yard but later they were fine with us just having dinner in the restaurant. Everybody was very nice, they allowed us to use to pool at night and came several times to check if we're okay. Let us put the tent wherever we wanted. 

There was a private birthday party in another part of the restaurant with loud music and kids playing around. But this one ended abruptly at 10 pm. After that very quiet, many birds to be heard in the morning, traffic noise is very low.

They have quite a big parking lot where you probably will be allowed to park at night. The whole area is fenced and guarded day and night.

name: Walmart
description: All the delights of Walmart. I did not stay overnight, I am guessing the car park is locked up out of business hours

name: Parking available in a safe area for travelers
description:
Parking available in a safe area for travelers. We know that it is difficult to find a safe place to spend the night in the car or caravan.
with the possibility of having a coffee. NO CHARGE. That to help the traveler  the parking lot is in front of me --- Parqueo disponible en zona segura para viajeros. sabemos que es difícil conseguir un lugar seguro para pasar la noche en el auto o caravana. 
con posibilidad de tomarnos un café. NO SE COBRA. Eso lo para ayudar al viajero

el parqueo es frente a mi 🏡

name: Laundry service
description: Laundromat owned by a young, friendly and hard working couple. Open 7 days a week, from 8am till 5pm. Drop it in the morning and you will have clean dry and folded laundry that afternoon. .90c per pound. Fast, cheap and efficient! Highly recommended!

name: Board repair Yepi
description:
Small repair shop right on the beach at Las Flores.
Yepi is super friendly and helped us out right away.
1 ding, 1 crack of 20cm and some small crack was usd25 in total.

name: Cabañas los Asoles
description: Asked here after asking at the termales. They want $20 for camping on the car (probably negociable) or $40 for a cabana with breakfast included (2 people). Didn't stay because we needed wifi or cell service and we couldn't get either here. other than that it looked nice and has a little restaurant.

name: Entre Nubes
description:
Super friendly owners ( Ivania & Daniel) welcome travellers with open arms. They allowed us to pitch our tent in the private fenced off garden where the peacocks live… we planned to be here for a night or 2 after crossing the border from Guatemala ended up stay much longer! On the second night it rained real hard and they invited us to stay with them at their house… we ended up staying at their house for 5 days, doing day trips from there! 
It was a fantastic experience. There is plenty of room for campers and medium size rigs you might even be able to get a big rig in there.
We were shown the entire property, they have hot showers, probably can sort out some power. We paid $10 per person including breakfast.
Ivania and Daniel were super hosts! Definitely swing by this place even if it is just to have a coffee or a meal. They both speak very good English.

name: Cadejo brewing Co.
description:
Good restaurant / brewery with a decent selection on beers on tap and a menu covering all tastes. The view over the ocean is awesome, they have a fresh and seawater swimming pool open to clients (must spend over $15 per person)
Good place to stop for lunch or smash a few decent cervecitas

name: Pueblo Viejo
description: One if not too many places to stop for a feed! Nice view, big outdoor terrace… simple.

name: Taller Moto del Cuco
description:
Humble motorcycle shop, they also work on cars but only have a small floor jack. They fix tires as well.
They have a concrete slab fairly covered ( sun & rain) that fits a rig the size of a VW Van. You can fit an autobus in the back if you want to but it's on compact dirt, no gravel.
I slept there 4 days fixing my van as I have my own tools but they have tools on site and a stick welder.
Bathrooms, showers, little kitchen that cooks food for people passing by, some fluids and random small parts supplies in the shop.
If you need parts delivered from San Salvador or San Miguel, contact C807 Xpress, they deliver for cheap 3 times a week I think.

name: Parking Lot (Shaded and Peaceful)
description:
Possibly the best place to park your vehicle (and overnight) when visiting the town. Parking lot is shaded and peaceful. Owner, Jose Hernandez, is a super friendly guy.

Surrounding the parking lot perimeter are tiny homes housing small families, so there is a nice community here.

Gate is tall enough for big rigs. We were 3.2m high and absolutely no problems. See picture for reference. Longer than 23’ might have problems making the turn into the parking lot, however. 

We did not sleep here but paid $2 for the entire day. Did not get an overnight price, but it can’t be expensive.

Bathrooms and shower available. Water also available.

name: Casa #34 block E
description:
Hello to all travelers by car, the place that I show is my house, it has 2 parking spaces for cars that do not exceed more than 2.50 cm, I can offer some services inside my house and negotiate the price.  I would like to help all travelers and help in whatever they need.

name: Centro Veterinaria La Mascota
description:
This is probably the most established, ritzy vet in San Salvador. Seems all the rich locals take their pure breds here to get vet care and grooming (yes, there is a very busy grooming salon here).

We gave our cat a rabies booster and a microchip for $72. Definitely not the cheapest but this place is professional and speaks English.

name: Water Fill Machine
description: $1.25 for a 5 gallon refill. Machine is right next to the entrance of the Mr. Donut shop.

name: Condominio San Blas
description: Hand washing station with three taps, conventional hose threads on each one. Non potable, but clean with good pressure. We used it to fill our shower tank and no one bothered us, the nearby guard approached but was curious and friendly.

name: La Guitarra
description:
Small private cabins feet from the beach. Shaded by a beautiful tree canopy.
$35/night 
Decent WiFi 
Secure parking

name: AST Surf Hotel
description: Ocean front room, including breakfast for $95. Gorgeous views from my room and the restaurant/bar at the top. Very friendly staff. They don't have a dedicated motorcycle parking but they let me park inside of a restaurant next door after it closed down at 9pm. A big curb to get in but nothing an adventure bike can handle. They have laundry service if you ask. Nice neighborhood around. Out and about drinking beers.

name: Parque
description: It is super nice place. Parking lot big enough for 3 big caravan . We paid 10 dollar for night. They have toilette . Fresh water . We didint use so I am not sure it is included. You need to ask . Safe place . Owners are so friendly . They have dog but dog is so friendly to . I am surprise no one was here before  . This place is amazing . You can see Volcano and sea  . If you want visit stuff 8 km has nice place for visit and eat . Volcano , river , chruch on the beach and sea you can see .

name: Taquilo
description: Many restaurants around. And parking lot for many cars . You can consume some (food, drink ) and you can stay here during the night. Nice place. Google does not show the road . So you need to turn after bridge if you are coming from el zonte.

name: Playa punts chiquirin
description:
After to visit amazing Espíritu de la Montaña , We come to this beach for past the night . Nice calm beach . You can drive till to beach . Try to stop before the sinked in  . Village is calm . Mostly fishermen. We pass the night without problem before the border . They have nice view . Green building is restaurant. They have nice shrimps and fish . They said „ be carefull don’t go far at the sea , it has some current“. 
We spended night almost everythings open at the car  . In the Morning 4 o’clock they started to do kraket. Other than this is was super calm 
( please consider that I have two dogs and my house is big artego . We looks intimidating )

name: Dentist - Clidente
description: if you ask for Doctor Olga - she is a very good dentist and reasonably priced. You will need to know some basic spanish. I tried other dentists here and they aren't as good. there is parking in the complex but I didn't see a guard there. it's easy to get here with uber just search for clidente. The clinic is in the upstairs part of the complex, on the main road side. They practice good hygiene.

name: Cuscatlan ATM 24/7
description: ATM 24/7 built into the side of the building. Street parking for easy access

name: El Pelicano
description:
Officially a place for events. But when there are no events they let people camp there. Big roofs to put your tent or van under.
Price 5 dollars a person. Simple and basic, probably the cheapest way to stay in Cuco.

No wifi, but Claro connection. Flush toilets and showers. Restaurants and small shops on walking distance.

name: Sea Garden Mizata
description:
Beautiful place by the sea, nice views, super friendly people, free camping with food or beverage purchase.

Big menu, local food and amazing jalapeño pizza, fair prices.

Totally recommend.
Enjoy the place.

name: Start of the walk to the antennas.
description: Take path on the right between two trees. No sign posted, walk on tight dirt track up.

name: Analiza Laboratorio (covid test)
description: You can get covid test for borders here, Analiza have many other locations. Bring your passport. US$25 each. They email results afterwards.

name: Nahui Hostel
description: Nice little cinder block hotel/hostel.  Rooms are simple cubes but have a bed and a fan.  Secure parking right outside our room.  Easy for bikes or a small car, not big enough for most vans.  20$/ night gets you a mattress, cold shower and decent wifi.

name: Coconuts field between sea and river
description:
At the end of an easy sand path, we found this nice coconut field. We asked the first shop they were so nice and told us it’s safe, and they stay here for the night too.
100m after there is à local chill restaurant, food is good and they told us we can Park just neer the restaurant… (we stayed at the first place)
Here you can chose to swim in the sea or in a river just near (no so clear but ok)
They may have lot of people here during week end and holidays.

name: Restaurante y Cocteleria “Julita”
description: Nice and friendly restaurant. We were allowed to camp with our tents for free, if we buy something from restaurant. Prices are like on mainland. Driving here requires 4x4 and some skills as approx 1km is pure sand. So not for big rigs. One can also come with local banana boat from mainland.

name: Finca Macedonia
description: Found this restaurant with a camping area on the Ruta de Panoramica. It was probably some of the best hospitality I have had in a while. The owner Brenda speaks very little English but loves practicing with you. There are clean toilets plus she let us use the hot shower in the cabaña that is currently being built. The bathroom in the cabaña is probably the nicest bathroom I've used in all of Central America.  Brenda also gave us 2 big bags of her coffee that she grows and roasts herself as well as offered to take us to the beach at the lake if the road was in good condition. It sadly was not that day so we didn't go. There is a large grassy area where you can pitch a tent with swings. The pupusas and yuca Frita at the restaurant are delicious. I didn't look at the price breakdown of my bill but for the food, two drinks and the camping for two people it was $24. She also said that there usually is wifi but the router wasn't working that day.

name: Laboratorio Lopez - COVID Test
description:
$25 antigen test on the way to the border, results in 10 minutes.

Avenida central local #22 frente a comer el Cristal, Cara Sucia, El Salvador.

+50376374376, lopezlaboratorio75@gmail.com

name: Photocopia
description: Good place to get Photocopies before heading to the border. 10c/copy, double sided available

name: Cadejo Brewing Company
description: One of the 3 cedejo breweries in this town, located in a paid parking lot with guards. I attached a picture of the beer list with prices but in case you don't have internet it's 4.35 for an actual 16 ounce pour in a proper pint glass. and they have a 23 oz pour for 5.50. food was fairly priced and quite good. they validate your ticket for the first hour. otherwise it was a dollar per hour to park. this shopping area also has the nicest grocery store we have been in since the USA. definitely worth a stop for both!

name: muffler internationales
description: after 20k km's our exhaust on our van had really taken a beating and was literally hanging on with tape and bailing wire. we ended up at this shop that was tall enough to accommodate our 2.8m tall van. the height limit here might be 4m. I showed up without calling, expecting to order parts for a later install, and thanks to a guy that spoke enough English to help me describe what we needed we came up with a game plan and they actually had everything I needed in stock and started on it right away. they cut out several feet of my damaged DIY exhaust on both sides and installed new pipes with new mufflers and hangers. took a couple of hours, naturally, and only cost 320 dollars, for both sides (true dual exhaust)! really quality work with mandrel bends and actual MIG welders, not some hoopty booger welds from a stick welder.  this place also specializes in radiator repair and maintenance if you need that too.

name: Playa Mueludas, next to fishermen boats
description:
Beautiful quiet and good spot to spend the day and night, you can easily swim here, just watch out for jellyfish if you go far away!

After a night at the Rancho Clemente next door, we spent the day here and met some really friendly locals (all the family is living around here)
They told us it's very safe to spend the night here, just watch for the tide if fullmoon. 
They will probably come to you and speak with you, a lot of childrens and the granfather is a fishermen.

name: VEGA’S GRANDPA HOTEL
description:
Amazing Hotel (hostel style with big common kitchen and dining space).  Tall vaulted ceiling in the rooms with private bathroom and shower.  Beds are only ok kind of old. Nice and clean facility. Super chill central courtyard with room access around the yard.  Lots of birds. Lots of lounge chairs and a hammock. 
25$ pp/ per night for a private room with A/C.
My room had two queen beds.
Good take. I enjoyed it.

name: Coyote Restaurante
description: good pizza

name: Albani@
description: Can't believe this place is not marked here yet... Zip lines, labyrinth made out of pine trees, good food and drinks. Nice place to stop when driving ruta de las flores...

name: Clínica Veterinaria Asís
description: We were looking for a vet for health certificates for crossing into Honduras and Nicaragua. There weren't any iOverlander pins for vets in the city so I googled and found this one near by. +503 7751 5315 for the WhatsApp to schedule an appointment, but they were able to get us in the same day and we only waited for a few hours. they gave us color originals for each country and a black and white copy each. 15 dollars for each dog for a health checkup. the vets in San Salvador wanted 78 each! the main vet there was able to speak English with us to explain everything.

name: Max Bloch
description:
Clinic in San Miguel doing covid PCR tests. requires making an appointment online beforehand. $100 bucks. Very small outfit but not busy at all. In and out in less than 10 minutes.

It's not the only clinic - they also do it at the hospital but it's more expensive, now the price of the PCR is 70usd. no need for appointment online.

name: Cadejo Brewing Company
description: A popular brewery in central America that offers good beer and better food. a bit on the pricey side at $4.50 for a pint and entrees around $9-14 but it's all delicious. this place is up a flight of stairs on the second floor. A large outside area available on the patio, but also a large indoor area in the AC.

name: Great view point of the Laguna
description:
You can reach this view point by a small trail which is marked on ioverlander. I uploaded a picture from the beginning of the trail.
You don't need to hike up all the way to the antennas to see the whole Laguna:) To get to this point it's 15 minutes uphill.

name: Mira Mango
description: Super nice spot right in front of the point — for 10$ you get a shower and a bathroom. They also have small cabinas and hammocks for rent. Fresh breeze and no mosquito! Friendly cat that will come hang with you for sure too

name: Only ATM in El Cuco area
description: As of when I posted this, this is the only ATM in the area different from what Gmaps may say. Right in the front of a small tienda. Plenty street parking right in front.

name: Puma Oriental - ULSD
description: Ultra-low sulfur diesel (ULSD) named Ion Diesel available.

name: MAR-AJAI
description: Enrique’s place it’s a local bohemian house where you can stay for a few day just with a small contribution for the mantainance of the place. It has everything you need for a rest next to the beach ( just a few steps )

name: Parking
description: We arrived at 3pm and paid $5 for the afternoon and night.  The car park is closed and access to enter and exit on foot is through the hotel, which is on the corner of the street.  Everyone was very nice.  The night was very quiet.  You are right in downtown Santa Ana.

name: Valvoline
description: We drained our Ford F250.  Very professional, quick and kind.  Change oil filter, oil and air filter.

name: Texaco gas station
description:
Esta es una gasolinera amplia con parqueo en la parte de atrás, es gratis, tiene agua y servicios sanitarios. Al principio dijeron que no era permitido quedarse, pero como nosotros pedimos permiso entonces que sí podíamos. Hoy nos contaron que otros viajeros se han quedado aquí. 

This is a big gas station with parking in the back. It has restrooms, water and it’s free. At the beginning they said it wasn’t allowed to stay for the night, but as we asked for permission the would allow it. Today morning another safety guard told us that more travelers have stayed in the past.

name: lavanderia lava Rapido
description: lavanderia, wash and dry for 6$ per laundry.

name: Taller Emmanuel Mecanica General
description: Big shop with full lifts. We only had our oil changed here ($45 including oil and filter), but we had some questions about our squeaky belt and they were helpful and not pushy at all. They have good reviews on Google. Spanish only. At the end of the side street there.

name: Columpio Buena Vista
description: Amazing swing out over the valley. $3 per person. Worth the trip out just for the photo, but there are basic facilities including washrooms and camping.

name: Mirador Rio Chicito
description:
Super friendly hosts. The owner Jose is almost finished building a cafe (should be done August 2022) that reaches out over the hillside. INCREDIBLE view. Flat parking for a few vehicles. Jose speaks English. 

New basic washrooms. No showers. Power available (basic 110v). No WiFi (yet) but solid Tigo signal. Probably pet friendly but I didn't ask.

Probably not big rig friendly - narrow entrance, low cables over entrance (2.6m maybe?), and the road up to the village is stupid steep.

Not a long term spot but great for a night or two. He originally asked $4 for two people for the night, but that may increase. We were his first guests and we just showed up randomly. Once he gets things organised properly, it may be a bit different. 

Call in advance to check availability +503 7557 1459.

name: El Chele
description:
Super friendly and welcoming family which owns a restaurant directly on the river. They saw us on the road under a palm tree and invited us to camp on their property for the night. They put us in front of the swimming pool and filled it for us! They offered us food every day (amazing fried fish)!
All free just in exchange of some help with little things (clean the dishes, the fish, the floor). They like to welcome travelers and spend time together.
It's a paradise, please respect it and be kind!

name: Comedor Joanna
description:
we stay here for the night very nice quiet and safe place 2 min walk from the beach we park with ford e350 they have enough place and they have a restaurant also the owner tell us that she can connect us with surfboard rent and lessons
the owners name is Idalia 
+503 70627568

name: comedor
description: Right next to the fresh juice place, right in the center

name: Beachfront
description: At the end of the road you can access the beach directly with the car. The sand was hard today, but be careful if only on 2wd. Local fishermen are friendly and said no problems to stay. Safe and free.

name: Playa Poza Verde
description: Beautiful spot right on the lake. Free. There are plenty of palapas around that you can use for free as well. Local fishermen sell talapia at the end of the road. The road to get here is unpaved, a bit bumpy and a bit narrow in some spots, no 4wd needed. Big rigs might find it a bit hard.

name: Just a street
description: Literally just a road that ends on the beach, nothing more. Nice houses for rent around, we spent a quite night here. Good if you don't find anything else. There is another more grassy road like this one a bit further down the street, with also a bit more shade.

name: Hotel Pacifico Dorado
description: This place is amazing. It has 17 rooms for rent, 3 swimming pools, a restaurant and a bar. Family oriented with wifi available. Very private and safe with locked gates at night. There is also an area to park an RV. I have a truck and trailer which is 40 feet in length and the spot was long enough for both. Owners Claudia and Carlos are welcoming hosts and Claudia speaks perfect English.

name: Auto Quick Repuestos
description: Auto Quick it’s a part store where you can ask for a part of your vehicle or hydraulic hose and also cable auto parts. You can also have advice of a vehicle failure by phone. They speak English and Spanish. Have free water and all type of lubricants for vehicle.

name: Laguna de Apastepeque
description:
Parking at the restaurant El Acapulco overnight free and quiet. 
The people are friendly and the kids too.
We bought fresh fish $2.50 dollar (pound) 
Coca cola $1 dollar 

There is access the lagoon from the restaurant. 

En el estacionamiento del Restaurante el Acapulco pasamos 1 noche  tranquila. 
La gente del restaurante son muy amables, los niños son simpáticos y curiosos. 
En el restaurante compramos pescado fresco a $2,50 dlls la libra. 
Cocas de 350ml $1 dólar 

En el restaurante hay bajada para bañarse en la laguna.

name: Pinar camp free
description:
very good place for camping, safe and quiet
---
muy bien lugar para camping, seguro y tranquilo

name: Taller Durán
description: great mechanic, was able to identify the strange noise my car was making super quickly. changed a crossjoint and 3 ball joints on my chevy silverado. was able to stay in my camper during the whole time. only downside is that there is no roof, so when it rains they stop working.

name: Restaurante la Campiña
description: large restaurant with direct access to the sea and swimming pool and rooms for cheap rent and excellent traditional cuisine of the region, the brothers who own the place and if you tip are very friendly and helpful, large doors, for any size of vehicle, that are closed during the night safely, I was here four nights very comfortable

name: Mirador El Peñón de Comasagua
description: Very nice place just in front of Peñón de Comasagua. You have toilet, showers, and parking. Impressive view!

name: wifi big pretty papusaria with street parking
description: papusa place with wifi and parking on the street. pretty and secure with fans blowing air

name: Parking spot next to Cadek Cafe
description:
Safe parking lot across the street from Cadek Cafe, owned by a very nice couple, Caty and Edwin, that runs the cafe. Normally the rate is $1/hr, but if you talk to Caty, she will give you a "traveler's rate" of $6 for the day and $2 for the night. 
Parking lot hours are from 7am-6pm. After 6pm they lock the gate, but they live next door and they can open upon request. We felt very safe and we we're the only ones parked there during the night so we basically had our own fully fenced backyard.

name: Hotel Mado
description: Clean hotel with a big and secure parking lot. We spent one night here before crossing the border. One of us slept in a room (25 USD) and the other two in the campervan (7 USD). You can find de phone number of the hotel in google!

name: Rancho el pacifico las tunas
description: We spent the night in this restaurant, the door closes at 6pm, they let us stay for $15 and be able to use bathrooms, pool and everything the place has, it is very safe and quiet, they have good speed wifi, the place is in front to the sea with a good view.  very friendly people, toilets are not clean.

name: Mirador Puesta del Sol
description: Very nice place to have a good rest and night you can camp and have a good dinner. Very secure and nice people in the place. You can contact with Juan +503 73645895

name: Hotel Don Luis
description: rough road to get into may look sketchy at first. gated parking lot. modern. rooms and furnished bathroom. good wifi. 30usd. warm water. AC. great for the price

name: Stephanie
description: Nice place to have a good night with bathrooms and a pool. Big space for big cars.

name: Ichanmichen
description: Water park with several natural pools, you can enter with your car and find the best spot. You have bathrooms, parking and food. It’s recommended for week days as there are fewer people at the place.

name: restaurante miramar
description:
We ate dinner at this restaurant, they've got good seafood plates, a little pricy ($13-$20). the owners let us park and sleep in our van. they've got a cold water shower and a chlorine pool. great view over the ocean! 
there is wifi but we didn't get the password because we're not staying in their hotel.

name: Captain Morgan hostel
description: the owner let us stay at the small, gated parking for 2.50 pppn. we were free to use the hostel facility (pool, lounge area, showers, hammocks) it's right at the lake front!

name: taller de Volkswagen don armando
description: this guy has over 50 years of experience with classic Volkswagens. he helped us with an oil change and adjusting of the bolts. Speaks only Spanish, but knows what he is doing

name: Playa el Esteron
description:
Big, free parking space at the beach, next to police station. There are a couple of restaurants, (solar powered) lights, toilets, showers and electricity. All free! 
Asked the lady from one of the restaurant if it's safe, she said yes.
Some people drinking at night but they didn't bother us.

name: Entre Pinos Hotel
description: BEAUTIFUL find but a bit expensive (worth treating yourself to this place though).  We pulled in on a Sunday asking to camp in their parking lot (crossing into Honduras the next day) to which they nicely said yes (pull up next to the hotel entrance and an attendant will come over and check you in and collect your entrance/camping payment).  Once we parked in their lot the attendant came over and told us we had access to all of the grounds. He gave us a map (see photo) and had another attendant lower the chain to a road leading into the forest. We drove around a web of roads through beautiful areas they maintain well until we found a fantastic spot with amazing views of the mountains and valleys. There were a few families about who also paid the entrance fee to spend the day on the grounds - hiking, picnicking, hanging out with family.  They all left towards sundown and we had the entire expansive property to ourselves. There were horses wondering about, and cattle grazing the lawns at night.  Starry sky and quiet all night. There is a pool at the hotel and a restaurant (looked good, but we didn’t use them). We paid $25 for the night. No facilities once you drive into the “park”.  The coordinates are we we camped. Look up Entre Pinos Hotel in Google maps for the main entrance location.

name: Parque Calderon
description:
The owners allowed to camp in their parking, really nice people. 
Here is enough space to park any type of vehicle. 
Tap water is also possible.

name: Casa Garrobo
description: It's a hostal with camping option. 5$ for camping. 10 $ is price for dorm.

name: Shopping Plaza El Encuentro
description: New shopping plaza with all kind of shops: supermercado, fashion, optics, farmacy, medical clinic etc. Opened in 2022.

name: Hotel La Cobierta
description: We first went to the Rancho El Pacifico, where they strongly recommended not to stay over night because they have no security guard and the area is not considered very safe. So we moved to this hotel where we stayed on the grass in the shadow next to the pool. Agreed with the manager on 20$ per night including everything (electricity, pool, wifi).

name: Hotel villa Santo Domingo
description:
Hotel right in the city centre of Ataco. Secure parking for motorcycles and a few cars. 
Rooms are comfy, costs 35 usd per night. Private bathroom with  good hot shower.
Nice vibe around town and there are a lot of street food places around after sunset.

name: Finca Rauda
description:
Tourist place, Mirador de Cristal, various restaurants. Entrance fee per adult is $3.00 per person.
They also offer space for camping. cost of $5.00 per adult
----
Lugar turístico, Mirador de Cristal diversos restaurantes. costo de entrada por adulto son $3.00 x persona.
También  ofrecen espacio para acampar . costo de $5.00 x adulto

name: Jenny’s Pupusaria
description:
Great place to stop for lunch, we had 5 pupusa and 2 bottles of water and it was $5USD.
Friendly staff and great view of volcano.

name: Parabrisa
description:
Very Nice and helpfull family. You can ask for your parabrisa or polarisation (for sun).
Good price

name: garafon de Agua al mini Tienda
description: Small tienda where you can buy 20l of water in garafon. 7.50$ or 3.5$ if you poor it in your tank.

name: DHL Store
description: They won’t accept any drones to be send to Costa Rica in order to avoid Nicaragua. They checked the parcel.

name: Safe and quiet street parking close to the pools
description:
Very quiet, there is a place on a fairly wide level that is not in front of houses.  Very convenient to park the rv during your visit to the salt pools and for the night.  We cooked outside too.  Nobody at night since the pools closes at 6pm. Toilets, cold shower available before 6pm.
The parking attendant had allowed us to park for the night next to the fence that closes off their parking lot but we preferred at the end of the street.  Wider and quieter.



Très tranquille, il y a un endroit au niveau assez large qui n'est pas en face de maisons. Très pratique pour stationner le vr pendant votre visite aux piscines salées et pour la nuit. Nous avons cuisiné dehors aussi. Personne la nuit car les piscines ferment à 18h. Toilettes et douches froides disponibles avant 18h.
Le gardien du stationnement nous avait permis de nous garer pour la nuit à côté de la clôture qui ferme leur stationnement mais nous avons préféré au bout de la rue. Plus large et plus tranquille.

name: Taller y Torno Las Flores
description: Super mechanic. Welder. We lost our spare wheel up front the truck and the guy repaired it in an hour or so. Super friendly. Right after la libertad

name: super tienda Herrera
description:
You can buy garafons here to pour into your containers!  $2.25 for the 20l.


Vous pouvez acheter ici des garafons pour les verser dans vos contenants! 2.25$ pour le 20l.

name: Restaurante La Molienda
description: The restaurant La Molienda is very close to the Laguna of Apastepeque. a charming place well decorated with impeccable service and the food is a delight. The prices are very affordable. They allowed us to spend the night with our van. We had access to the toilet and the shower. Very safe as the barrier is closed every evening, very quiet. We recommend it Fatima 503 78865638

name: Restaurante la Molienda
description: A couple of an exceptional reception they hold a restaurant the Molienda very close to the Laguna of Apastepeque a charming place well decorated with an impeccable service and what to say more on the food a delight. The prices are very affordable.

name: Humpback Whale Watching Tours
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Contributed by owner, check-in for feedback

Thousands of humpback whales do their migration route along the salvadorian coast. specially over this beach spot, local tour operators offer whale watching tours from December to March which is the time of the year when they come alonmg. Contact for rates and availability +503-7447-7642 -calls or whatsapp (english-spanish) :)

name: Comedor y licuados Nohemy
description: Family restaurant very nice place very good food and fresh juice the daughter at the owners speak very good English

name: Rancho San Miguel
description: Very nice place quiet and friendly very safe 5$us per night

name: Asados del Campo
description: One of my favorite restaurants located in the city of San Miguel. Big parking spaces. Fresh meat a la carte. big portions. reasonable prices. No trucks allowed.

name: Museo de la Revolución de El Salvador
description: Museum about El Salvador’s civil war that has photos, bombs, tunnels, and parts of helicopters from the war. Our guide fought in the war and had lots to share. Sad but very worth a visit.

name: Rosy’s Place
description: A good spot just in front of the beach, there are bathrooms and shower you can also buy food and drinks. Big space for big cars very secure! And also has hammocks for rent. Recomended.

name: Propane Tomza
description: These are the coordinates for the back entrance. It is much easier (and safer) coming in and out from here than from the main entrance. Just take the little road until you get to an orange gate. Honk the horn and they will open.

name: Hostal Rio Mar KM 59
description: Yogi is the owner he speaks English very well and just opened this hostal. He offers 3 bedrooms, a shower, toilet and a communal kitchen. He also offers you to sleep in your hammock. It is very peaceful at an amazing surf break that’s uncrowded. Recommend!

name: Taller Calderon Automotriz
description:
I has a leak on my radiator. Carlos, the taller speak a little bit english and was very helpful and efficient. He had fix my problem in 2 hours for cheap. I recommend this taller if you are on the road (or before) from (to) Guatemala borders. 

Suites à un problème de radiateur constaté lors de notre passage de frontière avec le Guatemala nous nous sommes rendu à la première ville et avons trouvé Carlos, un super mécano qui nous a sorti une belle épine du pied ! Main d’œuvre 40$ pour env. 3h de main d’œuvre et 20$ pour la soudure. 

Son numéro : +503 7990 2099

name: Welcome friends with Daisy
description:
There are several places on the coast of El Salvador to camp for free when you talk to the locals. We needed a safe place to put our trailer and go exploring. This place is fenced in and has 4 small businesses: a very good restaurant with low prices, a local clothing store, a skateboard ramp and a fresh juice stand. In the back, there is room for several vans or motorhomes or like us, a trailer.
Be careful, water is scarce. There are days when there is no municipal water. So fill your tanks before. There is a drinking water distributor in the village where you can get some water by asking a restaurant/hotel. Electricity is ok. Several dogs in the village, very friendly that we let our dog free (with supervision!).
For 24 feet and more = for experienced drivers only and the only entrance to the village you can use is the one in front of the school = the 1st one in El zonte
--------------
Il existe plusieurs endroits sur la côte du El Salvador pour camper gratuitement quand vous parlez avec les locaux. Nous avons plutôt besoin d'un endroit sécuritaire pour y placer notre roulotte et aller explorer. Cet endroit est clôturé et s'y trouve 4 petits commerçants : un restau ultra bon à petits prix, une boutique de vêtements fait localement, une rampe de skateboard et un kiosque à jus frais. Dans le fond, il y a de la place pour plusieurs vans ou motorisé ou comme nous, une roulotte.
Attention l'eau est rare. Il y a des journées où il n'y a pas d'eau municipale. Alors remplissez vos réservoirs avant. Il y a un distributeur d'eau potable qui passe dans le village où vous pouvez vous dépanner en demandant à un restaurant/hôtel. Électricité ok. Plusieurs chiens au village, bien amical que nous avons laissé notre chien libre (avec surveillance !).
Pour les 24pieds et plus = pour conducteur expérimenté seulement et la seule entrée du village que vous pourrez utiliser est celle en face de l'école = la 1ere de El zonte

name: Gato’s Motorcycle Repair shop
description:
Gato is THE motorcycle guy you want to know in El Salvador. He personally rides two GS’s (f650 & 800) as well as motocross bike and many others over his lifetime. He’s been a moto mecanic his whole life and is super kind and honest. He will help you with anything you need. 

He is the person who organizes all the motorcycle events in El Salvador, the motocross competitions and competes himself in the GS trophy. 

If you want to do a training with him he also gives courses very affordable. He has a training field he can take you to or knows all the off-road tracks in the area and can take you for a ride or answer any of your questions. 

He also has access to moto supplies that most don’t bc when the Touratech store closed down in San Salvador they stored all the remaining merchandise in a warehouse that he has access to buy from. He was able to find me an adventure tire which I originally was told by others would not be possible to find in El Salvador. 

Amazing guy, do a training with him, even if you think you don’t need it, he’s great. 

His father is also a mecanic so their shop is a family affair, Gato has been riding motorcycles since he was 4 yrs old, they’re all wonderful. 

I’m not sure if he does cars but I believe his friend does and I’m sure he can put you in touch with the right person. 

He is @gato.vides on Instagram. 
Tell him Tammy, Mind Body Moto girl sent you :)

name: Better Pupusas
description: We were going to go to the main square (which felt more like a fishbowl with everyone staring at us), but a local recommended this spot, and we were not disappointed. A bit off the beaten path, but the pupusas were some of the best we've had. The women running the joint are very friendly and welcoming too. Plus apparently they grind their own corn instead of using corn flour.

name: Public beach access road
description: Public Beach access road, unlike most of the access around here this one is quite wide. The access is a bit sandy, so we parked our Van by the middle of the road behind a small old building on the right side. We wouldn't recommend to drive further with a 2wd due to the deep soft sand, 4wd would probably be able to go all the way to the beach. Locals seem to be friendly and no one bothered us. Great place to stop if you've just crossed the border into San Salvador.

name: Las Veraneras
description:
Superb stop on the road. It’s buffet style, you choose anything you want and they serve you. I’d say it’s mostly meat, but nonetheless more than enough veggie options, too. (Try their cebolla/ jalapeño mix!) 
Huge plate for 5$. 
Not sure about their opening hours, we got there during the week at around 1pm and it was full of locals.

name: Agua Purificada
description:
1$ for 5 gallons. 
It’s the green house on the very end (left corner if you are coming from the main road). 
Opening hours on google are not correct.

name: Cafe tito la ponta surf camping
description: Tito is taking care of this beautiful spot, there is a kind of abandoned house but lots of places to park. super tranquil, go to the end of the dirt road and stop at the green gates. 4107 is written on the pillar. Tito and his lovely dogs will come show you in. Bathroom available. Rustic camping. Electric possible. Just at the edge of the town of la libertad. $10 for one night. Tito can make you a delicious breakfast for $5.

name: Parqueo close to the Cuecas de Moncagua
description:
100 meters before the entrance of the Cuevas on the left side. Parkground shaded with lots of palmtrees, very clean and tidy. Owners allowed to park overnight. Toilets and even a clean cold shower are available. 
After closure of the Cuevas no traffic in this area.

Gate is closed at night, we felt very safe. Paid 5 $ to the nice owners.

In front if the gate you can eat delicious Purpusas.

name: Agua Distributor
description:
$1.50 to refill a garafon (20 L/5gallons) by yourself.
Located in the Maxi Despensa parking lot, at the entrance of the store on the right-hand side.

name: Las Casitas
description:
What a great place to stay.  Lovely little courtyard to hang out at night with a BBQ and fire.  Brenda is the host and speaks no English but is super attentive and lovely.  Gustav (might be spelt wrong) is the owner.  He lived in USA for a number of years and speaks perfect English. He has returned to look after the family coffee farm. He will give you lots of info on what to do in the area. Parking for about 4 vans or a number of motorbikes. No big rigs as street is narrow.
Cost was $32 for a double with private bathroom

name: Immigration and Customs Control Puente La Amistad
description:
new check-out point for TIP before border crossing into Honduras.

drive down the road and pass the truck waiting line to the „older check-point“. they will send you this way. drive into the round about and take the first right. you will see a big building with several lanes, a guy will direct you which way you have to take. (they redirected/parked us three times…). we passed (but NOT went into) a big scanner and parked on a big truck parking lot right next to it. there, an official checked our canceled TIP/insurance and asked us to come into the building for cancellation etc. but the officials there, went on a 20min break at 9am in the morning. so we had to wait. during that time four officials with a search dog came up and checked our car. the dog went inside and sniffed. a little surprised and scary, but the men were very friendly and asked questions such as: where are you from? where you go? etc. After the break: you hand over the original TIP and get a copy and asked for a second one, which was no problem. we than left and drove back to the roundabout to Honduras. 

to finish immigration check entry for honduras.

name: Hotel El Progreso
description: Cheap hotel, we paid $10 for 2 people (double bed). Very old basic rooms though, toilet in the room and bucket shower. Surprisingly decent WiFi and there is a fan. Weirdly there weren’t any signs outside the hotel but the sweet old lady owner came out to greet us once the dogs stopped barking at our bikes!

name: Playa Las Hojas Eco Villas
description:
Great place to spend a few days on an endless beach. Cabañas, pool, restaurant, very friendly and welcoming owner Gerardo. Level space for all kinds of rigs under palm trees next to the compound, 15$ /night, use of all facilities. Quiet, safe, beautiful sunset. Good seafood, not cheap, but worth it. Absolutely recommendable 
see also www.hojasbeach.com

name: Hotel la unica vista
description: Really nice place, lots of cabanas to rent and camping available in either a tent or van. Toilets and showers available. Games room and kitchen available. Peaceful spot with friendly staff. $6 per person per night in a van.

name: Pena Rajada
description: This is a hike to a giant rock which has been split in two.  There is a dodge hanging bridge that goes across the rock has great veiws from other side.  Says $3 but there is no one there to take money.  30min return from campground

name: El Pital Mirador
description: Mirador which is on the Honduras/ El Salvador boarder.  Come up from El Salvador great veiws.  There is a Comms tower up here.  There are two dogs behind fence the will bark alot at you just walk past them to get to the highest point.  Can camp up here as well

name: Hotel Guzman
description: This is an auto hotel /love hotel but for 2 weary cylists who just want to sleep its absolutely spot on. We arrived around 3.30 pm and agreed to pay $25 for the night. Big gates with plenty of parking. Very pretty building which they are just putting the finishing touches to the decorating. Friendly helpful staff. The son helped carry our pannier bags up. We were given 4 bottles of water which we really appreciated. Tepid shower but that was fine as so hot. Seems very quiet area. Few shops nearby. Big screen TV with Netflix etc. And for those wanting a little bit more, pipped music, 80s classics at the moment, flashing lights, and one or two little extras if needed😂

name: Waterfall
description:
We hiked from our camp at Rio Sapo, as we read about this. Found trail and will pin start point, mostly easy to follow until last couple hundred meters but follow your instinct to this pin.
Once here we see a trail coming from above with handrails but no people. 
Amazing pool for amazing swim.

name: Camping by the river Rio zumpal
description: Tranquil camping spot right next to the river. Pit toilet and water from the river. Picnic benches in the shade. Very peaceful. $5 per van and 1 person

name: Safe Day and Night Parking
description: Secure parking next to the cathedral. 24h guard, 3$ from 7 pm to 7 am (we came at 6 pm and still paid only 3$), toilets open - ask the guard for the key.  Ideal place in the center, usual noise for street parking, but bearable. Fee during the day 1$/h

name: Spare parts and Mechanics
description: One of the really good workshops and spare parts places we encountered so far. Very friendly and helpful, all kinds if repairs on all kinds of vehicles

name: SAMBO MAMBO
description: Hotel restaurant, chambres propres, bonne literie salles de bain climatisation, excellent Wifi, piscine, plages, personnels professionnels, tres bon service. 93 $ la nuit petit dejeuner inclus.

name: Villa Napoli
description: Same as the hotel pin, but I know I don’t always check hotel pins. Great place to stay overnight in the parking lot. You can read the hotel pin reviews for more. Very friendly staff and security guards, very clean bathroom open all night and FREE to stay! We had some food and drinks & coffee in the morning to help support. The front desk lady called her boss to make sure it was okay and he sounded happy to have us! Definitely recommend. Also great wifi and they let me work from the restaurant area which is beautiful!

name: Playa Dorada
description: Great spot to park in front of the cemetery. Two blocks from the river and the beach which was great for swimming

name: Grassy Parking "El Mango"
description: Place is a free grassy lot, which neighbours use for parking. We ask two neighbours If its okey staying and both very friendly say yes. It is very quite and we felt safe at night. In the morning it was really windy. It has very good view on the vulkanos. Caution : the bushes in the back of the lot cause serious rash !

name: Street parking near downtown
description:
I couldn’t fit my 33’ rig at the nearby parking on IOverlander, so I found this great spot, safe family oriented neighbourhood.
Lots of space, wide street, quiet and lit up at night!

name: La Concha
description:
Stationnement publique conseillé par les policiers. Nous y avons passé deux nuits et une journée complète avec deux vans. Très sécuritaire et l'accueil à été vraiment très chaleureux des habitants de ce village. Certains sont venus nous voir le premier soir pour nous souhaiter la bienvenue. Il y a des lumières la nuit.
Au parc central, de 5@9 il y a une dizaine de Pupuseria qui offrent de délicieux Pupusa pour moins d'un dollar! Quel village sympathique, à découvrir!
Parfait pour s'y stationner pour aller faire Montana Espiritu. 15$ par adulte, 7,50$ par enfant de 7 ans et moins. 1hde montée dans une boîte de camion. 
Départ à 15h, 16h@18h en haut et retour en bas pour 19h.
Quelques collations et breuvages disponibles pour achat en haut. 
Contact pour l'ascension de la montagne : Luis via WhatsApp : +503 7824-7766
Public parking suggested by the police.  We spent two nights and a full day there with two vans.  Very safe and the welcome was really very warm from the inhabitants of this village.  Some came to welcome us the first evening. There are lights at night.
 At the central park, from 5@9 there are about ten Pupuseria that offer delicious Pupusa for less than a dollar!  What a friendly village to discover! 

 Perfect for parking to go do Montana Espiritu.  $15 per adult, $7.50 per child 7 and under.  1 hour drive in a truck box.
 Departure at 3 p.m. and return for 7 p.m.
 Some snacks and beverages available for purchase uphill.
 Contact for the ascent of the mountain: Luis via WhatsApp : +503 7824-7766

name: Parque Recreativo Altos de la Cueva
description:
4$ par personne il y a quelques piscines, glissades d'eau, et douches! Super pour se rafraîchir près de la ville. Grand stationnement.

$4 per person there are a few pools, water slides, and showers!  Great for cooling off close to town.  Large parking lot.

name: parqueo aquatico
description:
Douches et piscines 3$pp.
Showers and pools 3$pp

name: Pupusa Store (traditional food)
description: They offer many different pupusas, which are traditional filled bread (like pide). they have a large section of vegetarian pupusas

name: Trail Head Santa Ana Volcano
description:
This is the trailhead to the Santa Ana Volcano. You can camp here with big motorhomes and tents. Tigo and Movistar 4G, Claro no cell.
It's behind some food stores, just past the first parking lot on the street, there is a way that leads into the wood at the left side of the first parking lot.
Guides are MANDATORY. 

On Sunday before 6PM they charge 5USD for overnight parking

name: Water tap at Walmart
description: easy water tap at the walmart parking lot

name: Balneario Las Veraneras
description:
A private ranch that belongs to Ector and his beautiful family, transformed into a “balneario” - a swimming pool with showers and picnic area in the coconut field - with rented cabañas that cost from 10 usd per night. 

We stayed here for a week and it was great, as the ranch is 5’ walk from the Barra de Santiago village and only 200 meters from the beach. You can ask Ector and he will be glad to let you park your van, camper or RV for a small fee (5-10 usd) per night. There is electricity, communal WC (very clean) and shower available and you can also use the swimming pool, which is cleaned almost daily. Into the ranch there is a cute mexican restaurant “El Chalesito Mexicano” that makes great tacos, burritos and hamburgers for 2,5-3,5 usd. We think this is the nicest affordable place to stay at Barra de Santiago and a perfect starting point to meet the founders of AMBAS association that protects the endangered turtles that lay their eggs on the 12-km long beach. Ask Ector to bring you in contact with his cousin Flora or Eder, the founder and the biologist of AMBAS and don’t miss the unique experience of participating in the liberation of new-born turtles. A small donation will always be welcome.

name: Parking in front of the police station
description: We slept on another place in the village, the police knocked and said it is unsafe there, bit we can sleep in front of the police station, so they brought us here. If you stay here, just go inside and ask the police.

name: Quiet field
description: We parked at this quiet field. No houses or people are around. Its quiet everytime. The road is bumpy, but doable with 2WD. Not possible with cars over 7m

name: real start for the hike to Ilamatepe(Santa Ana)
description:
This is the start of the trail if you are starting from Casa Cristal
------
Ceci est le début du sentier si vous partez de Casa Cristal

name: Taller Calderon
description:
Family garage, good mechanics, efficient and friendly!  Carlos and his son Carlos welcomed us very generously.  Brake cleaning and suspension check for $40, then we had suspension laces added to our Mercedes sprinter.  They are really resourceful.  They allowed us to sleep in the garage and provided us with toilets and electricity.  Located near the downtown market.
----------
Garage familial, bons mécaniciens, tees efficaces et sympathiques! Carlos et son fils Carlos nous ont accueilli de façon très généreuse. Nettoyage des freins et vérification de la suspension pour 40$, puis nous avons fait ajouter des laes de suspension à notre Mercedes sprinter. Ils sont vraiment débrouillards. Ils nous ont permis de dormir dans le garage et nous ont fourni toilettes et électricité. Situé à proximité du marché du centre-ville.

name: Mototech
description: BMW motorrad expert and evry motorcycle garage and parts

name: Laguna Aramuaca
description:
Abandoned tourist center. Safe and nice space under the trees. View of the Chaparrastique Volcano. Very close to San Miguel, good to escape from the heat of the city. There is no water or electricity, clean lake water
Weekday is quieter, only friendly locals

Update 24.12.2023: there is electricity on site but better ask before! 
......
Turicentro abandonado, seguro, buen espacio bajo los árboles. Vista al volcán Chaparrastique. Muy cerca de San Miguel ,bueno para huir del calor de la ciudad. No hay agua, no hay luz ni ventas. Agua del lago limpia. Día de semana es más tranquilo, solo locales amistosos

name: Playa La Tusera Wild Camping
description: Safe and quiet during the night, very welcome people, no facilities

name: Lorena Pastelería
description: Nice coffee place with air conditioning, good croissants and donuts. Wi-Fi [passwords are not allowed]

name: Hostal y Restaurante Las Lomas
description:
We cycled here so we could hike up the volcano. It has a few basic cabins from $25, toilets and hot shower.
Run by a very kind family (the owner speaks good English). We camped in the garden for two nights. Lots of chairs and tables as well as hammocks to hang out in, and a great restaurant.
Not sure if they would allow RVs.
Small shop next door.
Bus to the volcano trailhead stops right outside.
More details on their Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/laslomascerroverde

name: Puma gas station
description:
Spent the night here in a big car park with the buses before tackling the border in the morning. The night guard gave permission - he asked for $3, friendly enough that it was negotiable! it's around 40 degrees here by day in April. Sweaty!

Toilets and taps on the edge of the building

name: la cherada
description:
It is a small dining room with very well-cooked specialties: fish broth, tamales, meat. The boss is Argentine and very, very friendly. The prices are very affordable. I really recommend it.

es un comedor pequeño con especialidades muy bien cocinadas: caldo de pescado, tamales, carne.... el jefe es argentino y muy muy amable.  Los precios son muy asequibles. Realmente lo recomiendo.

name: Corral de Mulas beach front
description: Wild camping directly on the lonesome beach. Only the ocean and some palm-trees. Some gravel roads from Corral de mulas lead to this awesome beach. Be careful: You need a very good 4WD because it’s deep sand but fantastic! Haven‘t seen any people here for 3 days.

name: las sieste cascadas
description:
It is a 4-hour walk where you will enjoy nature 100x100 and where you do hand climbing
  They are 100x100 natural water springs
The walk is through mountain trails and coffee plantations, we see 10 waterfalls.
The price $15 per person negotiable...
He can take you back to your place, we are at the Don Alvaro farm.
The guide's name is Elisabeth (Gaviotita Adventure Tours). WhatsApp +503 6113 7277. You need to make the reservation 2 days before. the guide is great, he helps children and the elderly and takes photos. A mud bath (exfoliating) and a swim at the end in 2 pools in the caldera jets. to do absolutely!!!
---
Es una caminata de 4 horas donde disfrutaras de la naturaleza 100x100 y donde haces escalada a mano
 Son nacimientos de agua 100x100 naturales
La caminata es por senderos de montaña y plantaciones de café, vemos 10 cascadas.
El precio $15 por persona negociable...
puede te recuperar a tu lugar, nosotros estamos a granja don Alvaro.
el nombre de la guia es Elisabeth (gaviotita tours aventura). WhatsApp +503 6113 7277. necessite de hacer la réservation 2 dias antes . la guía es genial, ayuda a niños y ancianos y hace fotos. Un baño de barro ( exfoliante) y nadar al final en 2 piscinas en las chorros de la caldera.  para hacer absolutamente!!!

name: Centro Turístico Mundo Acuático
description:
Camped here while on a cycling tour. The place is a swimming pool with plenty of shaded spots where they let us camp for $6 per person. Toilets and cold showers left open for us to use overnight. 
Didn’t try the restaurant as it closed early but we were able to get some papusas from the restaurant down the road.
Large parking area where you might be able to stay in an RV if you can get it up the bumpy but straight track

name: Banco Promeca
description: Banco with ATM. $5.65 service fee. green sign.

name: unknown cafe
description: a small local food shop. we ask to park here and they agree.US$5 per night. has water input,no electricity.next to beautiful beach. I love it. they have electricity but we didn't use it

name: Mr. Fer Lavanderia
description:
Laundromat where you can wash your own clothes ($3.00 for the smallest washer, $4.00 for the medium size) takes approximately 25 minutes to wash hot.

Dryers start at $1.00.

You can bring and use your own soap/detergent.

name: Sistemas Agua Pura
description:
