Purified Water refill machine.
Fills 5 gallon jugs.
$1.25 for fill (only $1 and $0.25 accepted)

Located beside Mr. Fer Lavanaderia

name: Alison mechanic
description: Our RV start having radiator boiling trouble. this mechanic who speaks excellent English repair for us the problem. we saw him disassemble a whole engine and adjust when we seek his help. he charge me US$20 plus big bottle of refrigerant. we stay at his workshop with shower and toilet. we are so touch by his kindness & expertise.. el Salvador people are so happy and kind.. best mechanic i meet in El Salvador.

name: Despensa Familiar
description: Three ATMs outside and one on inside the store.

name: Roadside bar/restaurant
description:
A small roadside bar and restaurant. We are on cycle tour and asked to camp. Two young girls looking after the place, they were a little surprised but said yes. We paid $10 for both of us because everything on this coastline is $10pp minimum. You might be able to pay them less if you bought food, but we’re veggie so they had nothing to suit us. There was a basic toilet and there was a water tank from which we could filter water using our own equipment (you can buy bottled water until the bar closes).

When the bar closed around 5.30, we put up our tent on the upper veranda. Two men were around to watch the building. One of the men proceeded to get quite drunk, but he was thankfully harmless. The two men usually sleep in hammocks on the veranda, which we didn’t realise. If we’d known we would have put our tent up on the ground floor. But, saying that, no one bothered us and after a little bit of chat between the two of them there was barely any noise. Big trucks going past were noisy, but we had a surprisingly good night’s sleep. 

So yes, a mixed bag but we were happy enough due to a lack of cheap options in the area. The sunset was absolutely incredible.

name: Agua Express
description: Agua Express to fill your garrafón at the entrance of walmart. 1,25$ for 5 gal

name: Lavamatic Service
description:
Coin Laundry where you can wash by your own.
washmashine, dryer available. free wifi
monday to sunday 8am to 7.30pm

name: Lakeside
description: What a beautiful spot! There’s lots of open grassy space next to the river and lake to tent camp or park a car or camper. There was loud music at night, but we stayed here on a holiday weekend so it’s probably better at other times. It felt very safe and several locals stopped to chat and told us it was safe. Definitely would come back!!

name: La Posada Del Jefe
description: Small hotel, about 8 rooms available all on ground floor. It’s definitely a bit dingy because no windows, but it was clean and felt safe and very close to all the shops. We paid $22 per night for two people. There’s a sort of gravel courtyard with a picnic table and guests also have access to the host’s kitchen. The WIFI was okay, it worked but wasn’t super fast. The water in the shower was cold, but it’s so hot here that that’s great. The air-conditioner kinda worked. There’s an AMAZING pupuseria right down the street for super cheap prices.

name: Hotel Arizona
description: What a fabulous place! $25 for two people per night. Internet, air conditioning (that actually works!), and very clean bathrooms and showers. We’re so happy to stay here! There’s a beautiful terrace on the top floor with hammocks and tables. The whole place is very clean and in excellent condition. Totally would come back.

name: Rancho Tadajas RV Park
description:
RV parking, located in the municipality of Sacacoyo.
Quiet and safe place, water service, bathrooms, sewage discharge service.
We receive donations for your stay.
WhatsApp  +503 7020 9032
.....
Parqueadero para RV, ubicado en el municipio de Sacacoyo.
Lugar tranquilo y seguro, contamos con servicio de agua, baños, servicio de descarga de aguas negras.
Recibimos donaciones por tu estadía.
WhatsApp. +503 7020 9032

name: Casa loca
description: Casa loca are 2 houses. Each can accommodate between 2 to 7 people with plenty of beds and hammocks. They have private bathroom, kitchen and refrigerator. 200 meters from Punta Mango, they are located in a very wooded, airy and relaxing environment. Prices vary between 30 and 40 € per couple.

name: La Fragata
description: Nice hostel with all services, toilet, water, big parking area, food service, small pool. Beachfront place.

name: laguna de Olomega
description:
Area next to the park facing the lagoon. I could stay here for free. The people are so kind
____________
área al lado del parque frente a la laguna. se pude quedar aquí gratis. la gente es muy amable

name: "Oasis Park" Garita Palmera
description:
It's a peaceful site where you will find many coconut trees, water pool, rooms, hammocks, and cordial attention. You can pay for a night or stay for a day. Restaurant, electricity, potable water, pets and parking. It's a beautiful place for a rest. 
I'm sorry. The photos were taken at night.

name: Lavadero Municipal
description: Here is a public place where you can wash your clothes on your own. Local people use this place. Free.

name: By the Lake (gate entrance)
description: Huge public area by the lake. This coordinate is the gate entry, just open and follow the tracks. You can choose different spots by the lake. There is a little bit of plastic bags and other trash around, but you can find a nice and flat place. We slept two nights, no shadow, but fresh at night. Safe and public.

name: Dollar city
description:
If there is any little dollar store thing you usually buy in the USA or CANADA then you will find it here. It’s exactly like the same right down to where to find items on the shelves. 
Need toilet paper, paper towels, office supplies or garbage bags? It’s all here. 
We had fun and thought it was worth mentioning here for our fellow overlanders. The place is beautifully air conditioned too!! Bonus.

name: 7 Waterfalls Hike
description:
7 waterfalls hike. Park here in safety and hire our guide.
We parked here inside the gates of the last house on this road. The owner came out and said he would guide us for $20 USD. We agreed on $15. The hike took a few hours and we were so glad to have Julio César with us as there is no way we would have climbed those waterfalls and found our way without him.
Here is his phone #. 78331155

name: Rancho Los Cosme
description: Camping under a covered shelter oceanfront, across from the restaurant and pool.  Great for roof-top tenters or tents.  We paid for camping and that allowed us to use the washrooms, showers and the pool.  Golden, an El Salvadorian beer, cost just $1.50 and they were ice cold. The restaurant closes after dinner but they gave us access to the gate so we could use the bathrooms or go for an evening swim.  We had breakfast at the restaurant, very delicious and just $8 usd for 2 full typico breakfasts with coffee.  We had dinner at the restaurant next door, Rancho Carolina-well priced and delicious.  We paid $25 usd to camp for the night and you can't beat the views.

name: Public Access
description:
Public access at Laguna Coatepeque. It is not the best option but it is free!
Some simple restaurants around.

name: Puma
description:
This Puma gas station is more of A truck stop. There’s a new and clean shower building around the back plus new bathrooms and all are free of charge. They may start charging eventually but as of June 1, 2023 it was free. There’s lots of big rig parking for the night if you need that too. Enjoy!
There’s 3 stalls in the shower building which are most likely used by male truckers but I had my husband accompany me just to be safe and no one else came in. We filled our van tank from one of the water taps around the parking lot. Water looks a little cloudy so we won’t be drinking it until we run it through our Berkey but it’s fine for showers and dishes. 
You can also get gas here and the price is good. 

night parking 5$

shower 2$

name: Rainbow Slide at Picnic Restaurant
description: A food and fun park in one. A huge rainbow slide you ride down on an inner tube. A carousel, carved creatures, life-sized animatronic giraffes and elephants, a mosaic castle, artistic shooting water fountains, and lots of colored lights and LED displays. The giant slide is $5 whether you eat there or not. The steaks we're tender and flavorful, the sweet potato fries fabulous. All seating is outdoor picnic tables, each with sun shades. Lots of topiary, too.

name: Balneario Galeando
description:
Natural swimming pools
cold and fresh water
public place
Very Nice!

name: water before San Antonio  Masahuat
description: free drinkable water at taps along the road under the big cell tower

name: Near Sports Complex
description: Parking on flat area just outside the sports complex in San Rafael Obrajuelo. The sports complex has pools, showers, and toilets.

name: Brigada Misionera Global park
description: Flat parking next to a park and basketball court in front of the Brigada Misionera Global bldg. Big trees for shade. no facilities, but everything is nearby. A few cows parade through, no issues.

name: Lavenderia Oriental
description: clothes ready next day, $5.50/load plus detergent charge. two big loads cost us $13.80. Easy access.

name: Banco Hipotecario. No fee ATM
description: All Banco Hipotecarios in El Salvador will dispense USD without a transaction fee. This fee can be as high as $7.91USD at other banks. Max amount seems to be $500 USD

name: Costa del Lago
description:
Public parking next to the lake. We went to the campsite of the last option but they charged us 6usd and since we were only going to spend the night we preferred to stay here.

We asked a local and he told us that there was no problem that it was Public.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Estacionamiento público al lado del Lago. fuimos al camping de la última opción pero nos cobraban 6usd y como solo íbamos a pasar la noche preferimos quedarnos acá. 
Le preguntamos a un local y nos dijo que no había problema que era Público.

name: Rafael’s Cantina - Novotar Vasura Aqui
description:
There are very few hotels or campsites along this stretch and we we’re looking song daylight. This little restaurant/bar is perched on a fantastic spot to watch the sunset over the valley and lake, and caters to locals. After sunset it empties out quickly and no sign of the big speaker. We drove past and returned a few minutes later to find it all dark but Rafael came out and greeted us warmly and showed us he has space around the back to camp. Very friendly family and they would have cooked us dinner if we wanted. They brought out tables and chairs from the restaurant so we didn’t have to set up ours, gave us access to the baño overnight and let us set up camp. Then Rafael sold us beer and came for a chat.

Rafael’s English is quite good as he worked in Alaska on fishing boats for 5 years before coming back home to set up this business.

I asked him if he wanted other travellers like us overlanders and he said definitely to post this and invite others. Cost of stay was $10 US. View over the valley was amazing.

name: Hospedaje Granada
description: Cheap and quiet hotel per hours (15 dollars from 20-7am) near to the buses and they let us let them our backpacks for one night while we went to juayúa and ruta de las flores, so it was useful to stay there and the rooms were ok, with fan and bathroom

name: parqueo Santa clara
description:
small hotel/restaurant/bar
with a humongous parking lot fit for any type of rig. 
a few semi trucks parked 
has showers and bathrooms 
5 minutes from the border 
really nice hosts
2 dollars a night for a van 
the bar has a few electric outlets

name: Altea Hostel
description:
This place has recently updated to become a Hostel. The rooms are clean and it is in a great central location.
Usable kitchen. rooms with private or shared bathrooms.
Secured parking perfect for motorcycle or bicycle travellers.
We paid $15 a night, however I  think the rooms are normally $25.
Highly recommend.

name: Comedor
description: Great little comedor attached to the large truck park. Good typical food and friendly staff, plus it's open longer hours than the restaurants right by the border which close at 1pm! Plenty of room to park any type of vehicle. free WiFi.

name: Hotel & Restaurant Aspen
description:
A friendly hotel with lots of secure parking, large comfortable rooms and a nice pool. $28 for a double room with private bathroom & AC. rooms also have hammocks inside! All clean & tidy. 

Bringing our bicycles into the room wasn't a problem - loads of space.

The restaurant is also good but not the cheapest. we paid $7 each for dinner + a drink. I think breakfasts are $4 each.

name: Restaurante Torola
description: Nice restaurant, large selection (typical, Chinese, American...), reasonable prices ($3-5) and open 0700-2000 every day of the week. friendly staff.

name: Restaurante El Corralito
description: Nice little restaurant with a big selection and OK prices. lots of shady seating and friendly staff. frozen drinks & licuados etc.

name: Hostal California
description: Basic hotel with kitchen, $35/night for a matrimonial room with AC and private bathroom. ok if you have no other options! very central, just off town square. No reception and no staff present after checking us in.

name: Ramon’s House
description:
A beautiful house with family ambience it’s your luck if you can stay here.
You can ask for Raul on the church and talk t him to see if you can stay in the place.
Feel like family.

name: Arcatao Central Park
description:
Beautiful center of the small town.
Fresh wheat her rounded by mountains.

name: Lava Premium
description:
Self service laundromat with women working there to help with any questions. Super friendly. We brought our dog inside and one of the ladies kept giving him snacks. 

If coming from the west, there is a parking lot just after the laundromat on the left. Not big rig friendly because of tight turns but no height restriction. 

Prices:
Little washer: $3
Larger washer: $4.75
Dryer: $1 per 8 minutes

They also sell little plastic baggies of detergent: $0.25/bag (she recommended 3 for a large load, probably okay with 2 but our clothes reeked so we went with 3). Update: they weren’t totally clean. Buy your own detergent.

And the fragrant dryer sheets costs $0.25 for 2. 

There’s a Super Select supermarket in the parking lot if you want to buy a bottle of detergent there. 

No need to have change, they will give you quarters if you pay with larger bills. 

Note: they close for a lunch break from 12:30-1:30.

There is a bathroom with toilet paper, no wifi.

name: Papuseria
description:
Just next to the little tienda is a papusaria that sells a variety of papusas for $0.75/each. They have many vegan and vegetarian options. They also accept bitcoin.

The girls working are super nice and the place is simple, rustic, and welcoming. 

Awesome place for dinner when staying at Hammock Plantation!

name: Around the lake
description:
This lake is favorite spot for locals, many bars and restaurants and narrow road almost all around. It's possible to go down there from the main road after Puerta La Laguna to the left side, then it's better to turn right if you want more private quite spot for overnight parking (still narrow road but it's possible to park there !but! much of trash on the ground) or go right and park right in front of the restaurant El Faro which is quite clean but louder and not that private (wifi password at our time was Faro2023) and after this restaurants the road is going up again to get to the main road or continue to find even more local small restaurants.
It's also possible to swim in the lake, but we didn't.
We felt really safe and people all around were really nice.

name: do not cycle
description: We highly recommend against cycling this section southbound. very busy, large trucks, lots of fumes & smoke, little to no shoulder, long slow uphill.

name: Parking Lot
description:
Private secure parking lot. Very friendly woman who lives here.
$1 for one hour. You can negotiate for more time and maybe the night.
Entrance is the big green gate.

name: Pente viejo little parking
description:
Little free parking of the puente Viejo Agua caliente ! 
Drive on a dirt road to go there, no need 4WD. Not super flat but it does the trick for one or two nights. Okay for camper van but I think it's too tricky for bigger rig. A little bit of shade under the trees.
Locals come here in the afternoon to relax by the hot water river but nobody at night. Cell signal ok. Very quiet.

name: Pupuseria Raquelita
description:
Very very very good and fat pupusas!
Probably the best one in town right now.

name: Pupuseria Rossy
description:
Stopped here to grab something to eat after crossing the border.

They have pre-cooked food (cantine style). Busy with locals during lunch time. Very tasty food and fast service. 

Pupusas are available only in the afternoon, not for lunch!

name: Paid parking
description:
Good option if the other larger and modern parking lot is full.

$1/hour.

name: Tropigas
description:
Propane refill station near a busy road. Take the side road to get closer or stop near the bus stop and take the stairs.

Knock hard on the big door until someone opens. Ask for a refill. 

Had to wait outside for about 30 minutes. Chatted with the nice security guard at the door.

Staff is friendly and honest.

Paid less than $2 for a 5 pounder (2.5kg).

name: Water tap at Puma
description:
Regular puma gas station with a water tap with excellent pressure near the sign post. 

We filter this water before using/drinking.

name: Bourbon Hostal Parking
description:
Large gravel parking lot close to city center. 

$2 for 2 hours. Can't pay just for one hour.

name: Hotel El Fuente
description:
Decent hotel with spacious rooms, aircon and warm showers. Enough electrical sockets in the room. Decent WIFI.

Cheapest room was 30 dollars. A bit expensive for my budget, but I didn’t check the prices of others hotels. 

Friendly lady that runs it.

Parking place on the premises. I could easily git 2 bicycles in the room.

name: RodMar Hotel
description:
Large clean rooms with TV, AC and private bathroom. New construction. No hot water. Free breakfast. Gated parking. Close to the beach with an excellent point break.
The facility has a swimming pool and decent restaurant. The staff are friendly. The manager, William, is wonderful.

name: Puma - ULSD
description:
Puma gas station with ULSD (ION Diesel) at the self-service pumps.

You fill-up first and pay at the small booth near the full-service pumps (not inside the store).

Free toilets inside the store.

name: Bicycle mechanic: La Casa del Ciclista
description:
Good bicycle shop with sufficient quality spareparts and skilled mechanics. The manager is very kind and helpful.

This bikeshop went to another level of service to correct and repair what another bicycle mechanic (another town) had terribly failed. They charged me a very low price for this service.

I really recommend this bicycle shop!

name: Hotel Mado
description: They tried to rob us here! We wanted to camp at their parking lot but left immediately after this attempt. Don’t stay here it’s dangerous!

name: La Casona
description:
No frills place right near the highway. Typical food and very reasonable prices.

You can also order pupusas for lunch. They are very cheap and good.

Clean toilets and friendly staff.

name: Historical downtown
description:
This is the old city center of El Salvador. Currently, there is a lot of construction work happening and it is not a pleasant place. Only a few buildings are renovated and in good shape. 

Probably in a year or so, this place will be a truly old city center worth visiting.

name: Tienda Karlita
description:
A small grocery store that has a bit of everything, including fresh eggs.

Unfortunately, it is very hard to find a good variety of fresh veggies in this village. It is best if you do your shopping before coming to this area.

name: Water at Puma
description:
City water tap where you can connect your own hose at Puma right near the store (see the sign Agua/Aire). Very good water pressure.

We filter this water before drinking.

name: Pupusas 100% Olocuilta
description: We saw that this place had a bit of locals eating. Tried pupusas and a few others things but the food was average. So it's not a place worth visiting.

name: Rancho de Abuelo
description: 15 min. drive into El Salvador. You have this restaurant in a beautiful setting. Great tasty Pupusas. Great parking outside tge restaurant  where you could park and campout at night in a van or RTT

name: Brisas de Sanra Monica Restaurant
description:
We spent a very quiet night here, it is on a dead end street next to the lake and it is free. 
We arrived at night and the restaurant security told us that it was a very safe and quiet place. 
The weather is quite good, at night it is perfect. Ideal to spend the night before or after crossing the border.
4g Claro Signal

name: La Chosa Papusaloca
description: Best Papusa in the area. The local guy told me. Parking is available outside by the street. Ate at the restaurant at Laguna El Piso otherwise would have eaten here.

name: Malacatiupan Falls parking lot
description: I came here to see the falls during the day. Beautiful falls. Very secure parking lot. Army is on the outside guarding the lot. The fall entry fee is $2 and day parking is $1. They also allow camping at night. it's $5/person. Nice big parking lot. There is Lso a good but expensive restaurant  on site. Main entes are $10 range.

name: Montana y Cielo
description: Restaurant  with great vista. Food was okay but the views from upper story were out of this planet

name: Day and night parking.
description:
I parked here for the afternoon. It's  $2/day. They also allow overnight. It's  $10. No Banos or water. I thought it was expensive.  

Couple of spots (Juayua hotel and Grassy Lot) listed here are okay so I will park for the night there. I parked at the grassy lot identified  here.

name: Colorful town with good street food
description: Beautiful town with great street food and pupusas that are the signature dish of El Salvador also a beautiful town square that is well maintain and clean.

name: Rinconpizza Restaurante
description: this place it have a very  view and good food, very good climate, also you can rent a place for camping for $25

name: Street Parking Nahuizalco
description: I wanted to park by the Parque at the already identified places but due to long weekend and festival there was absolutely no place to park. Lot of locals were enjoying the food and enjoying the festival. The parking attendants guided me here. I even left the car and enjoyed the town in the evening. Nice and quiet night. The street is quite sloping.

name: Street Parking
description: The archeological site was really busy. I could not find a parking on front. They recommended I park along this street. people said it was safe

name: Miranda Restaurant
description: Restaurant with great views. Food was good but expensive. You are paying for ambiance. Good service. No wifi though. Claro signal is weak.

name: Bike Rental and Tours
description:
Great mountain bike rental and tour. The owner brothers Aurelio and Flaviano are great hosts and will love to rent you bike and take you to different tours around the country. they're based in a beautiful Parque El Espino, which has great trails and walking path.
They can arrange for bike tour, walking tours in San Salvador and kayaks trips. Really great guys.

name: El Boquerón National  Park turn
description:
if you use Boquerón NP coordinates, it takes you to someone residence. The drive has a gate. It's a dead-end street. I put in this spot marker so you can use the right turn to get to NP.  up the road, there will be a dog right turn where dirt road takes to the left. please do not use that. just stay on the asphalt road, and it will end at NP. 
Around the NP, there will be a guy with a traffic vest waving you to park the car by the road. He charges $2 for street parking. just ignore him and head to the NP parking lot. They charge $1.

name: Alaska Snacks
description: Tasty ice cream here. 100％ natural ingredients! The owner Alex is a super nice guy and is willing to help people in every way. He speaks excellent English too.

name: Parque Central de Cinquera
description:
If you are traveling by bicycle or foot, you can camp for free at the Parque Central. It has a roof and some outlets to charge batteries.
I asked the policia and they said it is ok to pitch my tent and sleep there. The hostel in town charged $25 for one person / night which was a bit expensive for me. The other camping option, Parque Ecológico Bosque de Cinquera, will charge you $5-6. There was a review saying you could possibly go in after the staff leave at 4pm, but it's a small town and people would probably notice... it's better not to sneak in and try to free camp there. It's safe and quiet at the parque.

name: Centro de Desarollo social Turistica
description: This is the tourist office where you get the ticket and arrange for the guide. I am a solo traveler  so they said if you can wait for a group, it will cost you $7 to go with a guide. if you want to go Solo it costs $20. For two people it cost $10 each. You can park on the street. The police is very helpful and watches the car. I waited inside air conditioned waiting are for some group to arrive. photo attached.

name: Rancho Vilmita
description: If you need a local experience,  this is the place. You can park your car under the shelter. He started with $20 and negotiate it down to $5.  All the locals stay here. He has rooms. I would not stay there.

name: Rio Caliente
description: Spot at the confluence of 2 rivers of hot water, one is around 37 ° C and the other at 45 ° C. It is possible to swim and be massaged by a waterfall. It is an exceptional place, we spent 2 very quiet nights there. The night is cool and there are not too many insects, it is very relaxing. Some very nice local people come to enjoy the place (in the evening) and farmers come to harvest corn in the surrounding fields. Only downside there is a lot of waste. To access this place you have to take a small track (muddy after a good rain), there are also some low branches (max 2.5m). Random Internet access with Tigo.

name: James’s Place!
description:
A lake house where you can stay with all the amenities you need.
Water, electricity, bathrooms and shower.
Has a lake access and a dock where you can stay.
You can previously contact: enriquegti@yahoo.com

name: Banco Hipotecario
description: No fees for withdrawing money.  Limit of US$1000 per day.

name: Best pupusas
description: Best pupusas in town both corn and rice flour vegan and meat options I had to come back the next day to try more. Also they have a viewing area of the lagoon I was really impressed.

name: Lempa Turismo
description: Lempa Turismo Camping. 5 dollars includes wood and spot to camp. not suitable for big rigs. we made it with our Promaster but the road is tight.

name: Pupuseria Jenny
description: Inside the market place there is an alley with 3 pupuserias, we chose the Jenny pupuseria.  The pupusas are excellent and really cheap.  We paid US$5.45 for 12 cheese pupusas/chicken/red bean cheese.

name: Path to access the Lago de Coatepeque
description: Maps.me will suggest you take this path to access the Lago de Coatepeque. It is indeed a shortcut of about thirty km if you wish to access the south of the lake. Be careful, however, the path requires a high clearance 4x4 (we did it with a Defender). It's very rocky and it rocks!  But when driving very slowly it goes away.

name: Centro Arte Para La Paz
description:
Beautiful art center that is also a Hostel and an overland/RV parking spot.  They have single rooms that rent for $15/ night. Banos and duchas are accessible to both the overlanders and the hostel users. For overlanders, they have  electric hookups. They also can do a laundry load for you for $5 (drying $5 extra) or you can hand laundry wash for free. 
You can get free music, dance, judo, painting.... lessons at this great facility. I love the place. Great food restaurant on site. 
If arriving after late hours, please contact Maira Castro whatsapp +503 2335 1080.
The main entrance door gets locked at night. please call maintenance guy Alcides at +503 64460185 to open door for you.

name: Centro Arte Para La Paz (peace center)
description:
Beautiful art center that is also a Hostel and an overland/RV parking spot.  They have single rooms that rent for $15/ night. Banos and duchas are accessible to both the overlanders and the hostel users. For overlanders, they have  electric hookup also available. They also can do a laundry load for you for $5 (drying $5 extra) or you can hand laundry wash yourself free. 
You can get free music, dance, judo, painting.... lessons at this great facility. I love the place. Great food restaurant on site. 
If arriving after late hours please contact Maira Castro whatsapp +503 2335 1080.
The main entrance door gets locked at night. please call maintenance guy  Alcides at +503 64460185 to open the door for you

name: parking garage historic  center
description: Great place to park and see historic  center. it's  underground  parking. I believe  vehicles upto 8' can get in there. secure lot

name: papusa y Panes Rellenos
description: Based on local recommendations we came here for the dinner. This is where locals eat. Cheap and tasty. you will not be disappointed

name: Mirador a la Cruces Parking
description:
This is the parking lot to park your car if you need to see the Mirador
 To get here you need to pay $1 to park your car
 5 min walk to Mirador from here

name: El Braswro de Ataco
description: Great restaurant with great food. Main dishes are around $12/entry but the ambiance is great. Great place to get American experience.

name: Punta de Amapala
description: We stopped here only for launch, but it seems for us a nice place to camp. It is at the end of a dirt road close to the sea. It is not possible to swim here since there are a lot of rocks but the view is really nice. The only downside is that there is a lot of trash.

name: Mirador El Matazone
description: little Lookout over the Valley, good for one night. Locals use this spot as well, but quite during the night. Relatively clean. Enough space for three cars or a big Rig. Not too much Moskitos. Claro works fine, Movistar not so good

name: Papuseria  Marthita
description: Great Papusa's where all the locals eat. parking lot across the restaurant. one last Papusa on the way to Honduras. enjoy, while they last. 2 papusa n coke for $2.05.

name: Atm
description: atm to withdraw money. Parking right across.

name: Texaco gas station
description: Very big gas station with a full restaurant. We spent the night while deciding what to do. We pump gas and ask if we can stay for the night and they told us no problem.

name: Camping Eco Parque Berlin
description:
Beautiful Eco Park with full amenities for camping. it is $4 pp, it Includes access to bathrooms (nicest bathrooms I have used so far in El Salvador) cold shower, fast wifi, tables and chairs to camp in a grassy area, possibility to camp in a covered area. There is an attached restaurant and they sell coffee and honey from the associated Finca. We cooked for ourselves and they had no problem. We are bike tourers and the staff were extremely friendly and curious about our trip. 

They offer tours of the Finca, activities and games like zorb ball, a giant swing, tours of a nearby cave and the possibility to go camp at the Finca as well. They have only been open a year. 

There is plenty of room for vans and it is a secured area with a night guard. Great option to camp in Berlin where the hotels and hostels are a bit pricey and not many options to camp or park a vehicle for the night.

name: Parque Ecológico el Espino
description: Public park, it is safe, free and quiet... there is water, the bathrooms are in poor condition... municipal police come to watch every hour... some families pass by at night but far from where we stayed... going down at the end of the parking lot there is a street that reaches the main road towards the Chinese border.

name: La fuente restaurante, café
description:
This place opens at 6am and offers breakfast, lunch and típicos which is traditional Salvadoran afternoon food food such as pupusas, tamales, atoles, fried cassava, and other yummy baked treats. Típicos starts at 3pm and goes til 7pm.

I love their atol de elote (hot corn drink) and their fried cassava.

name: Namaste Rawat Restaurant
description: Small family run Indian place. Husband is from India, Wife from El Salvador. Delicious food! Small place. Check google for hours but they are open most days. Dinner time gets packed! Vegan options

name: Service station
description:
We spent a night here without a problem, all the employees were very friendly. We crossed the border at night to enter El Salvador and rested here to continue our route.

Pasamos una noche acá sin problema, todos los empleados muy amables. hicimos frontera de noche para entrar a el salvador y descansamos acá para seguir ruta.

name: Quiet street
description: We spent several nights here. Quiet and safe neighborhood. People are very nice. Pretty flat. There’s water in the park (Redondel Del Palmar). Quiet during week and animated during weekend but nice. Supermarket close by and restaurants.

name: Delicious ice cream (vegan options). El sin Rival
description:
Small shop with lots of artesanal ice cream/gelato. They have all seasonal fruits and water based options. It’s delicious. They only take cash. Two little tables to sit inside but you can take it to go and walk to the big park across the street. Very nice ladies running the shop! Their coconut flavor is really good. They also have mango and jocote and other yummy flavors 

They have a bathroom you can use.

name: El Ancla
description: It's a hostal with a restaurant and a swimming pool at the beach. The bartender is reeaally friendly and helpful! You can camp freely and use their bathroom and shower. We consume some beer and other in exchange.

name: Rancho Danny
description:
Good and free parking place. At Rancho Danny there is everything, they charge $4 per person to spend the day or if you eat lunch it is free, you have WiFi, a pool, access to the beach, showers and some incredibly good Pupusas in the afternoon. Elías is a charmer and the treatment received by all the workers is spectacular. recommended 100%
Lugar de estacionamiento bueno y gratis. En Rancho Danny hay de todo, cobran 4$ por persona para pasar el día o si consumes el almuerzo es gratis, disponte de WiFi, piscina, acceso a la playa, duchas y unas Pupusas a la tarde increíblemente buenas. Elías es un encanto y el trato recibido por todos los trabajadores es espectacular. recomendado 100%

name: TURTLE SANCTUARY // Vivero de Tortugas Marinas
description: Hostal El Ancla. Turtle sanctuary where you can release the turtles in the ocean (depend of the season). They take care of the turtle eggs and protect them from the black market to let the baby turtles free to the ocean. During the weekend you can adopt a turtle and release it to the ocean for 5$ donation. Also nice restaurant with fair prices next to the beach. Has awesome swimmingpool to spend the day. Friendly staff. They have 6 rooms with private bathroom. Probably you can ask to sleep in the parking lot (space for a few vans, don't know the height of the entrance), toilets and shower available. They also help cyclists for free!!

name: Ex Teleferico Station
description:
Ex cable car/ German fun park abandoned place// Finca san Antonio Amatepec
The gate is from the St Marco sustainable coffee house (honk & wait front of the gate- they see you on camera) - camping 5$ and you can explore the whole hill and drive up/around with 4x4 and high clearance. 
If you find the top of the mountain (exactly on this coordinates) > you will get the once-in-a-lifetime view of the city and surroundings!
..and an abandoned city up there- with creepy stuff. Enjoy!

name: Alex Mechanic Shop
description:
electrical mechanic shop Alex, travelers welcome, wifi
---
 Taller eléctrico Mecánico Alex, se reciben viajeros, wifi

name: Miradores del Pacifico
description:
Family owned 600 Manzana fruit/coffee farm with 9 platform (on every sea lvl) around the whole area to camp > > With a magnificent view in every direction and pay 10 pp for clean shower and toilet (ofc on all Camp site with solar lights too!)
Well maintained- they have horses, deers and coyotes - in the kiosk you can buy self produced orange juice!
( available: Paintball, air bikes, quad and 800 m altitude zipline too) crazy
It is behind the gate of Montaña - say so that you are going to Miradores: On the entrance gate is a phone number (+503 7220-0545)  to call/write for „let in“
Robert- the owners son- speaks well English 
What an amazing experience! At sunset they drove us around to check up all the platforms & shades of the coming night

name: Mountain Paradise
description:
Nice 4 acres Finca with room for vans / tents and 2 bungalows, surrounded by plants of bananas, cafe, cacao, platano avocados, lemons, oranges. They also farm tilapia fish.
Each bungalow has private bathrooms while for the camping space they offer the bathrooms and are in process to build also showers very soon. Hook up available with a small surcharge.
Nice kitchen available for all guests
No Wi-Fi  but there is a good signal. 

Contact Mr Rene Aparicio +503 7894626

name: Shortcut to the Volcano
description:
This road is in better shape// goes directly to the Miradores so you are not paying 2x for the entrances - only once for the camping at Miradores del Pacifico (made a new entry on this map).
No 4x4 necessary - only bring your driving skills (and maybe not more 2,50 cm high)

For „let in“ text Roberto at the green gate 6200-8163 or +503 7220-0545

name: Crater Hoyon
description:
Spectacular vulcano crater in the forest. During the rainy season there is bubbling water while in the dry season it is bubbling mud. 
Steam all time.
Get yourself a guide because the trail is not indicated and also not well maintained. 
We used “Shaman Lenca” +503 7539 1876. Julio, his daughter Cris and their little dog will walk you safely through the forest.
We paid Usd 10 pp.

name: Mostro 4x4
description:
Off-road and overlanding specialist 

The place to be if your rig does „clack clack“ or „thing thing thing“

Very professional and they are well connected if there are some parts to order

name: Llena water system
description: 1.25 to fill the garaffon next to the Despensas right side - automatic

name: Wash Lavandería
description:
opening hours: 
Monday - Saturday 8am - 5pm
Sunday  8am - 3pm

self service laundromat with really nice stuff. We were even allowed to bring our dog. everything is super new and we were suprised but they can wash "hot". what ever this means in Central America ;-) 

cold wash: 3,25$ - 39 min
hot wash: 4,24$
washing liquid: 0,25$
dryer: 3$ - 40 min

name: AB Vet Santa Tecla
description: Super friendly Vet who helped us with our Rabies FAVN test (600$) to get our dog to Europe. Our dog liked Dr. Benitez and her staff straight away, even though she is an easily scared dog. They offer many services and speak good English. We had a really good feeling when we left. If you have any questions you can contact the Vet via WhatsApp +503 7730 9485

name: Via Vela
description: Lots of small fish restaurants. we stayed for one night at the end of the road. police said its safe. lots of locals swimming in the lake all night long, music from the restaurants and fishermen in the morning. so not the quietest place for the night, but definitely beautiful scenery. no mosquitos. Internet was good. also they have toilets 0,25$ and showers 1$ during the day.

name: Aduana Terrestre de San Bartolo - TIP
description:
We got a 180-day Visa for El Salvador, but our TIP is only valid for 60 days, so we came here to extend our TIP.
They are still processing our request, but up to now this was the process:
I had to go to the "Entrada de Correspondencia" which is hidden on the side of the building (see picture) where they wrote a letter to the Director of Aduana in my name, asking for the extension of my TIP. I had to provide a ES telephone number and an email address. 
With this document I went to another person in the same room and they put my request into the system. I received an email, telling me my request is now in the system. 
They told me it would take up to 15 days before I'll hear back from them. If my TIP ends during that time, I will no longer be able to legally drive my car. I have 7 days left on my TIP, let's see what will happen.

name: El Tunco Parking
description:
3$ per night, good location.

We were not able to find a space to park on the tight street of El Tunco. We slept here for a night (quite busy as there is a nightclub in front but it closed at 1:30 when we were there)

name: Gilma House
description:
Gilma is an excellent woman who lives in a beautiful house on a large plot of land full of plantations and flowers and welcomes travelers and also has two cabins that she offers to those who come here.
Provides laundry, Bathrooms, Wi-Fi, water.
It also provides breakfast and lunch.
----------
Gilma es una excelente mujer que vive en una bella casa en un gran terreno lleno de plantaciones y flores y recibe a los viajeros y además tiene dos Cabañas que ofrece a los que llegan aquí
Brinda lavandería Baños wifi agua  
Además brinda desayunos y almuerzos

name: Valentina La Argentina
description: Little shop where you can buy very good price Yerba Mate and other stuff related to Argentina!

name: Uno gas station
description: Several parking lots at UNO gas station. Asked if it is okay to stay for the night. No problem for them, no payment necessary. Toilets open 24h. Security guard 24h. Café with breakfast is part of the station.

name: Beach front
description: beautiful sand beach- some abandoned palapas, lil trash, no shade, no rocks, no folks only awesome sunsets on hard sand to camp. Some cows and mosquitoes are roaming around but no heavy duty. Dirt road to drive/ nothing biggie - easy access. (Claro is spotty). There are many more spots on the beach West from here, all the way to "Corral de Mulas".

name: the small hell
description:
El Infiernillos // volcanic activity on (hot!) surface with a platform to camp - next to the bubbling sulfur field or further away 
Vans better are staying at the village (down the cobblestone road there is two leveled spots too) because of the rock next to the small river xing in the way to get here but you do you
for everybody else is decent uphill no biggie 
You can go further up there are opportunities to camp and explore > we bribed the finca guards to get to the el mirador (for more information get in contact with us) serious overlanding!

name: El Infernillos
description:
Boiling water coming out of the hill - really hot!
You can hear the bubbling underneath the surface.
Beautiful and free. Like a mini Yellowstone NP, but no health and safety. 
------
Access: beware, if using OpenSteetMap data, it will take you the wrong route.

Head to: 13.62696° N, 88.85290° W

From Verapaz, head up the road to the village and turn left at the church, drive down a steep section, small stream to cross, then a sign reading "4x4" only. I would not ride it on an "adventure bike," only a dual-sport motorcycle, or whatever the 4-wheel equivalent is. Honestly, just consider parking in the village and walking 300/400m.

name: La Poza
description: Amazing fresh water pool for a swim. Very friendly locals. Road is unpaved but not in bad shape. 24’ rig no issues. Wouldn’t bring a tow behind though.

name: Squirrel Eye Brewing (SEB)
description:
If you like brewery, this is the place !!! They have THE BEST Hazy beer we got so far in Central America ! Nice owner and nice vibe, I strongly suggest a visit here.

They had a live band when we came on a friday

name: Street Parking
description:
It was very hard to find a place to park in San Salvador and we ended up on this street. We slept here for a night and it was super calm !

When we arrived here, there was a guy that seem to be doing security for a restaurant on the street. He helps us to park and said he will check our car while we go eat. He also said we were ok to sleep here

name: Finca Rauda
description: This place offers also a camping site. it is in a park with many restaurants.  they also have ziplines and a bicicle line. very nice and friendly people.

name: Perkin Lenca
description: Beautiful hotel and restaurant. Great breakfast with cafe. Cabañas for rent too. Really enjoyed our time here. Payment w cash or card

name: DHL Service Point for Drohne Shipping
description:
DHL Service Point in the huge shopping center "Metrocentro Santa Ana", 
perfect place to send the drone to Costa Rica or Panama, 

very friendly man who speaks very good English, 

you need your passport, an address in the country of arrival and an address here in El  Salvador, 

the drone clearly has to be without a battery, 

payment is possible with a credit card, 

easy, quick, uncomplicated, simply perfect,

name: Hotel restaurante isla Icacal
description:
the place is a hotel restaurant, but they have a camping area. It is a very very nice place, the owner is friendly and helpful. They say 10usd at first, but I asked for a discount and I paid only 5usd. The last 3km before arrival are in bad condition but they are fixing the rout.
highly recommend.

name: Oldhippie Glamping
description: it's a nice place with good prices and a nice owner. Beautiful views in a perfect place to stay and explore the area,from here in only 30 min you can go to the Chorreron or to the Olominas. They have cute cottages and camping areas, with access to a full equipe kitchen.

name: Lavanderia
description:
In this street there are couple of it but this one is quite quick (same day) and washes with hot water
1.50 kg is 3$

name: EL BOSQUE
description:
Nice littl place near the road (easy access)! There are some restaurant in “treehouse” kind of structure. You can find lots of different style of food (pizza, mexican food, burgers, etc…) 

1$ to park tour car

We also asked to sleep here for the night and they accept

name: National park Montecristo Trifinio
description:
Entrance to the park. You have to pay an entrance fee per day, camping is included in the fee. Beautiful place, very well maintained. Some short hikes free, hike to Cerro Trifinio permitted only with a guide(cost 2$/p, seems to be everyday 9am). A lot of rangers there, taking care of you and checking all camping places also during night till 12am. They said it's very safe here, we felt very safe too but I think there is some reason for that attention. Also the guide to Cerro is going with a gun. But that is nothing special in Central America. Beautiful park, surprised by climate and cold temperatures and the biodiversity. Recommended. 
Price in November 2023 6$/p a day/night. you must pay every day. Car is 2$ one entrance and doesn't matter how many days. 
Entrance for camping till 2pm, leaving time from the park if you don't spend a night is at 3pm.

name: Carlos A/C
description: Our aircon started to make unusual sound. We stopped here and they helped us immediately. Fixed the problem, explained everything. Even gave us more options for spare parts. Friendly staff, possible to pay with card, clean waiting room with coffee and water and clean toilet. Price seemed reasonable to us.

name: Agua Purificada
description: Machine to fill your water jug at the Maxi Dispensa. 1.50$ for 5gallon (1 garafon)

name: Veterinaria La Casa del Perro
description:
Super nice veterinarian en El Salvador. Located in a richer area, local come here with their pure bread dogs. We came here to spade our rescued dog and they were really supportive and answered to our questions. 

The main veterinarian “Pablo” speaks a little english.

They also do grooming and dog “daycare”

name: Tekapa Hotel
description: wonderful small hotel with safe secure parking for vehicles and motorcycle.  very clean rooms  breakfast included in low price.   We paid $48 for private bath with air conditioning.  very close to park. high speed wifi.

name: Bongo Experience
description:
Keep driving until the end of the new Punta Mango roadworks and we are on the left-hand side of the road opposite Tienda Elizabeth. There is a shed at the entrance to the property and a small lane down to the Bongo Lodge. 
The Bongo Experience is a lodge set within approx 7 acres of beautiful nature, a great place to get away from the crowds and enjoy being amongst the mango and coconut trees, all with access to a semi-private beach that can deliver a great wave for surfing with the right conditions! 
We have perfect pitches for campers, small vans and RVs, with access to our facilities as required, as well as beds in our mixed, shared dorm. The water is drinkable and usable and has been tested but it is not the tastiest so we would recommend bringing your own.
From the Bongo Experience it is approx a 15/20 minute walk to the famous Punta Mango point break or a 15-minute walk to the lesser known Bonjo which is also a great wave, or a few miles drive or bus ride to Las Flores.

name: DHL Express Store
description: Best service. English speaking, you have to show the drone, batterie in drone is ok, buy a parcel at the shop, she helps to pack it, you need ID Card, EMail, Destination Adress with phone number. Pay by card. Value for the tax. Parking big rigs not possible.1kg costs 85US$.

name: Urge Print
description: Perfect copi shop, also USB, at the main road,cheap, fast, easy, 10cent for print out,12cent copi

name: Termales de Alicante
description: Termal spa, open from 8am to 5pm every day. You can find pics and more info about it in closed informal campsite point in ioverlander here. They do not offer camping anymore but termas are open. I couldn't change it from camping into tourist attraction so I made new point.

name: Parqueo y complejo municipal
description: Free municipal parking to spend the night before crossing into Guatemala, during the day there are sports activities.  The police brought us to this place and told us that we could spend the night safely one street from the central park of Metapan.

name: Pacifico Hostel
description:
Not sure about the name, have no sign outside but you can recognize it cause is a pink house with blue doors. Just knock the door the friendly owner welcoming you.
Is the cheapest place in town. Dorm for 7, private for 18.. 
big beds and kitchen. The area is quiet with tiendas e comedor close by. 
Laundry service available for 3 dollars..

name: Fuel station with WiFi
description: A fuel station with WiFi. Possible overnight sleeping, but got to be noisy

name: Casa González
description: Hello travelers, My name is Gilma and if you are looking for a tranquil place to rest and camp for the night, look no further. For just $20 a night you are granted access to my beautiful garden with plenty of space for all of your needs. The grounds offer plenty of room park, a beautiful terrace with a phenomenal view of the mountains as well as access to electrical outlets, wifi, clean water, and a full bathroom with shower and hot water. We offer a washer and dryer for laundry at an additional cost of $5 for unlimited washes (detergent not included). We have partnered with local restaurant to offer a breakfast for delivery at $3.50 per plate, which includes a typical Salvadoran breakfast. Our gate entrance measures roughly 2.8 Meters (9 feet), campers that are 2.6 Meters in height that carry any object on the roof of the vehicle will not fit. We also offer two cabins which you can find on airbnb under Cabaña Gonzalez located in Salcoatitan. If you have any questions please feel free to give me a call at +503 7741 4670, or you are welcome to come by and ring the bell as well.

name: ATM Banco Hipotecario
description: Three ATMs here, the one in the middle (Banco Hipotecario) didn’t charge any withdrawal fees.

name: Hostel “en el tunco mi otra casa”
description:
On the main road, really close to main center, close to comedores .
Dorm for $15. Camp $6 in the parking inside it.
Quiet and safe place. Not crowded Hostel. For $6 you have also access to kitchen, pool, bathroom, shower, hammocks, Wi-Fi..

name: FREE beach camping
description:
We looked at Rancho Alicia but there was a lot of trees which wasn’t the best for our solar panels and starlink so we simply parked on the beach parking for FREE! 

We’ve been here 1 week and no one cared about it. We went to the restaurants few evening, food was good, okay price. 

Park as far of the beach as possible as the tide rise a lot

name: Banco Atlántida
description: No fee to withdraw money on this bank but only VISA customer parking is free

name: Hospital veterinario Chivo Pets
description:
We are Argentinians and we obtained the health certificate here to travel with our dog to Guatemala. First you have to register in the chivo pets system with your passport and other information. If it doesn't work, call 195 to schedule an appointment. You require a cell phone chip from El Savado.
 Each practice has a symbolic value of 25 cents if you pay with a virtual wallet-bitcoins. In our case it didn't work so we asked a person to pay for us and we gave him the cash. At the consultation they performed a routine blood test and complete check-up. We apply vaccines and dewormer, plus the health certificate for $2.25


Somos argentinos e hicimos aquí el certificado de salud para viajar con nuestra perra a Guatemala.
Primero tienes que registrarte en el sistema de chivo pets con tu pasaporte y otros datos, si no funciona llamas al 195 para agendar una cita. Requeris un chip de celular de el Savador
Cada práctica tiene un valor simbólico de 25 centavos de dolar si pagas con billetera virtual-bitcoins. En nuestro caso no funcionó entonces le pedimos a una persona que pague por nosotros y le dimos el efectivo.
En la consulta realizaron un análisis de sangre de rutina y revisión completa. Aplicamos vacunas y desparasitante, mas el certificado de salud por 2.25 dólares

name: friendly private parking
description:
This small village is a must stop! The  central Plaza is full of people during weekend with live music. We came on Saturday and had a really nice local experience, with nice market, street food and music. 
The guard of this private parking lot let us stay overnight with the van for 5$. Save and quiet after 10pm.

name: Street parking in front of City Hall
description: Given our size we were not able to pass through to the parking lots at the Malecon. Given that it was Christmas Day they were full anyway. We parked along the main road leading towards the park and walked around to fin a suitable sport. One of the towns "vigilantes" helped us and at the end pointed to this spot in front of the city hall. He said it it would be o.k. - because of the Holidays the city hall was closed until the new year. It might not be allowed to overnight park here at other times. It was relatively quiet at night, but busses started to drive by at around 5:30am.

name: Jiquilisco Bahia de las estrellas lenkas (Tour operator)
description:
We spend a wonderful day with Arnold on his boat touring the bay. He is very personable and excited to share his knowledge about the area. Our tour started at 8am and we returned at around 4pm. The cost for the trip (for up to 8 people) was $130.
Arnold can be reached via WhatsApp at +50377777768.

name: Restaurante Altamar
description: Friends of ours had stayed here before so we decided to check it out as well. We had no trouble getting there. No arch or cables obstructing access to the large parking lot. The people where friendly and welcoming - no charges for overnight stay. We did drink and eat in the restaurant though. They have a pool - we didn't try it - and some bucket showers. Basic, but fine. Access to the beach - not sure if swimming is o.k. - many fisherman and seabirds. We had a maintenance day and prepping for boarder crossing, so it was fine for our needs. Very quiet at night.

name: Lago de Güija petroglyphs
description: I couldn't drive as far as this as the lake level was still high after the rainy season, and I only came to check it out rather than to spend the night. But a food vendor mentioned there were petroglyphs here so I walked round to explore - there sure are! Some easier to spot than others - some have been chalked to make them stand out more, others you have to search harder for - lots of them though! This is about the furthest lot I found, walking anticlockwise, but there are plenty more before this, and quite possibly lots I didn't find - once you start seeing them they're everywhere!

name: Hike to San Miguel volcano (without a guide)
description:
Here you can start the hike to the San Miguel volcano. In my humble opinion there is no guide necessary, given that you bring the necessary fitness (know that there is around 1200 m to ascend and descend with partly slippery terrain).

The trail to the top is very easy to follow once you found the start of the trail (for that see the picture and my description attached). The trail on maps.me is very accurate beside the entry point and the first 500m. 

The beginning of the trail goes through what is currently a construction site (they are developing a whole neighbourhood on the side of the volcano), so this is kind of a private/restricted property. To avoid any discussion if crossing that area is allowed or not, I started my hike before 6:00 am (so none of the workers was there yet) and just bypassed the gate (I met them on my way down, I greeted friendly and noone seemed to care). The first third of the trail follows a dirt road (again see map.me or Google satellite), that's very easy to follow.
On the second part of the trail, you will hike a narrow path. Dont worry, you cant loose the trail, there is only a single path and even marks on trees or rocks (long trousers recommended to not scratch your legs).
Eventually you will reach the last part of the trail which goes through volcanic ash and rocks (here hiking sticks are a great help). If you are in a group I recommend to stay close to each other (or at least dont hike above each other) as there is a lot of loose rocks that you might trigger. When you enter the crater just memorize where you entered, then leave the same way. 

Here some more info:
- we found a nice and quiet place to sleep in our camper in las placitas, only a few minutes from the entry gate. That way it's easy to start the hike early
- as you start the hike at 900m altitude it is not very hot + if you go early morning you will be on the shadow side of the volcano. No need to carry 5 liters of water..
- a guide costs around 60$ and can be found in las placitas quite easily (every man is basically a guide...)
- check the wheater conditions before the hike. When I was there the top got very cloudy at around 9am and only cleared up in the afternoon. You might want to avoid hiking through thick clouds with reduced visibility
- I would guess the hike takes around 3,5 h up and 2h down for average hikers. However, a fast hiker could do it in 2,5h up and 1h down.

name: Rancho Punta tremedio los cobano
description: Safe place to spend a night in front of ocean. friendly owner. very basic campground, but maybe a good solution for a night or two. they asked 15$ for a van.

name: Maury‘s Bike
description: Bike shop repairs bicycles and sells parts. There are several other bicycle shops to the left and to the right as well

name: Lava Premium
description: Self-service laundry; I filled a small machine plus one go round the drier and it came to a reasonable $6.25 - would have been in and put in under an hour if I hadn't taken my folding clothes and sorting out the van a bit. Detergent etc for sale cheaply. Room for several vehicles in their parking area off the street.

name: Bicimanis
description: Bicycles, parts, clothing, repairs and Shimano service center.

name: El Árbol de Dips gallery, workshop and shop
description: Gallery of the artist Fernando Llort - lovely staff, including his son, are very happy to give you a tour of the workshop and gallery, where you can also buy any number of souvenirs featuring his artwork. I challenge you to spend some time in there and come out feeling sad; it's beautiful and vibrant! And the painters were fascinated to hear about the whole overloading thing; they wanted photos and to come out and see my 'desmadre' of a van (that was my description rather than theirs!). Free entry.

name: Parqueo y Guías Turísticos
description: Came later into town on a Saturday (festivities) and could not fit my truck camper in the places that previously saw on iOverlander. Found this parking lot on Google maps and  they (tourist guides) let me parked there for $5/night. No amenities. It is very convenient for big rigs and it's just 15 minutes walking to the central plaza. They do offer tours to the 7 waterfalls, Rio Monterrey, and Chorros de la Calera.  Ask for Carlos.

name: Beach with a View
description:
clean sandy beach that goes on for a long time. a couple of dogs wander, and a few locals either pass or hang out on the beach (it's massive, so there's lots of room)

can be pretty windy during day and night. 
met a few locals at night, all very friendly. at the main big palapa, there is a van with a BBQ in it. It looks like it could be a small vendor, but we came on a Sunday night. empty.

wouldn't recommend driving far on the sand without 4x4.

there are some solid parts before the beach but just check before driving.

stayed one quiet night

name: Public Parking & Baños
description:
We stayed here one night after crossing the Honduras/El Sal border. Big open parking, nothing pretty but it's got lighting, a security camera and we weren't bothered by anyone (other than noisy chickens in the morning!) A couple of bars nearby but not noisy, we stayed on a Friday night.

We had asked the guys at the Lavacar if it's okay to stay and use baños in the morning, they said no problem, it's safe and they would be there from around 0630 in the morning. 

It's a really cute town with welcoming and friendly people and a big market, heaps of ferreterías and great street food. The road here was excellent from the main highway turn off, looks like it's brand new all the way to Perquin.

name: Public Showers
description: Access to toilets and shower. Pay the little restaurant for paper if you need it.  Park up at the open parking area near the football field.

name: El Changarro
description:
Good bar and simple restaurant serving fresh food. It's roadside but you have a sea view and a good chance to talk to local people and other tourists.
Large beer $2.50
Food from $1.50

name: Cascada la Golondrinera
description:
Impressive waterfall in a narrow canyon. I drove up from Sonsonate and parked outside the gate of the hydroelectric plant in Sisimetepic, where the road ends on Google maps; the staff were friendly and allowed me to access the path through the plant. From there it was about a 30 minute stroll, plus time to chat to people, say hi to the dogs, take photos etc. There's a closer access if driving from Nahuizaco; you can park up at Plaza Los Amates (on Google Maps again). 

From where maps.me no longer has anything marked: turn off the toad down the little path heading southwest at 13.762629, -89.718054. Turn right and follow the path uphill at 13.764338, -89.717896. Left along the tops of the fields at 13.764296, -89.717489, then right down between them at 13.764548, -89.717394. Once you come out at the river follow it upstream till you hit the beginning of the canyon, you'll then be wading in and out of the river till the falls. 

I had it to myself at 3pm on a Friday - apparently it gets quite busy at weekends, and is more so in the mornings. They said it can be dangerous in the rainy season as the river can rise suddenly while it's raining; I imagine the path gets slippery too. it was doable in sandals in January. 

Super friendly people everywhere to ask if you need directions, and I had several offers of guides, I don't think looking for money, they were just kind. Great views from the village and fields too - feels like a little slice of paradise!

name: Large shady parqueo
description: I arrived late after I wasn't able to contact anyone to open the doors for me at El Ancla (also a bit leery of the $10 minimum consumption to stay' sign there. Big space between river and sea, lots of palms for shade. Had a super quiet night (apart from the 6.1 earthquake, always exciting!), and was charged $2 in the morning. Friendly guy who collected it said I could stay till whatever hour - basic toilets and saltwater available in the little building by the road.

name: Despensa Familiar
description: Walmart owned grocery store with a really well priced groceries. The actual local is a block west of this pin.

name: Casa de Don Carlos
description: Hotel with a/c and intermittent hot water. Perfect for a stop on a cycle tour, but there was a locked courtyard with auto parking. Cost on Booking.com was $42 for the night, which still seems cheaper than other hotel reports in the area. Had to call the owner on WhatsApp to be let in (hotel and courtyard are behind green, unmarked door next to tv repair shop)

name: Final lane in the village
description: I tried the 'public access beach road' marked and got bogged down in the sand immediately. A local guy suggested this spot instead - I spent one night at the other end of the lane next to the beach, nice for the sound of the waves but it's the main access to the restaurants etc down the beach so was relatively busy, plus was in the sun early in the morning. This side was far quieter and pleasantly shaded till gone midday. Just tucked in under a tree at the end of the road, probably not space for bigger rigs.

name: Access Road - Beach
description:
Plenty of space to park here - no shade and dusty but it's free, much quieter than the side of the street in the town, and near the waves. Plenty of space for big rigs and tents; hard-packed sand so no risk of getting bogged down. Saw a couple of vans parked here when I arrived. 

No facilities, but you could possibly use the toilets in the hotel next door, in the block facing their pool.

name: Puma Gas Station
description:
Puma gas station open 24/7 with security guard. Perfect spot for one night after or befire the border.

There is also toilet and showers. Not the cleanest but did the job. There is also a place to fill water (not potable).

name: Rancho Aroma Del Mar
description: Nice little hostel owned by by an American and an El Salvadoran/American citizen. Great amenities: wifi, kitchen, bathrooms, showers, AC in bedrooms, several lounging pools, outdoor movie screen, outdoor bar, hammocks, fresh mangos off the trees. Large gate that owners keep locked with secure parking inside for several smaller cars/SUVs (not big rig friendly inside gate). Local caretaker lives there full-time with family and he is a great resource. A short walk from a popular surf spot. Contact aromadelmar@mail.com

name: Centro recreativo
description:
Government-run complex with pools, including a 25m one, and cabins. There are toilets and indoor and outdoor showers. Pools cost $3 to use, parking is $1. Overnight in a cabin is $15 I believe, not sure if that's per person but I think per cabin. That gets you use of facilities from 8am till 3pm the following day. 

Asked about spending the night in a vehicle, they said no problem and no extra charge; hammocks are welcome too. Gates are locked at 4pm but the security guard said they'd open up for you to come and go till 10pm if they know you're staying there. Friendly staff.

Hours 8am till 4pm Weds-Sun, pools and beach access close at 3pm. Alcohol not permitted (at least by the pools, not sure about in the cabins).

name: Potable water
description:
Another set of drinking water taps - love this town for this! 'Regalo de Dios' from the natural springs around the town - free water for everybody. Magic.

Plenty of space to pull over on a road that had almost no traffic when I was there on a Sunday afternoon. Fill ya boots! (And tanks/bottles/whatever.)

name: Parque San Rafael
description: Town square is full of iguanas and terrapins/tortoises! There's a guard who's more than happy to point all the iguanas out to you. Lots of nice murals dotted around too; worth a quick stop if passing through.

name: Hotel Brolyn
description: Fairly shabby hotel but does the job. I don't think it's an auto hotel but I'm not sure. They quoted me a price for the night rather than per hour. Double rooms with a fan from $8.50

name: Damangohaus Hostel
description: You can park your van here for $5. Includes bathroom, water, and use of the facilities. $30 for a room with a/c.

name: botanical garden
description: nice botanical garden to spend a bit of time. 1,75$ entry per adult

name: 4 inch PVC With drinkable water.
description: On the side on the road there is a 4 inch PVC pipe with non stop flow. Confirmed by locals it’s drinkable. A man helped me fill my containers.

name: Parqueo El Amatillo
description:
Huge parking lot mainly for trucks. You can park at the more quiet end of the lot, so you are about 100 m away from the main street.
2 USD per vehicle.
24 h security.

name: 360 Views sunrise and set, penon de comasagua
description:
STUNNING 360 VIEWS, so far my favorite camp in the entire country. Sunrise and sunset are just jaw dropping. Camped night — not a single person or tour bus. Will go back and camp again

High winds are rare but certainly possible.

When I arrived to camp at the cafe (also marked on iOverlander) the gate was locked with no one around so I asked a man walking if I could drive closer to Peñon de Comasagua he said yes the dirt road is the way

Turn down the dirt road (shown on the photo) roughly 100 meters then you go down the hill to a gate at the end — under a mango tree with lock

A man is usually sitting there during business hours — it is $3 to hike or $5 USD per night of camping (solo traveler so I believe it’s 5 per person) 

Anyways, you drive up to the right then left, go straight for the big parking lot to camp. 

The dirt road has many deep ruts, clearance and 4Lo recommended. 

When the path splits to go straight (camping spot) or to the right you can drive around, down, up, around then again down to the stairs that will take you to the very top of Peñon de Comasagua. Maybe 5 minutes up. 

The walk up is NOT for bad knees the stairs are steeeeeep and tall.

Dog friendly — trash bins in the parking lot. 

Enjoy

Water tap in the lot of Don Juan grocery store (lots of great option and fresh foods) Sundays there is a great market one block away
