name: Eramon Paradise 360⁰
description:
I am really surprised this place hasn't appeared here previously. It's a mountaintop with a killer view, magical sunrises and sunsets, and various sleeping options. 

To access it you need to go through Nombre de Dios, and then it's about a 45-minute drive up to the tiny village of Las Aradas (appears on Google Maps but not Maps.me), and a little further to the trailhead, then ditch your vehicle and hike. I went during the dry season and initially they said it would be accessible by 4x4 only, then took a look at my RWD Chevy Astro and said it might pass - there were a couple of patches of road with soft sand where I fishtailed a little, but made it ok - saw a couple of bikers ahead of me struggle to maintain control, but they made it too. Not sure how it would be during the rainy season. Also not sure where anything bigger than a small van would park - maybe in Las Aradas and hike up from there, you could ask in Nombre de Dios. The other option is to take a transport from town; $20 each way - ask at the Commercial Liliana on the plaza, a couple of doors down from the Neveria.

From the end of the road it's about an hour's fairly steep hike to the top - most is very exposed and it gets very hot even quite early on, so be prepared if you come during thr day. Horses available at Las Aradas for those who would prefer one. There's an obvious fork in the path towards the top - right takes you to the marked point, Eramon Paradise 360⁰, and left to Camping Eramon. They're only about a 10 minute walk apart - there's another path that connects them over the top too. 

Eramon Paradise is fancy - various options for camping and glamping, cabins, different miradors, one of those scary swing things (similar to Hobbitanango, outside of Antigua Guatemala, for those who've been there). There's also a restaurant for pupusas ($1 each), soft drinks, bottled water and more, and toilet block, I think a shower too, though it didn't look as though there was any running water while I was there. They charge $5 to enter, and I think $7.50 to camp, with various equipment available to hire - I believe tents were $8.

Camping Eramon is a much more basic setup and still under construction, but usable. I slung my hammock up inside an adobe hut to get out of the breeze; they charged me $5. Tents and mattresses usually available to rent too. Less likely to find food there though - I went and ate some pupusas at the other place after sunset (they didn't charge me to enter - though wanted to the following morning when we went to ask about breakfast, and $5 for breakfast), and then hiked over to this one for the night. Got chilly overnight!

A fair few resident dogs, all friendly, though one looked more than a little battle-scarred. No signs saying pets not allowed that I saw.

From Camping Eramon there's a hike to a further, lower hill that gives you a great open view over the beautiful meandering river system and surrounding mountains - it took a good 20 or 25 minutes, much longer than I expected! But well worth it for the sunrise views.

In summary - not the easiest place to get to, but the view justifies the effort! A few photos added to give an idea of the views.

name: Mercado Cuscatlan
description:
Parking of Mercado Cuscatlan. Should be open from 6am to 2am (next day). Not clear if overnight parking is accepted.
Free of charge and some security guards on duty.

name: Motel Económico
description:
We found this very simple and clean motel with $8 rooms for the night.
Entrance at 6PM and exit at 7AM.
It was the best price we could find.

Parking is secured by a gate and that was the reason we chose this.

Ever received us with the Salvadorian kindness, talked to us about the recent changes in El Salvador and gave us recommendations for siteseeing.

We had a private bathroom with cold water and great pressure. 

This is a very simple motel but it is clean, very safe and you can't beat this price.

Our dog was welcomed to sleep on the floor in our room.

name: Los Encinos
description:
A place that has cabanas and a parking space. We were allowed to stay with our campervan, for 6USD per night.
Good starting point to hike to El Pital

name: GreenFields
description:
- Getting there: Google Maps directions were correct so just follow those.

- Bathroom & Shower: There are separate men's and women's bathrooms that were nice and clean. There is currently no shower but they're working on adding one.

- Other things to note: The owners are a kind couple who are building this up for camping and eventually a couple of cabins. They can help you find a guide for hiking the volcano or you can walk to the gate outside of Casa de Cristal and join a tour. We were here on a Sunday night and were the only ones here. We had full bars of LTE with Claro SIMs and got 45mbps download and 11mbps upload speeds.

name: PUMA, not uno.
description: The shell fuel station does not exist. Please delete. Could not take a photo, sorry. Traveling south I stopped at Uno but they wanted money even with a fill up, food, and beer. I left, came across Puma, no longer a Shell. I gave them an ultimatum, said that if I filled up, I stay for free, if not I get $10 of gas( I was low) and move on. I stayed for free. The security guard later came over and gave me a tour of the baños and duchas for free. You can stay for free, you just have to make it so. A big place good for big rigs, small rigs. There is flat grass here to the north of the parking, lots of grass, I don't see a problem with tents. No other facilities.

name: Eddie - Best Mechanic
description:
I know… this place is already marked as a campsite, but maybe even more than that, Eddie is a fantastic mechanic! And a very very nice guy!

Since Colombia we had a queeeeek sound while driving and many mechanics already tried to get rid of it!  Eddie now finally fixed it for us - what a relief… No ,quiiieeeeeck‘ anymore! On top of that he fixed our air condition and helped us fixing our broken water tap. Everything for a fair price. 

He really can help with nearly everything and if not himself, he knows someone who can! 

So give this man your business! Highly recommended. 

Just contact him a little in advance: WhatsApp number: +503 7506 8896

He speaks perfectly english and german … and spanish of course.

name: hairdressing school
description: Hairdressing, barber and aesthetics school which offers free services supervised by competent teachers. For men and women. Mo - Sa 8:10 am to 4 pm (except we only the morning). Free!

name: Cascada de Don Juan
description: Lovely waterfall. Parking is on east side of road with a 5 minute easy walk to waterfall.  $3pp entry fee payable at parking lot.

name: Centro de Amigos del Turista
description: Tourist info centre.  Very helpful.  One person spoke English.  They photocopied documents for free for our next two border crossings.  Air conditioned so a great place to cool off.

name: Hostal Juarez Ataco
description:
Very nice and quiet family run motel with secure parking.
Super friendly people!
Comfortable clean rooms with the best showers in Latin America.
Each room has a small balcony with table and chairs. Besides that there is a small garden with chairs and tables.
$35 per night for double room (without AC) including a good breakfast.
They have rooms in different seizes with and without AC.
Laundry services - $6 for a machine of clothes.

name: Street Parking
description:
Since there is no better place in town, this is where we slept.
If you park right next to the lantern, your car is well lit.
But just drive around and look for any street-parking spot, there is no Parqueo/ Estacionamiento and hotel Elena will not let you use their parking (unless you pay for a room 50$)

name: Hostal Tía Reyna
description: Nice AirBnB with a garden and a pool. Clean bathrooms and kitchen. We asked spontaneously and they let us stay there in our tent for 5$ pp including all the facilities and drinking water.

name: Camping at mirador (cyclists)
description: 360 view mirador with roof and a cement platform. Good to shelter from the sun or rain, good lunch spot (view is incredible) or camping spot. Some trash around :(, but easy access from the road - little to no traffic. I’d wait to set up camp until it’s a bit dark. Bring water and food, nothing around. We loved the view

name: Sugarloaf Surf Lodge
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Situated right on the beach and offers ample space for tents, vehicles, private rooms for rent, or dorm beds. Everyone has use of the wi-fi, kitchen, bathrooms and showers, beach access, and lounge areas.

name: Mexican restaurant
description:
Very good food. Cheap too, with parking 
Burrito with coke, 5$

name: Finca recreativa Santa Adeleida
description:
Here we could park ( big rig)and stayed a few days next to 7 Cascadas, very save and quiet, right now it s just a huge grassy spot , shade under big trees, without facilities, but fresh water , good claro signal. Mathias , the owner ,gonna built a restaurant, camping , cabañas . He showed us his finca and we are invited to his restaurant ( same name)
Very kind- we recommend 
Pl cantact Mathias , maybe the property is looked !

+503 7641 9634

name: Finca Recreativa Santa Adelaida
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Site added by owner. Please update after checking in.
Santa Adelaida Recreational Estate is located in the Apaneca Ilamatepec Mountain Range. Specifically in San José La Majada, Juayúa, sonsonate. Located at 1,100 meters above sea level, which helps us with a delicious climate surrounded by nature. You can search for us on Google Maps as "Santa Adelaida recreational farm" We have the following services Restaurant: Delicious country food, meats, chicken soup, barbecues for 3 or 6 people, as well as typical snacks. The restaurant has an extension of 2.5 blocks so you can enjoy with family and friends. Farm: You can appreciate different species of farm animals, which are free and you can interact with them and you can feed them. Nursery: Ornamental and aromatic plants at affordable prices Camping area: You can camp at our facilities for a price of $17 per person with dinner included (camping tent not included) Hikes: You can purchase our hiking packages for $25 per person with $10 for restaurant expenses. Horseback riding:  You can purchase a horseback ride at our facilities for a price of $3.00 You can make your reservations and live a different experience. We will wait for you!

name: elite automotriz
description:
super equipped workshop that supports travelers since they are also travelers, complete confidence and has everything necessary to treat any type of vehicle whether diesel or gasoline, large space and fits any vehicle up to 4 meters high

taller super equipado que apoya a los viajetos ya que también son viajeros, total confianza y tiene todo lo necesario para tratar cualquier tipo de vehículo ya sea diesel o gasolina, amplio lugar y cabe cualqueir vehiculo hasta 4 mts de alto

name: Perfect spot for a break on SAN93S
description:
If you’re in for a challenge, you can drive the SAN93S road from north to south. 4x4 definitely needed, as well as low tire pressure and high clearance. 

This spot is perfect for a lunch/coffee break, with amazing view of Lago Coatepeque.

name: E Challenger
description:
They Can provide fast and reliable solutions to electric, and mechanic issues even at your place.
they fixed our electrical problem on my RV in an hour and came back at my place the day after to do another work.
prices honest and fair

name: Parking right after the border
description: Small but allows you to eat with lots of small restaurants and rest before hitting the road again

name: European groceries
description:
Superselectos Supermarket: A big supermarket with lots of imported goods such as cheese, sausages from Germany, a great variety of of fruits, vegan milk, and “European” baguette etc.

Parking just in front, rather small
Parking spaces but we managed with a Mercedes sprinter.

name: Food Garage
description:
This is a space that supports the traveler and the artisan, it is a restaurant with a cafeteria that allows you to work and sell your crafts and take advantage of the weekends when a market is set up right in front

este es un espacio que apoya al viajero y al artesano, es un restaurante con cafeteria que te permite trabajar y vender tus artesanias y aprovechar los fines de semana que se pone mercadito justo enfrente

name: Ricks Hostel
description: Good place if you are travelling on a motorbike. No camper parking available. It is a large hostel in downtown Santa Ana. Rick is a biker himself. Rents out bikes and if you arrive here on a motorbike you can get it off the road and into his large courtyard. He also has an area where you can do oil changes and general maintenance on your bike. Very very helpful. I did an oil change here and I wasn't even staying at the hostel and he didn't charge me anything for the space. Super helpful and location is a few blocks from the main square.  He also has a campsite near Juayua 1 hour from Santa Ana on a farm so van people can park there. Speaks Spanish and fluent English

name: locked yellow gate
description:
There is a locked yellow gate. pretty much impossible to pass without key. bicycle or walk possible heavy vehicles not. There are a few of these gates around 
probably to stop people cross. it's a beautiful area

name: Hostel Surf Camp Aloja
description:
Super nice place, managed by Victor and his family right in front of the beach (you can see the waves from bed!). They have kitchen, good bathroom and shower and cozy common areas. The accomodation places are much cheaper than the rest of the offers in the area. Furthermore they have a lot of boards to rent for a good price.

For some other questions ask Victor; +503 7921 8685

name: DLC Gas Station
description: Gas station with security overnight. There is no need to fill up your tank. The security guard comes in the evening and takes your name. Costs $3 for secure parking. The night was relatively quiet for a gas station. Good for a night after crossing the border.

name: Bonito Mirador
description:
Beautiful place to stop and maybe spend the night. Very clean, 2km from Sacacoyo. Quiet and crowded with local people.
---
hermoso lugar para parar y quizás pasar la noche. muy limpio, a 2km de Sacacoyo. Silencioso y concurrido por gente local.

name: El Zonte Coworking
description: Coworking space with mostly reliable Wi-Fi and air conditioning. Other amenities around. Good spot if you need to hunker down and get stuff done. https://hopehouseelsalvador.org/co-working/

name: Hostal Casa Luna
description:
we stayed in this place for two nights. we reserved through Booking, the price is really cheap, we paid around $22 for two for two nights. The rooms are private, there is a shared kitchen, very basic. and a couple of tables where you can eat, the bathrooms and showers are shared. in Booking it says that you have a private bathroom and kitchen but that's not true. The place is a bit noisy because the walls are thin but for the price we paid I would say it was excellent. if you have a car you can park it in the internal courtyard and the gate is locked at night. The parking is not for giants truck.
nearby you can find local food, supermarket etc.. we ate at Pupuseria Rosita which is truly spectacular. 4 pupusas two beers $5.85.

one more thing, in the rooms during the day it is very hot but during the night it is possible to sleep. don't expect luxury, the rooms are basic and the lady who runs the place is friendly, the place seemed safe both for us and for the car.

name: volcano with THE view
description:
beautiful three leveled camping spot with 4x4 filter >>> non stop wind around so camp is better behind the trees on the left side of the dry crater 
But there is opportunity to drive straight up to the small volcano or to the right, to the steep black slope (on the top is the exact marked coordinates from this entry )
View of the two biggest volcanos, calm nights and lots of wood for fire awaits you

name: Parque National Los Volcanes
description:
after a nice 4x4 climb you can reach this NP with „primal forest vibes“ 
The hike to the St Ana is shorter and negotiable for the price and conditions… ;)
Cool temperature on leveled spots with all the „lil bit dirty“ pleasantries 5pp 
Update: we did the hike without guidance without extra money 
The trail is super easy to follow and waaay shorter

name: Rancho La Periquera Camping
description: This is the best place to van or tent camp while surfing or visiting Punta Mango. Carmelo’s beach-front location is directly on the long, sandy, beautiful beach attached to the short and rocky beach of Punta Mango. He owns a few large palapas with hammocks, tables, chairs, outdoor showers, and a flushing toilet. A 2-minute walk down the beach is an empty sandy lot he is developing with a friend for camping. Currently you drive onto the beach and then into his lot. You can also use his facilities and hangout spot. However, they are in the process of building a road directly onto the lot to cut out the beach drive. The current road onto the beach is definitely 4x4 required. Getting down was pretty easy, but we needed 4x4 and airing down our tires to get back up in our Sprinter van. You can’t drive the beach at high tide. It was $5 USD/night per person. The pin is marking where our van was parked. To get there, drive down the “Punta Mango Access Road” that has the Punta Mango Hotel and Restaurant at the end. The lot will be on your right before you reach the hotel. It might have a gate, so text Carmelo on WhatsApp to let him know you are coming! +503 6860 3836. This will likely become unnecessary when the road is finished being built. We checked out Cielo y Mar (another iOverlander location nearby), but it was more of a dusty parking lot on the rocky beach (with less nice facilities). We much preferred the beautiful beach set-up. See photos.

name: on the sumpul river
description:
Los Amates// on the main road is a not marked turn ( 14°01'42.91"N 88°48'39.25"W opposite the red tienda)
to the river on the dirt road btw to houses this is a direct route to the steel gate with „bienvenidos Rio Sumpul“ - somebody is in the hammock to let you in
balneario with nice half shady spot with breeze to chill/ overnight - shower & toilet semi clean but the river is not deep at all to bath
we were alone on a monday
around 3$ pp but I think it is negotiable 
4wd is not necessary

name: Uno Servicie Station
description: We spent a night here after crossing the border. They allowed us to spend the night but security charged us 5 USD a night. We wanted to negotiate, but we were unsuccessful! It was already late so we decided to stay! Bathrooms are available. Security 24/7. Safe and quite noisy!

name: lugar seguro para pasar la noche
description:
This is located on the street 1 block from the church of Alpaneca. On the corner there is a craftsman's workshop, the local man allowed us to spend the night here. Very quiet place and the center with its beautiful square.

Este esta ubicado en la calle a 1 cuadra de la iglesia de Alpaneca. En la esquina hay un taller de artesanos, el señor del lugar nos permitió pasar aquí la noche. Lugar muy tranquilo y el centro con su plaza muy bello.

name: Wifi - conectandoelsalvador
description: Open Free wifi. Fast. #conectandoElSalvador. In front of the main square.

name: gasolinera Texaco
description:
It has a small parking lot for a pickup camper.  Manuel the security guard did not allow us to spend the night.  There is a bathroom.  Safe place.
--
Tiene un parqueo pequeño para camper tipo pickup. Manuel el guardia de seguridad no permitió pasar la noche. Hay baño. Lugar seguro.

name: Main Street
description: You can park on the right side of the main street leading to the beach. Pretty calm, safe according to police, free and some hours of solar. If you need WiFi, shower or toilet get some food/drink at the Esencia Nativa Hotel.

name: Genesaret Hostel
description:
Contact: +503 6420 1349 +503 7549 0302
Rooms with prívate restrooms, fan and bath accesories. You are allow to cook in our kitchen. Wifi. Parking lot and video camaras 24/7.
Special prices for backpackers.

name: ATM
description:
Closest ATM to El Cuco. Right on the park. (It appears that the pin dropped across the street from the actual location, where I stopped to take and add a photo. The ATM is in the front wall of the municipal building, which has a small police station on its left side).
The town is pretty flat, and the streets immediately around the park don't have any low cables. I was fine at 3.2m. I parked at the curb without issue.

name: El Ancla - Hotel and Free Camping
description:
A small and quiet hotel located on the beach. We paid $25 USD for a room with a private bathroom. Rooms are basic but clean with AC. The grounds have a restaurant which is great (try the seafood paella if you’re hungry), lots of hammocks, a well maintained pool, and direct access to the beach. The owners are friendly too. They have two small chihuahuas that don’t bother you.

The hotel service/restaurant is opened until 5:00pm, so you will have to go elsewhere for dinner or have some snacks on hand.

They also offer tent camping under a large palapa area (usually used for dining if no one is camping) for FREE. They just ask that you buy some food or beer at the restaurant. There are showers and well maintained bathrooms for campers, and obviously access for the grounds. 

There is secure parking. There’s enough space for big rigs. Not sure about big rig camping as we only asked for ourselves.

This is a very quiet place. The beach is nice but the waves are very choppy, so best to use caution when swimming.

name: Free WiFi in Parque
description: Free WiFi with no password. Pretty fast too

name: La Casona SV
description: A very nice hostel with 2 swimming pools, lots of hammocks & resting place. Private room is $40. Ready made tent is $12 (there are 4 tents available). The place is clean. Receptionist speaks good English. Free coffee & tea & drinking water available 24hrs. Its 3 mins walk to the beach which is not so nice (rocky) but good for surfing . At the beach u can find lots of rancho serving affordable seafood meals.

name: Pupuseria Ale
description:
Cheap pupusería "Ale"
Very tasty pupusas from 35 cents, they make them in front of you. A lot of diferent flavors!

name: Motel Presidencial
description: Along this street there are many live hotels. It looks like a lot of them are pretty much the same. This one was $14 for a full night. Check out at 8 am. AC, WiFi, private bathroom, etc. Also, a private garage, perfect for securing a bicycle. As a love motel, it also has a lot of quirks, like random pieces of sex furniture and a mirror by the bed, but it seems clean, and the price was right for me.

name: Pupusa Place around the Corner
description:
Amazing pupusas, $0.50 each, probably the best we’ve had in El Salvador so far. Two flavors: mixed (bean, cheese, chicken) and just bean + cheese. 

Highly recommend, very close to hostal. 

Opens at 5pm

name: "CASACA" cheapest & nice hostel
description:
$15 pp/night $20 for 2 people p night (May 2024)
Wifi, hot shower, shared kitchen, brand new mattreses, everything super clean. It's a large house with bedrooms and a little garden working as a hostel, the owner is Antonio, he always makes sure that everything is perfect & he also makes delicious typical food for a good price. His phone number for booking with him is +503 6197 9727
2 lovely rescued dogs in the house too. 
Quiet street for parking right at the door's hostel.

name: Cascada el Chorreron
description:
Great bathing spot with a Waterfall, grass beach area and clean toilets. 
Entrance fee is $2 pp and you need to hike 5 min to get there. 
Absolutely worth the drive !!!

On the road there I came across a gate where they wanted to look in my bag (close to the border) but let me pass with no problems.

name: Piedras blancas
description: on the road to Miradores del Pacifico, we couldn't go further with our 30 feet rig. We could sleep here, people is very friendly, it's very calm and we could have a cooler night.

name: Tickets for Tamanique waterfalls
description: This is where you get tickets for the Tamanique waterfalls. It costs 7 dollars per person with a guide included. Since it has recently been mandatory to go with a guide, there is no way to negotiate. Are nice, recomended!

name: Water tap - Texaco Station
description: Water tap at texaco station. It is located between the plants, in the background. We asked security before use and he very kindly said yes. It has good pressure, it is not drinkable!

name: Free Wifi - Apaneca
description: Free wifi in the central park of Apaneca. Speed ​​30Mbps. Quiet and very nice place! Wifi DOM is the name.

name: Axul Café and Artesanías
description: Lovely shop with locally-made crafts. Several large looms with artisans weaving. Also has a cafe with excellent coffee and desserts and good-looking vegetarian options.

name: Estacionamiento plaza la libertad
description:
Translation: Parking with a high height limit (more than 3 meters) in the center of San Salvador. Perfect to see the tourist places. $1 per hour/fraction. It's 24 hours so maybe you can stay overnight, we didn't ask. Perfect for large vehicles. Are there bathrooms.

Estacionamiento con límite de altura alto (más de 3 metros) en el centro de San Salvador. Perfecto para ver los lugares turísticos. 1$ la hora/fracción. Es 24 horas así que tal vez se pueda pasar la noche, no preguntamos . Perfecto para vehículos grandes. Hay baños.

name: DON'T PARK HERE IN RAINY SEASON
description:
DON'T PARK HERE IN RAINY SEASON 
quiet and leveled street with shadow, good place to park and sleep. BUT it's dangerous in rainy season (may-nov) : We were sleeping in our van and a storm started, after 15 minuts of heavy rain, this street was like a river, it was very scary, the current was strong and the water level was over the sidewalk. We jumped to the driver sit, started the van and left right away, and took the road up, everything was fine on that street and we spent the night there. I think in dry season wouldn't be a problem staying here. 
~ 
Calle tranquila y nivelada, con sombra, buen lugar p parquear y dormir. PERO es peligroso en época lluviosa (mayo-nov): estábamos durmiendo en la van y comenzó una tormenta, después de 15 minutos de fuerte lluvia, esta calle parecía un RIO, fue horrible, la corriente era fuerte y el nivel del agua llegaba hasta la vereda. Saltamos a la cabina, arrancamos y nos fuimos enseguida, tomamos la calle que va en subida y estaba todo bien en la calle de arriba así q pasamos la noche ahí. Creo q en temporada seca no habría problema de dormir acá.

name: Finca Rauda
description: We didnt camp here but saw on our way out of town that it is $6 to camp here. Would consider for next time.

name: Suma Camp
description: Small campsite available for a small fee, we were planning to stay the afternoon but after meeting suma and facundo we decided to stay two nights. The camping is right next to a restaurant with really nice food for cheap. We ended up doing a tour with facundo and he also cooked up some fish on the campfire for us. Probably the highlight of our trip so far.
